loans.name: Galo Enrique

texts.es:
Galo es una persona responsable con su familia y con su trabajo tiene 41 años es soltero no tiene hijos

El se dedica a la agricultura y a la cianza de animales y ganado el dinero lo va a utlizar en la compra de mas ganado para tener mayores ingresos.

El sueño de galo es terner salud para realizar mejor el trabajo. En los tiemposa libres le gusta hacer deporte con los jovenes del sector.
texts.en:
Galo is 41 years old and single with no children. He is very responsible about his job and his family

He earns a living through agriculture, and breeding animals and cattle. He will use the loan to buy more cattle to improve his income.

Galo's dream is to be healthy to do his job better. In his free time he likes playing sport with local young people.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Liridon

texts.en: Liridon is from the southern part of Kosovo. He is 31 years old and single. For a long time, he has been the main source of income for his family. He has been earning a living by cutting wood to sell to others, to use for heating. Many people have spent the summer in Kosovo and have already started to purchase wood. This has enabled Liridon to sell his wood at a higher price, due to the increased demand for it, helping him to gain more financially. However, because he has so many more customers, his wood cutting machine has been used much more and is now broken. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new wood cutting machine. His goal is to be able to expand his business and continue to grow. He appreciates the support from the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new wood cutting machine.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 31 years old, married and had two children. She is raising hogs and selling them upon achieving the desired weight.

Marvin would like to improve the growth and nutrition of her hogs but has insufficient funds to sustain them; that is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed for the sustenance of her hogs.

She will save additional revenue for school fees and daily meals.

loans.use: to buy feed for sustenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Nlr Group

texts.en:
Nina is the featured borrower of the NLR group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon with a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Nina is a 51-year-old married mother of four children. She is working hard in selling clothes to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions in the Philippines; thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of fashionable clothes.

Nina is the second lady on the left.

With respect to the other group members, Venice is the first lady on the left; Lilian is the second lady on the right; and Michelle is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of fashionable clothes.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel pertenece al banco comunal EL ÉXITO, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia sigue con su negocio de negocio de venta de plantas ornamentales, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es unja persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de plantas entre otros.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of EL ÉXITO communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

Isabel continues in her business of selling ornamental plants. She has had this business for quite a while, and does well at it thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She is a responsible person. She wants to be able to continue working, in order to continue supporting her family. She is thankful for the loan, and promises to comply with the required payments. She seeks the loan to buy plants, among other things.

loans.use: to buy plants, among other things.

loans.name: Marijane

texts.en:
Marijane and her husband are engaged in buying and selling animals such as cows, carabao (water buffalo) and pigs. They have been doing this for almost 14 years to earn a living.

Thus, she is asking for a loan to purchase additional animals (mentioned above) to sell.

In the future, Marijane wants to improve their business. She wants to have more livestock to sell.

Additionally, Marijane is from Baybay, Leyte, and is a mother of a 10-year-old son.

loans.use: to buy a cow, a carabao (water buffalo) and pigs.

loans.name: Claudia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Claudia, es una joven de veintiocho años de edad, muy emprendedora y activa, ella posee una pequeña tienda donde oferta sandalias, bisutería, ropa, entre otras cosas. Ella agradece mucho la ayuda de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, porque le han dado la oportunidad de ser una mujer independiente que al igual que su esposo aporta al desarrollo  de su hogar.
Para seguir creciendo Claudia solicita un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, con el cual planea la compra de nuevos estilos de sandalias, zapatos y ropa para niños.  En un futuro desea expandir su negocio, poder invertir en carteras y perfumes. Ella es una mujer decidida a tener un negocio exitoso y nada la va a detener, su principal motor de energía son sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 28 year old young woman who is very entrepreneurial and active. She has a small store where she sells sandals, costume jewelry, clothing, and other items. She is very thankful for the help from Kiva and MiCredito because they have given her the opportunity to be an independent woman, who equally with her husband supports her household.

In order to continue growing her business Claudia seeks a loan from Kiva and MiCredito which she plans to use to buy new styles of sandals, shoes, and clothing for children. In the future she wishes to expand her business, be able to invest in wallets and perfumes. She is a woman very determined to have a successful business and nothing is going to stop her. Her main motivation are her children.

loans.use: to buy new styles of sandals, shoes, and clothing for children.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old, single man who has been working as an electrician since 2013. Working in electricity installation and maintenance is his only source of income, and he is working hard to develop his business to improve his income and living.

Ahmad's business is his only source of income, thus he has to make sure to develop it properly for a better income.

Ahmad is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car necessary for his business development, which he will use to take the long-distance projects that he has to refuse in the meantime because of transportation obstacles.

He hopes that one day he can open his own electricity needs and maintenance factory.

loans.use: to buy a car necessary for his business development, which he will use to take the long-distance projects that he must refuse in the meantime.

loans.name: David Elias

texts.es:
EL socio tine 66 años de edad se dedica a la cria de animales y a la agricultura de platano, yuca con el credito obtenido David mejorara su plantacion incrementado una nueva variedad de producto como las almendras para esto debe comprar semilla abonos y fertilizantes.

El sueño de David es el de llegar a tener una estabilidad económica para incrementar sus ingresos.
En los tiempos libres  David le gusta leer y descansar.
texts.en:
David is 66 years old and he raises animals and grows banana and yucca. With the loan David will improve his plantation expanding a new variety of product such as almonds so he should buy seeds, manure, and fertilizers.

David dreams of having economic stability in order to increase his income.

In his free time David likes to read and relax.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, and fertilizers.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a married man with children. He is a teacher by profession, and he also owns rentals to supplement his income. Through this, he is able to cater for his family's needs.

William's desire is paying school fees for his children up to university. This time he lacks enough money to complete his children's school fees due to delayed salary payments.

He requests money to top up his salary and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Bozoroy

texts.ru: Бозорой родилась и выросла в районе Темурмалик. Она очень миролюбивая и хозяйственная женщина. Ей 46 лет, она замужем и мать двоих детей. Её муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию на заработки. Сама Бозорой занимается животноводством. В этом деле ей помогают ее сыновья. Так как жизнь в сельской местности сложна, Бозорой решила закупить несколько голов крупного скота для последующей продажи. Бозорой обратилась за кредитом в надежде, что ее просьба не останется не замеченной.
texts.en: Bozoroy was born and raised in the Temurmalik region. She is a very peace-loving and hospitable woman. She is 46 and married and the mother of two children. Her husband has gone to Russia to work, and she works in animal husbandry with the help of her sons. Since life in a rural area isn't easy, Bozoroy has decided to buy a few head of cattle for further resale. She is looking for a loan in the hope that her request will not go unanswered.

loans.use: to buy a few head of cattle for further resale

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 26-year-old single man, who has been providing transportation services since 2011. Husein was traveling abroad, when he decided to come back and stay near his parents. He is a hard-working man, who puts much effort into developing his family's living, and his own at the same time.

Husein is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. He will use the loan to make necessary maintenance and body work for his van, to keep it in good shape so he can continue providing his transportation services. He might also use part of the loan to support his parents' business, a grocery store, which he intends to develop and expand for a better income.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance and body work for his van, to keep it in good shape and continue providing his transportation services.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 15 Novembre 2006 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe. Elles  vivent dans le même quartier depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Madame Fatou, (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson frais.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter la caisse de 35 kg de poisson à 50000f pour le revendre en détails et payer un transport de 12000f

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’une part améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en renforçant et les charges scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on 15th November 2006 at the same time as its inauguration. There is a good relationship between the group members. They have all lived in the same district for several decades and benefit from solidarity and cooperation within the group. Their main activity is running small trading activities.

Fatou (who is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and mother to three children, and she sells fresh fish. With her new loan she is planning to buy a 35 kilo case of fish for 50,000 francs to resell on a retail basis and also to pay 12,000 francs for transport.

The profits she makes will enable her to improve her family's living conditions on the one hand and also to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a 35 kilo crate of fish for 50,000 francs to retail and to pay 12,000 francs for transport.

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine.

Basel is a 30-year-old man from Rafah City. He is married and is a father to 3 sons and a 1 little daughter.

Basel was living with his family in a small, humble house, but during the latest conflict in Gaza, his house was destroyed completely. He had to then rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently Basel took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild his old house. The loan will allow Basel to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return his family to their normal life.

Basel appears in the photo above. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to rebuild his old house.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De La Zona D Group

texts.es: LACEY  de 30 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “mujeres emprendedoras de la zona d” la cual lo conforman 05 socias que trabajan honradamente para mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella hace más de 3 años que se dedica al negocio de venta de cosméticos por catálogo el cual le va bien. Gracias a su constante dedicación logro sacar adelante a  su familia. Su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio .solicito el crédito para la compra de más cosméticos como perfumes colonias rubor y talcos. La Alcancía “mujeres emprendedoras de la zona d” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Lacey es la primera del lado derecho viste chompa color marron.
texts.en: Lacey, 30 years old, is partnered and has 2 dependent children. She belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Zona D" which is made up of 5 members who work honestly to improve their quality of life. For more than 3 years she has worked at her business selling cosmetics from catalogs, which is going well for her. Thanks to her constant dedication, she managed to get her family ahead. Her greatest desire is to be able to expand her business. She asked for the loan to purchase more cosmetics such as perfumes, colognes, blush, and talcum poweders. The Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Zona D communal bank is grateful to the Kiva investors for the offered support. Lacey is the first on the right, wearing a brown sweater.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics such as perfumes, colognes, blush and talcum powder.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 58 years old. He is married and has three children. His businesses are motorcycle taxi and farming. He has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of forty-two thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is his seventh loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for the farming business.

He will use the profits to expand his business as well as servicing the loan. His hopes and dreams are to be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farming business.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a married woman who has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 30 years old, and her three children are in school.

Marife has a business, buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, like shorts, underwear, etcetera. She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Marife would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shorts, underwear, etcetera.

loans.name: Martha Yadira

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de cuarenta y ocho años de edad, muy sencilla y trabajadora, está casada y tiene una hija. Trabaja para un empresa privada en el área administrativa, paralelo a esto, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos, perfumes y artículos de belleza, los cuales oferta a sus compañeras de trabajo, vecinas y amistades. 
Dado que le va muy bien en este negocio, ella decidido apostar a más, por eso ha tocado las puertas de Kiva y MiCrédito, esperando se le beneficie con un préstamo que le brinde la oportunidad de comprar variedad de perfumes para damas y caballeros, dado que este producto es muy solicitado por sus clientes. En un futuro le gustaría dedicarse a solo esto, es decir abrir un tienda en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Martha is 48 years old, and a very down to earth, hardworking woman. She is married and has a daughter. She works for a private business in administration. In addition, she also has a small business selling cosmetics, perfumes and beauty supplies, which she offers to her co-workers, neighbors and friends.

Because she has done very well in this business, she has decided to increase her stake. For that reason she has come to Kiva and MiCrédito, hoping to obtain a loan that will give her the opportunity to buy a variety of perfumes for men and women, since this product is highly requested by her customers. In the future she would like to work entirely in this field, by opening a store in her home.

loans.use: to buy a variety of perfumes for men and women.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena works at a railway station marketplace in Melitopol. Mostly, she sells household items, men's footwear, and clothing merchandise.

Yelena started this trade 16 years ago. She owns her own vending location at this point. She is married with 2 grown sons.

Yelena is seeking 15,000 UAH to diversify the inventory she offers for sale at her vending kiosk. She is planning to buy a supply of electric devices, household items, and assorted men's footwear to sell retail.

In the nearest future Yelena is planning to both continue growing her business and finish construction work on her private house which always requires additional financial inflow.

loans.use: to diversify the inventory she offers for sale at her vending kiosk.

loans.name: Wadad

texts.en:
Wadad is a 44-year-old married mother of four children. For five years, she has been working in a mouneh, or preserves, business which she runs from her house to support her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs.

Wadad is a hard-working woman, and puts forth so much effort to expand and develop her business to make sure she increases her income. Yet, Wadad's and her husband's combined incomes aren't enough to cover any additional expenses they might face. Their children are their main reason to work hard, therefore Wadad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her daughter's wedding expenses as a gift for a new beginning.

Wadad is planning to start tailoring business in parallel to her current mouneh production and sales business, and will make sure to buy a tailoring machine as soon as possible to start her new business.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's wedding expenses as a gift for a new beginning

loans.name: Ndoumbe's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 15 Novembre 2006 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe. Elles  vivent dans le même quartier depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Madame Ndoumbe,(debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est veuve et mère de 02 enfants. Elle s’active dans l’agriculture de riz dans la vallée. Elle maîtrise bien cette activité.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 12 sacs de semence de 50 kg  à 7000f le sac 24 sac d’engrais à 7000f, payer 03 laboureurs à 45000f et 30 sachets de produits à 1000 l’un pour les besoins de sa récolte et le revendre en fin d’hivernage.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’une part améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en améliorant la nourriture, l’habillement, la santé
texts.en:
This group was created on 15th November 2006 at the same time as its inauguration. There is a good relationship between the group members, who have all lived in the same district for several decades and enjoy solidarity and cooperation among themselves. Their main activity is running small trading businesses.

Ndoumbe (who is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is a widow and mother to two children. She farms rice in the valley and manages her business well. With her new loan she is planning to buy twelve 50 kilo sacks of seeds at 7,000 francs each, 24 sacks of fertilizer at 7,000 francs each, as well as to pay 45,000 francs to three laborers and buy 30 sachets of products at 1,000 francs each for harvesting and reselling her produce at the end of the winter season.

The profits she makes will enable her to improve her family's living conditions, by improving their food, clothing and health.

loans.use: to buy twelve 50 kilo sacks of seeds at 7,000 francs each, 24 sacks of fertilizer at 7,000 francs each, as well as to pay 45,000 francs to three laborers and to buy 30 sachets of products at 1,000 francs each.

loans.name: Asliddin

texts.en: Asliddin is a handsome boy. He was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1997. He is single and lives with parents. He passed the entrance examination at Technical University this year. He is going to study and get his higher education degree. He is an active, gentle, bright and communicable student. He is requesting a loan to pay for his higher education costs. He wishes to graduate with excellence and find a good job. He awaits KIVA lenders kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina operates a beauty parlor. She caters services like hair rebonding, hair trimming, and hair color. She has been operating a beauty parlor for more than 10 years now.

She is married with three kids. Her oldest child is 11, and the youngest is 4.

She decided to take the loan to buy supplies like medicine for hair rebonding, an electric blower and a hair iron. These will enable her to provide quality services to her respective clients. Thus, she could accommodate her clients very well. This enables her to attract more customers to visit and avail themselves of her services as well.

Thus, she could continue support the needs of her growing children and also expand her business to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies  like medicine for hair rebonding, an electric blower and a hair iron.

loans.name: Think Positively - N6T1Đbắcqvinh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lênh is 56 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for seven years.

Lênh lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The income from this business is unstable because when some poultry disease happens, they could die, which leaves her nothing to sell. She will then be in trouble with finances.

The main hardship that Lênh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Lênh joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Lênh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

She is the group leader of "Think Positively - N6T1ĐBắcQVinh," which consists of three members.

Along with her business profit, Lênh hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Hard Working - N05Cthắngnlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiền is 36 years old and she is married with 2 children.
She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years.
Hiền lives in Hau Loc district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

An the income from this business is unstable because the amount of fish they can catch depends on to the weather conditions. And there are many people also selling fishes in this area, so she has to make sure that her fishes are fresh, delicious and have a competitive price.

The main hardship that Hiền faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.
In 2014, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She always repays loan on time.
She is the group leader of the "Hard working - N05CThắngNLộc", which consists of 3 members.
With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL EXITO.
La socia Alejandrina tiene 48 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de ferreteria, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
Las socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the El Exito communal bank.

The borrower, Alejandrina, is 48 years old, has 3 children and is single. The borrower alternates her daily activities with working at her hardware business. The borrower has had her business for a good while, which is going well for her thanks to the dedication that she puts into her business each day. The member wants to be able to continue working and in this way to continue supporting her family.

The borrower asks for the loan to purchase paint and more.

The borrower is grateful for the granted loan.

loans.use: to purchase paint and more.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is from Gavar city, in Gegharkunik region. He is 51 years old, and he is a skilled and experienced farmer. He used to work as an electrician, but farming always has been the main source of income for his family. Now he lives with his single son, who is a very clever and hardworking young man who greatly helps his father.

On his farm Armen has cows, calves and bulls. So his farm products that he sells are milk and beef. Armen greatly wants to start sheep breeding also, but lack of capital is severe. This plan is still a dream for him, since it will be very profitable for his farm. With this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, Armen plans to purchase a lot of fodder for his farm cattle. This will be a great solution for a very urgent problem for any farmer, like Armen.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 53 years old and widowed. She has seven children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She wants to see all her children go to school, and this makes her work hard on her cocoa plantation for eight hours a day. For fourteen years, she has realized that farming is better for her family's standard of living. She also sells fish in markets, for additional income. She dreams of expanding her cocoa-selling to big cocoa agents, though unpredictable weather changes limit her plans. Elizabeth is asking for a loan to pay school fees for her children, ahead of third term.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard is from Vinogradovo. He has already used assistance from Kiva before. Eduard invested the previous loan he received in a purchase of necessary instruments for his jewelry business. The tools that he purchased helped him to accomplish his job, better meeting the demand of his customers and fixing jewelry pieces that needed to be handled extra-delicately.

Now, Eduard needs 40,000 Grivnyas to do remodeling on his house. He is planning to change three interior doors and to remodel two rooms in his house. He wants to install drywall on the ceiling, to plaster and paint walls, to put wallpaper on portions of walls, and to tile the floor in one of the rooms.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and equipment for his work.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and blessed with 5 children who all go to school. She lives in a two-bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, such as the deaths of her parents, son, and brother, as well as sickness.

Margaret was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by her friends and relatives in 1998. She has successfully borrowed and repaid 12 loans.

With this new loan Margaret is going to buy flour, groundnuts, oil, plantain, banana, cocoa, yams, cassava, Irish potatoes, piglets, chicks, feed, and drinks to sell. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has a lot of experience, others have also been succeeding, she will buy quality food stuffs, and she has a good business site.

With this business activity the community will benefit from quality food stuffs, moderate prices, a reduced distance to market, easy breakfasts, and manure for cultivation at a cheap price.

The profits from this loan will help Margaret pay her children's school fees, provide some basic food for the family, and pay for her family’s medication. She also plans to hold back some of the profits and buy a plot to build a house for her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate, no collateral, finance management training, and convenient terms of repayment.

loans.use: to buy flour, groundnuts, oil, plantain, banana, cocoa, yams, cassava, and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase manure, insecticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Claveles Rosadas Group

texts.en:
The Western region of Guatemala is generally quite hot but has enough rainfall that there are lush green forests in the valleys and surrounding mountains with numerous rocky streams flowing down from them with cascading waters. The rural community of Sacapulas is located here and is the home of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Claveles Rosadas” or “Pink Carnations” that was formed by eight enthusiastic hardworking women with dreams of overcoming poverty!

One of the members of “Claveles Rosadas” is 29 year old Candelaria who is working towards a better future. Currently, she is studying to be a nurse and hopes to graduate soon. In order to cover her school expenses and to help her family financially, Candelaria owns a mini-mart. Although the mini-mart is doing well, she needs to increase her inventory of food-stuffs because of new requests from her customers. This is the reason she is asking for a loan so that she can buy eggs, noodles, beans, rice, sugar, oil, juices, etc...everything her customers want. She is very happy that she can get a loan in order to expand her business which then supports her studies. Her parents are too poor to be able to help her with her dreams.

The eight women of “Claveles Rosadas” look forward their monthly meetings when they make payments on their loans. The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, that combines education and small loans provides successful tools for the ladies. They actively participate in training in subjects like women’s rights, women’s and children’s health issues, self-esteem, business management, and leadership. These are a few of the many topics presented by a Facilitator from the organization. Candelaria and her companions recognize the value of these monthly meetings and are deeply grateful to the Kiva investors for providing them with the opportunities to develop their lives, their businesses and their communities. In her words, “God Bless Kiva investors and thank you!”

loans.use: to buy eggs, noodles, beans, rice, sugar, oil, juices, etc...everything for her mini-market.

loans.name: Ponciano Jr.

texts.en:
Ponciano is a 39-year-old man from Baybay, Leyte. He is married and has three children, ages 16, 15 and 10 years. Ponciano and his wife run a sari-sari store, to earn a living. They also engage in raising pigs. Ponciano works hard to provide for the needs of his children.

He is asking to borrow money to buy stock for his grocery store, such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, and napkins. Another part of the loan he is seeking is to buy piglets and feed. In the future, Ponciano wishes to improve his business, for a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy stock for his grocery store (such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil, and napkins), piglets, and pig feed.

loans.name: Marleni Irene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL EXITO.
La socia Marleni Irene tiene 45 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
Las socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the El Exito communal bank.

The borrower, Marleni Irene, is 45 years old, has 2 children and is a widow. The borrower alternates her daily tasks with working at her grocery store business. The borrower has had her business a good while, which is going well for her thanks to the determination that she puts into her business each day. The borrower wants to be able to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family.

The borrower asks for the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and more.

The borrower is grateful for the granted loan.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and more.

loans.name: Cristhian Cohen

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal EL EXITO.
El socio Cristhian  tiene 21 años de edad y es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a ejercer su carrera de electricista, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de herramientas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the El Exito communal bank.

The borrower, Cristhian, is 21 years old, and is single. The borrower alternates his daily tasks with working in his field as an electrician. The borrower has done this work for a good while, which is going well for him, thanks to the determination that he puts each day into his work. The borrower wants to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting his family.

The borrower asked for the loan to purchase tools and more.

The borrower is grateful for the granted loan.

loans.use: to purchase tools and more.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is thankful that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) has partnered with Kiva to help entrepreneurs lacking capital to run the business. She’s grateful that CCT granted his previous loan of P9, 000 and also want to thank lenders for participating in the kiva program. The amount was used to buy additional products for the business.  There’s an increase on her daily sales. However the daily profit is just enough for their day-to-day expenditures. 

Dedication and perseverance are the qualities that she has that’s why the business is growing. However, she aims to have an array of products to offer to clients. That’s why she decided to apply for another loan of P12, 000 since she wants to have products on stock such as bottled drinks and grocery items to add on her variety store business.

On a weekly basis, Daisy regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more products and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is aged 59. She is a widow from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite. She has four children, three of whom have their own families already, and her youngest is still in the elementary level in school.

Being a widow has been her biggest challenge in life but with her faith and perseverance she came out of it victorious. Her small general store has been her source of income for 10 years already, which has helped her raise her children all by herself.

She trusts she can take a PHP 15,000 loan to buy and refill her store with essential food items such as canned goods, instant noodles, bread, biscuits, chips, eggs, cooking oil, and beverages to sell.

Although at one point she almost lost her business due to bad debts of some customers, she did not lose heart, and thankfully, with her regular fellowship and study of God's word with co-members lead by CCT's Covenant Community Builder, she was strengthened and she persevered.

Fe believes and dreams for her business to fully recover and grow into a bigger store. She hopes that one day she can relax and enjoy her grandchildren.

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 53 years old. He is married and has five children.

His business is farming. He has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of 22,000 Kenya shillings.

This is his fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy animal feed, fertilizer and seeds.

He will use the profits from expanded business to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to have a comfortable life and educate his children to the highest level.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Sathitporn

texts.en:
Sathitporn, pictured here alongside her husband, Paradorn, is an artisan from Thailand who specializes in hand-carved teak relief panels. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood for her designs .Sathitporn has been selling through NOVICA since 2014. This is her story:

"I'm Sathitporn and my husband is Paradorn. We live in Chiang Mai, known for traditional arts, crafts and culture. As a local tourist guide I took visitors to elephant camps and temples, and to see wonderful handcrafts of Chiang Mai: lacquerware, silverware, saa paper, and wood carvings. Demonstration of each craft helped visitors understand local traditions. I became so enamored I decided to rent a small shop to sell local wood carvings. I met my husband here. He was a messenger and when his employer faced economic trouble and closed, he joined me at the shop. By offering unique designs we are better able to ensure high quality products, provide good income for local artisans, and promote the use of sustainable materials. Most of my hand-carved pieces use teak salvaged from unused buildings. Tourism has decreased a lot, but we don't think of closing because we are happy to be a part of the conservation and promotion of Thai crafts."

"This loan will help me buy materials in bulk at a better price. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Sathitporn's hand-carved teak relief panels on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/9325

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood for her designs

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is from village Krtsanisi. She has husband and 2 children and the family has no source of significant income to cover even basic needs of the family. Natela is engaged in cow breeding and her husband has also private activity and earn a small income.

Natela has great desire to make the stable income and open a store locally. She had started repairing the place for the store and now needs financial assistance to finish the activity and also have money for working capitals. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Natela to get a loan of 2000 GEL and start trading business. She thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in great location and the only business of this kind in the area. After the store is opened, the family will have a stable income which enables them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future.

With support of the Start Up program Natela will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle with the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to open a store of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a 41-year-old, married woman. She lives with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Khalida's husband has been driving an auto rickshaw in Lahore for many years, but now his rickshaw’s body and engine are fully damaged. He has sold his rickshaw to a scrap dealer for a very low price. He now wants to buy a new auto rickshaw, but is still short of the full amount.

Khalida's husband is unable to earn even a single penny for his family without a rickshaw. Khalida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. With this loan amount, her husband can easily buy a new rickshaw.

Khalida and her husband thank Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Raj

texts.en: Raj once again thanks all of you for the support and the believe in him. He has repaid his last loan on time and with the profits he could renovate his house. Raj wants now to save for the future and needs a loan of SRD 10.000 which he will invest in the rice production.

loans.use: to purchase diesel, fertilizers and pesticides for his rice cultivation.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo has lived with his family in Xochimilco for all his life. He started working right after highschool. He was able to start his own business recently by buying over 11 sewing machines and doing detail work, like buttons and straight hems, for nearby factories. With the money he had been saving for almost 10 years he was able to build his house. He is proud about what he has accomplished.

He is now just waiting to instal the roof so he can move in. He doesn´t want to wait to have all the money saved again since that will take time and the unfinished construction might be damaged. He is asking for this credit so he can install the roof and move in as soon as possible. He is excited to live by himself and hopefully soon start his own family. Leonardo will receive technical supervision from certified technicians who will ensure that the construction meets safety standards.

loans.use: to build a roof over his longtime dream, his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Setia Tani Group

texts.en:
Abdul, 37 years old, is an aspiring leader of Setia Tani Group. In the profile photo there is Suripno, Abdul’s close friend who has agreed to be photographed for Kiva. He wears the batik shirt and blue cap, in the first row. He is shown along with the rest of the group members. They are standing in front of a cow house. Abdul has a family with two children and lives in a tiny village in Lampung Tengah, Indonesia. 

Abdul has been running a small-scale rice farming business and keeps a few cows to fatten and resell. His business is going quite well. However, he was concerned to see the high price of non-renewable cooking gas and chemical fertilizers. He also saw the cow dung being wasted in the nearby field, which pollutes the air with a pungent odor. 

After becoming associated with Yayasan Rumah Energi (YRE) and Harapan Bersama Mason Group (a local organization, founded by YRE as a biogas construction partner), Abdul learned about the Household Biogas (BIRU) program. Abdul saw that biogas is a good solution to his problem. He saw an opportunity to reduce his dependence on non-renewable cooking gas. In addition, he wants to use bioslurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer for his plantation. In order to make it happen, Abdul invited eight of his farmer friends to form a borrower group. He is so keen to purchase a biodigester, but he does not have sufficient capital for it. A loan from Kiva will help him and other group members to make it possible. 

Abdul has an optimism that if he can build a biodigester, he can use the biogas for cooking and use the bioslurry (biogas residue) as fertilizer for his plantation. He also wants to sell the remaining bioslurry to increase his family income. He hopes that in the future, he can invite all the farmers in his village to use biogas.

loans.use: to build a biodigester facility and utilize bioslurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer

loans.name: Ganjina

texts.en:
Ganjina is an active girl. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1996. She is single and lives with parents. She successfully graduated secondary school #61 in their local area.

This year she passed the entrance examination and is going to study World Economy at part time department. She wishes to study with excellent and good marks and be a highly qualified specialist.

She appealed to IMON to get a loan to pay her higher education costs.

She awaits KIVA lender's kindness and support. The loan will help her to achieve her goal to be a economist specialist and be helpful to Tajikistan.

loans.use: loan will help her to achieve her goal to be a specialist economist and be helpful to Tajikistan.

loans.name: Raise Our Dream - Qtrunghchâu Group

texts.en:
Mrs Duyến is 43 years old, and she is married with 3 children. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.

Duyến lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family lives in a low-income household in a village. The market demand is also low in this region. The income from this business is unstable because when a poultry disease spreads, the stock could die, leaving her with nothing to sell and troubled finances.

The main hardship that Duyến faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and then sell.

In 2008, Duyến joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 9 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Duyến is the group leader of the "Raise Our Dream - Qtrunghchâu", which consists of 3 members. With her business profit, Duyến hopes to maintain a successful business so her children can go to school, and so she can buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel owns and operates a convenience store in Poblacion II, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. The store has existed for eight years. She ventured into the retailing business, because she wanted to help her husband provide for the needs of her family.

Raquel was supplied by Paglaum MPC with the capital that she needed to start up her business. She successfully repaid her obligation, and so she was able to ask for another loan this time. The amount will be used to restock the store with consumable items, such as noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, detergent and bath soap, shampoo and other things.

loans.use: to restock the store with consumable items, such as noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, detergent and bath soap, shampoo and other things.

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.en:
Uldarico is in a printing press business at Brgy. Polao, Tangub City, Mis. Occ. He is 63 years old, single and an active member of Paglaum MPC.

He has local customers and customers coming from neighboring towns. He's making good profit out of this business venture.

Recently, he took a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase a new printing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new printing machine.

location.town: Tangub-P-7 Polao Tangub City  Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 45 years old, married and lives in Polao, Tangub City. She previously ran a sari-sari (variety) store; however, she experienced bankruptcy. She hopes to get back on her knees.

Paglaum MPC came to the rescue and agreed on the proposal of Evangeline for her loan of PHP 30,000 to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, soy sauce, cooking oil and others.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, soy sauce, cooking oil and others.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a farmer in Milanid, Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old and married with adult-age children.

In need of additional capitalization for her farming activities, she asks Paglaum MPC for a loan to purchase bags of fertilizer. She believes that having enough fertilizers for her farm will give her a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

location.town: Sindangan-Milanid, Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zambo

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita has been in a retailing business for six years. She got engaged in this type of business because consumable goods are easy to sell and there is a fast return on investment. She started up with the capital that she borrowed from Paglaum MPC, where she is a member in good standing (MIGS).

This time, Clarita wants to restock the store with consumable items like canned goods, noodles, soy sauce, cooking oil and vinegar, so she asks for a loan from the coop.

loans.use: to restock store with consumable items like canned goods, noodles, soy sauce, cooking oil, and vinegar

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 48 years old; she's married and has one child. She finds better ways of living with her coco land business. She sells a number of coconuts and it helps a lot to sustain their living.

She gained access to GDMPC and it helped her to improve her ability to engage in business.

Recently she took a new loan primarily to pay for labor for her coco land, to gain more income for the better future of her family.

In the future, Lilibeth wants to expand her business as well as the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to pay for farm labor for her cocoland.

location.town: North Mapang, Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 25 years old. She is married and has one child.

Her business is dairy farming and growing cowpeas, mangoes, maize and beans. She has been in this business for seven years. She earns a monthly income of 18,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to boost her business to improve the standard of living of her family.

Her hopes and dreams are to be financially secure and a family with a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juliana is 49 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Juliana has a food vending business in the Philippines. Juliana requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, pork, fish, chicken meat, spices, vegetables and utensils for her food production business.

Juliana has been in this business for 16 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, pork, fish, chicken meat, spices, vegetables and utensils for her food production business

loans.name: Zepherine

texts.en:
Zepherine is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Walter Rene

texts.es:
Walter, de 23 años de edad, está estudiando en la universidad la carrera ingeniería en sistemas informáticos, está soltero y vive en casa de su padre junto a sus hermanos.  

Walter, trabaja en un cafetín de comida rápida, donde hace tortas mexicanas, hamburguesas y hot-dot para vender, tiene un año de trabajar en ese lugar, este trabajo lo aprendió gracias a un amigo, la distancia que recorre es de 1 kilómetro para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo y viaja en motocicleta.

Walter, necesita el préstamo para colocar su propio cafetín y con esto ser dueño de su propia fuente de ingresos, el lugar donde lo pondrá es en el parque de la cuidad.

Sus sueños son poder terminar su carrera universitaria y también continuar con su fuente de negocio, espera que el negocio le de resultado y poder hacer crecer las ventas; las ganancias del negocio serán invertidas en el negocio y para pagar la universidad.
texts.en:
Walter, 23 years old, is studying at the university for a degree in computer science. He is single and lives in his father's house with his siblings.

Walter works in a fast food eatery where he makes Mexican sandwiches, hamburgers and hotdogs to sell. He has been working at this place for one year. He learned this work thanks to his friend. The distance he goes is 1 kilometer to get to his workplace and he goes by motorcycle.

Walter needs the loan to establish his own eatery and with this be the owner of his own income source. The place where he will establish it is in the city park.

His dreams are to be able to finish his university degree and also continue with his source of business. He hopes the business will give him a profit and to be able to increase his sales. The earnings from the business will be invested in the business and to pay for the university.

loans.use: to establish his own eatery.

loans.name: Sajeda

texts.en:
Sajeda is a 41-year-old married woman. Almost a year ago, she started selling children's gadgets to help her husband in covering their needs and expenses.

She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is working hard to develop her business; thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with more children's gadgets to satisfy her customers' requests.

Sajeda hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with more children's gadgets

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a 34-year-old, single lady who started three years ago selling clothes to cover her needs and expenses. She is an independent and ambitious lady who is working hard to develop her business. She has a good reputation among her region and has her loyal customers.

Today, Hayat is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of fashionable autumn clothes to satisfy her customers' needs.

Hayat hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of fashionable autumn clothes.

loans.name: We Are Smiling - N14Đtâm Group

texts.en:
Lan is 39 years old and she is married and lives in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.

Her family is a low-income household in the village, where the market demand is low. The income from this business is unstable because when some poultry disease occurs, the birds could die, which leaves her nothing to sell, causing financial trouble.

The main hardship that Lan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

In 2013, Lan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of "We are smiling - N14ĐTâm", which consists of 5 members.

With her business profit, Lan hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is engaged in a retail business in her village. She sells various kinds of grocery items, such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles, and coffee. She has been in this business for ten years. Julieta says that her income from the business provides for their daily household expenditures. According to Julieta, her husband's salary as a carpenter is not enough to sustain all of their needs, since they have two children whom they are sending to school.

As her way of helping her husband to improve their living standard, Julieta wants to expand the business. Hence, she is asking for a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy grocery items to sell. Julieta believes that the loan will make a big contribution for her effort to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: St. Athanasius School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Barbara. She is the head teacher of St. Athanasius Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Kisenyi in Kampala with 700 students.

St. Athanasius School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

St. Athanasius School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Barbara ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ty Kampong Group

texts.en:
Mantaoleng is a 65 year old mother of 5 children and grandmother of 4 aged between 14-6 years. She not only takes care of her children but has to take care of her four young grandchildren and husband aged 71. Mantaoleng lives in a traditional hut that is not well ventilated, nor warms up well in winter. She works long hours to ensure there is enough food for her entire family, some of whom are going to school and only help her in the field on Saturdays and Sundays. She has to wake up very early, between 3am and 4am, during the week to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water and warming the house for all the children before they go to school.

Collecting firewood, setting up the fire and doing the actual cooking demands a lot of her time. Temperatures in the Lesotho highlands are never really high; winters can get very cold and often Mantaoleng has to start the fire inside her hut. Starting a fire releases smog and smoke which when inhaled in large quantities over a period of time can lead to lung diseases, eye problems and in the worst case to death. In these circumstances, life for women like Mantaoleng has been very difficult.

Mantaoleng has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, in order to be able to purchase clean cook stoves which provide her and 13 other people from her village, who are living in the same circumstances, the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families, and that does not require a lot of wood, which is hard to find in Lesotho, nor expensive paraffin and gas. This stove can be started with the use of very little, readily available biomass like dry twigs and dry cow dung that do not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the homes.

This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones and a mini LED lamp. A life improving package for these people. This stove saves them time to be with their family, saves energy, eliminates the element of toxic inhalation, house burning and has given them the freedom to have a better lit home to see better in the evening while cooking and enables children to do their homework. For stove info please check www.africancleanenergy.com

loans.use: to be able to pay for the ACE cook stove which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel and the time she spends collecting firewood.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia runs a convenience store in Pagadian City. She is making good sales knowingly she is the runs the only store in their barangay. Delia recalls that it was Paglaum MPC who gives her the needed capital to start up her business. Currently, she avails her 9th loan to restock store with canned goods, noodles, condiments and confectioneries.

loans.use: to restock store with canned goods, noodles, condiments and confectioneries

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is married and blessed with six children and lives in a six bed room house in the North West Region of Cameroon. She will use this loan to buy plantains, bananas, firewood, fertilizer, seeds, palm oil, groundnut oil; plates, spoons and hire labour, also buy firewood for sale. The fact that she has faced many challenges in her life, which are the death of her family members
and ill health.

She was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by a non Ghape member. Hence she joined Ghape in 2012 and has successfully borrowed and repaid loans two times.
The profit from this loan will help her to settle her bills, provide some basic food for the family, pay for family’s medication and plough back some of the profit. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rate, convenient time of repayment and the sociability of members towards each other.
She knows her business is going to succeed because she has been doing it for long, the demand for food is increasing and she has a good business site. With this business activity the community will benefit from quality food, moderate prices, reduce the distance to market and food will be available.

loans.use: to buy plantain, banana, firewood, fertilizer, seeds, palm oil, groundnut oil, plates, spoons and hire  labour also buy firewood for sale.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is a businesswoman who runs a convenience store in Pagadian City. She has been in business for 20 years. The store gives her an approximate income of PHP 7,500.00 per month. Remedios wants to purchase additional inventory for her store. She requests a loan to restock her store with commodities like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap and other items.

loans.use: to restock her store with commodities like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap and other items

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is an ornamental plants and flowering plants grower in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She has signed up for her membership with PMPC, and availed the needed capital to start up an ornamental plants growing and selling business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Nonita is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days.

She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan to buy ornamental plants and flowering plants.

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to buy ornamental plants and flowering plants

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is 74 years old, widowed, and lives in Labinay, Ozamiz City. She runs and operates a video-karaoke pub with her youngest son. Through this business, Beatriz is able to help her children send her grandchildren to school. Now that she wants to expand her entertainment pub, she requests a loan of PHP 45,000.00 to buy another video-karaoke machine for her entertainment business.

loans.use: to buy another video-karaoke machine for her entertainment business

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en: Marichu runs a sari-sari store (convenience store) in Mantic, Tangub City. She signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC just this year and had successfully repaid a previous loan. Recently, she requested another loan of PHP 8,000.00 to restock her store with consumable goods like canned goods, noodles, soy sauce, vinegar, condiments and other items.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods like canned goods, noodles, soy sauce, vinegar, condiments and other items

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en: Genevieve is 26 years old, single, and runs a convenience store in Mantic, Tangub City. She is a member of Paglaum MPC where she requests additional capital for her business. She is glad that the cooperative offers financial services to a small-time borrower like her. Currently, she requests a loan to restock her store with condiments, confectioneries, detergents and bath soaps, shampoo and consumable goods.

loans.use: to restock her store with condiments, confectioneries, detergents and bath soaps, shampoo and consumable goods

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Catching - Hsơnhtrường Group

texts.en:
Mrs Duyên is 47 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years. Duyên lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Duyên faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools and nets for fishing and selling.

In 2009, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Duyên has successfully repaid many loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the "Catching - HSơnHTrường", which consists of 4 members.
With her business profit, Duyên hopes to maintain a successful business, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase tools and nets for fishing and selling.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is 40 years old, married with school age children and lives in Manil, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. He sells various kitchen wares from one town to the other during market day of the particular town. Recently, he avails a loan of PHP 14,900.00 to buy additional stocks of kitchen wares for his buy & sell business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of kitchen wares for his buy & sell business

location.town: Sindangan-Manil, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie has been in a hog-raising business for 17 years that gives her sufficient income for her family. She is also a member of Paglaum MPC that supports her business through its finance and non-finance program for members like her.

Currently, she avails a loan to purchase bags of animal feed & vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed & vitamins.

location.town: Oroquieta-Dolipos Alto, Oroq. City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ruby is 47 years old and has four children who are in school.

Ruby has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like bananas, oil, etc..

Ruby has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, oil, etc.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is a mother of one child, and she is single. She deals in the coffee business, but is limited by capital and she also falls prey to competition because of selling coffee in small quantities.

Aidah however is determined to become a big dealer in coffee, by working hard and trying to find more money to stock her store. She requests for money to buy more coffee for selling this peak season.

loans.use: to buy more coffee for selling.

loans.name: Angy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL EXITO.
La socia Angy Irene tiene 19 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de productos de belleza, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
Las socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colonias para damas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "EL EXITO" communal bank. Angy Irene is 19 years old and combines her daily activities with her beauty product business. She has had the business for some time and things are going well thanks to the determination she brings to her work each day. She wants to continue working in this way so she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy cologne for women amongst others.

Angy feels grateful for the loan awarded and promises to comply with the established installments.

loans.use: to buy cologne for women amongst others.

loans.name: Salt And Sand - Txuânhtrường Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nguyên is 55 years old and she is married with three children. She has operated a food stall, selling fish, for more than 10 years.

Nguyên lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Nguyên faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools and nets for fishing and selling fish.

In 2006, Nguyên joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Nguyên has successfully repaid nine loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

She is the group leader of the "Salt and Sand - TXuânHTrường", which consists of three members.
With her business profit, Nguyên hopes to maintain a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. She also wants her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase tools and nets for fishing and selling

loans.name: Berly

texts.en:
Berly is 56 years old, married, and primarily provides for the needs of the family through sunlight breaker making. This business had helped her husband in rearing their family, knowingly her husband's income cannot suffice for their needs.

Currently, she asks for a loan to purchase materials such as bamboo, nylon and other materials for sunlight breaker production.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as bamboo, nylon and other materials for sunlight breaker production.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 49 years old; she is married with adult-age children and lives in Tipan, Oroquieta City. She had experienced various failures in business ventures. But with a high spirit of willingness to provide for the needs of the family she finds another way, that is sunlight breaker making.

This business is financed by Paglaum MPC where Concepcion is a member.

To respond the growing demand for her product, she asks the cooperative a loan to purchase materials like bamboo, nylon ropes and other materials for sunlight breaker making.

loans.use: to purchase materials like bamboo, nylon ropes and other materials for sunlight breaker making.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 46 years old. She is married and has 4 children.
Her business is a retail shop. She has been in this business for 8 years.

She earns a monthly income of nine thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, flour, cooking oil, soap, salt etc. for the shop.
She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, flour, cooking oil, soap, salt etc. for the shop

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a skilled tailor in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Despite her age, she never gets tired to wake up and do the tailoring job.

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase various cloth, thread, tailoring chalk and other things for her tailoring business.

loans.use: to purchase various cloth, thread, tailoring chalk and other things for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a new borrower with Ugafode. He is married with 5 children and a resident of Busingiri NYANAMA. He has applied for a loan of 2millions to increase his working capital to buy more stock of electronics such as sockets, plugs, bulbs, extension cables among other electronic items to sell to his customers.

However, Michael his faced with challenges of low working capital that leads to loss of customers and business, and he is so hopeful that if financed he will attract more customers. He is so grateful to Ugafode microfinance funds that have helped his business boost.
Pictured is Michael with his wife in their electronics shop.

loans.use: to add more electronics business stock.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL EXITO.
La socia Carmen Rosa tiene 46 años de edad es soltera y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
Las socia solicitan el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite, carnes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "El Exito" communal bank. Carmen Rosa is 46 years old, single and has two children. She combines her daily activities with working in her business selling food. She has been in the business for some time and things are going well thanks to the determination she puts into her work each day. She wants to continue to work in this way to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies like rice, oil and meat amongst others.

She feels grateful for the loan awarded and promises to comply with the established installments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, oil and meat amongst others.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal EL EXITO.
El socio Jose Luis  tiene 22 años de edad y es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de restaurante, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "El Exito" (Success).

The member Jose Luis is 22 years old and single. He rotates his daily activities, dedicating himself to his restaurant business. He has a good time with his work, which goes well thanks to the effort he puts into his work everyday.

He would like to be able to continue working and support his family this way. He's seeking the loan to buy inputs like rice and oil, among others. He feels grateful for the loan provided and promises to comply with established payments.

loans.use: to buy inputs like rice and oil, among others.

loans.name: Antonieto

texts.en:
Antonieto managed a dressed-chicken business together with his wife, who also managed a convenience store. Both of their business ventures were financed by Paglaum MPC, where Antonieto is a member in good standing.

Antonieto wants to make used of the fortunes he now has by renovating their age-worn house.

He asks for a loan to purchase bags of cement, hollow blocks, steel rods and galvanized iron sheets for his house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, hollow blocks, steel rods and galvanized iron sheets for his house renovation.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 24 years old. He is single.

His business is mobile phone accessories and MPesa (Mobile Money transfer).

He has been in this business for one year. He earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenya shillings. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

He will use the loan to buy mobile phone accessories as well as increasing the float in the mobile money transfer business account.

He will use the profits from the expanded business to educate his siblings, as well as improving his standard of living.

His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and establish a stable family.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories as well as increasing the float in the mobile money transfer business account.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 49 years old and married with five children.

She is in agricultural business, raising pig in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Libilyn

texts.en:
Libilyn is 53 years old and married with three children.
