Libilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Libilyn has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending and raising pigs.

Libilyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Patricia Gerardina

texts.es:
Patricia, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está soltera, tiene dos hijos y uno de ellos aún estudia, en su casa vive su hermano y una sobrina. 

Patricia, tiene una tienda en su casa desde hace 8 años, decidió colocarla en su casa porque observó que no habían tiendas cercas y la gente buscaba productos de primera necesidad, ella va a la ciudad a traer mercadería 3 veces por semana al mercado y para eso recorre 35 kilómetros. 

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar productos de primera necesidad para vender como azúcar, detergentes, papel higiénico, arroz, frijoles, sal y maíz; este préstamo mejorar su negocio, porque tendrá la oportunidad de vender más y cubrir necesidades en su casa. 

Su sueño es tener una tienda grande, para obtener mejores ingresos y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien y se superen profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Patricia, 35, studied until fifth grade and is single. She has two children, one of whom is still in school, and lives with her brother and a niece.

Patricia has had a store in her house for eight years. She decided to put it in her house because she realized that there were no stores nearby, and people were looking for basic necessities. She goes into the city three times a week to bring her merchandise to the market, traveling 35km.

She needs this loan to buy basic necessities to sell, such as sugar, detergent, toilet paper, rice, beans, salt, and corn; this loan will improve her store, because she will have the opportunity to sell more and cover more necessities in the home.

Her dream is to have a big store, to have better profits, and to help her children go to school and succeed professionally.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities to sell, such as sugar, detergents, toilet paper, rice, beans, salt, and corn.

loans.name: Vitor

texts.en: Vitor has built his house, but the money is not enough to buy more materials for his house to be completed, so he is requesting a loan of $ 1,500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete his house. And he is taking this loan because he wants to buy more material such as wood, sand, stone, iron, cement, nails and other materials to be used. He is very happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for his, because with this loan he can be complete his house.

loans.use: to buy more material such as wood, sand, stone, iron, cement, nails and other materials to use.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem and husband are farmers living with 2 children in Achen village that is far from power grid. As a farmer, Nem wants to expand her business with 2 hectares land and making her family living in comfortable condition. However, she is facing some problems because her house is in remote area.

Her house has no reliable energy source. She has to go to charge car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometime because of busyness she doesn’t have time to charge battery the whole family is in pitch black condition for the whole day. She is applying a Kiva loan to buy high quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, she believes his family condition would be better and safer. She also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Achen Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo Distric

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en: Virgina has very high interest in doing business, she has been involving in business activities since 2008, with her awn working capital of $ 1000.00, and she make her best on it. She has a small store so she is requesting a loan of $ 1500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital because her capital is not enough, and she will used this loan to buy more additional items to keep in her store including wheat, rice and other things to sell. With this loan  she still wants to improve her business and Goods sell to other place.

loans.use: to buy more additional items to keep in her store including wheat, rice and other things to sell.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 40-year-old Palestinian refugee, a married father of one child, who has been working in house painting and as a taxi driver with five years of experience.

He lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp, and is working hard to improve his family's living.
He used to work as an employee in a bakery, but he decided to start his own business and improve his family's living.

Today since his income is quite enough to cover his living needs, Abdullah is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a refrigerator needed for his house.

He hopes to stay capable of developing his business and addressing his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator needed for his house.

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel is 28 years old. He is single.

His business is farming, mostly mangos, maize and beans.

He has been in this business for two years. He earns a monthly income of 48,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

He will use the loan to buy farm chemicals, fertilizer and to pay for farm labor. He will use the profits from the expanded business to educate his siblings and plan for his future life.

His hopes and dreams are to have a stable family.

loans.use: to buy farm chemicals, fertilizer and to pay for farm labour.

loans.name: Muendo

texts.en:
Muendo is 69 years old. He is married and has six children.

His business is farming and buying and selling cows and goats.

He has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and cows and goats to sell. He will use the profits from the expanded business to educate his children.

His hope and dream is to expand his business to bring a big and steady income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and cows and goats to sell.

loans.name: Liz Zayda

texts.es: LIZ una estudiante de 24 años de edad es soltera. Ella estudia la carrera de ingeniería industrial gracias al apoyo de sus padres le va bien. Ya se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo de su carrera es por ello que solicitó el crédito para el pago de matrícula y pensión de estudios. El deseo de Liz es de poder sacar adelante a sus padres. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar a estudiantes como ella.
texts.en: LIZ is a 24 year old student who is single. She is studying Industrial Engineering and thanks to the support of her parents things are going well. She is in her forth semester of her studies and she is requesting the loan to pay her registration and course fees. Liz's desire is to be able to get her parents ahead. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for supporting students like her.

loans.use: to pay for her resignation and her course fees.

loans.name: Mareme's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de sept femmes a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois et regroupe des femmes issues du même groupement et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Marième la responsable est une femme mariée âgée de 63 ans et mère de quatre enfants dont deux filles et deux garçons tous majeures.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de viande par l'achat de de pattes de bœufs recyclés puis vendu au détails pour la préparation de soupe.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 400 000 francs CFA elle va acheter de la marchandise pré cité au près des boucher.
Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour avoir pratiqué cette activité depuis longtemps.
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires sanitaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group composed of seven women was created during the first loan cycle of the Banc Villageois and it brings together women who all come from the same group and are united by good social and professional relations.

Madame Marème, the featured borrower, is a married woman aged 63 and the mother of four children, two girls and two boys, all adults. She works at selling meat by buying recycled beef feet to sell retail for the preparation of soup.

With her new loan portion of 400,000 francs CFA she is going to buy the above item from butchers. She has a good deal of experience since she has been in this business for a long time. The profit from her activity will allow her to cover the food and healthcare needs of her children and add to her savings account in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy meat to resell at retail.

loans.name: Laugh, Love And Live - N21Bthọnlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Mơ is 47 years old and she is married with 1 children. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for more than 10 years.
Mơ lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Mơ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweet, sugar, milk,... to resell.
In 2009, Mơ joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Mơ has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of the "Laugh, Love and Live - N21BThọNLộc", which consists of 4 members. With her business profit, Mơ hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk,... to resell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a strong-willed woman who will do anything for her family. She is 62 years old, married, and lives in Tabon, Jose Dalman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

She operates a hog-raising business, which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC, that gives her a quarterly income of approximately PHP 15,000 that sufficiently provides for the needs of her family.

Recently, she availed another loan to buy heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feed.

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Saramie

texts.en:
Saramie is a 28 years old business woman from Malibay, Philippines and is married to Ian, an office staff. She is a new member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and currently running a tailoring business for 1 year now and she’s able to market the products locally.

Being in a business that has something to do with ‘Fashion” is very difficult since each year trends come and go. You just need to be creative, come up to new ideas and designs on how to keep pace with trends and fashion.

Any business needs capital to grow, Saramie decided to apply for P8, 000 loan to buy needed materials for the business such as lace, fabric, garter, thread etc. This amount will really help her produce quality materials. Since the business really became a medium for her to sustain her family’s day-to-day expenses.

Saramie is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy needed materials for her tailoring business such as lace, fabric, garter, thread etc.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 26 years old. He is married and has one child. His business is a retail shop.

He has been in this business for two years. He earns a monthly income of 28,000 Kenyan shillings. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

He will use the loan to purchase a stock of rice, sugar, tea leaves, soap, salt, sodas etc. for the shop.

He will use the profits from the expanded business to improve the standard of living of his family.

His hope and dream is to be financially stable

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice, sugar, tea leaves, soap, salt, sodas etc. for the shop.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic was able to utilize her previous loan as she was able to buy computer set and materials for the renovation of her internet café. She’s thankful about the monetary support and approval of her previous loan to Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and Lenders. She considered her internet Café and house rental business growing since there’s an increase on her monthly income. For her internet café, Youths are mostly her patrons since they rent computers to play online games, some are for projects and homework.

You’ll know if the business is growing if the number of customers are increasing. Marivic needs to add another set of computer and peripherals to accommodate all of the customers that visit the shop. Moreover she also needs to buy necessary materials for the improvement of her apartment. With this, Marivic applied for a loan of P20, 000 and hoping that her request will be considered one again by CCT.

Marivic believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: To buy computer set and necessary materials for her internet café and house rental business.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a brick-selling business for over five years, selling to the neighbors. She mentioned a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase materials for making bricks in her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making bricks in her business

loans.name: Nazish

texts.en:
NAZISH is a 25-year-old married woman; she is living with her two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband's owns a bakery in their hometown; he sells kinds of cakes, fresh cream cake, rusks, milk, biscuits and juices. He purchases the inventory in large quantities from a nearby wholesaler and sells it at his own bakery.

Now he wants to offer additional different types of sweets to his customers, but he does not have a sufficient amount to buy these additional sweets.

Therefore, NAZISH requested a loan so that her husband can buy his desired bakery items to sell.

His wish is to prepare these bakery items at home so that he can minimize the cost and maximize the income as well. He will start to make savings with the profit amount and hopes in future he will prepare all sweets himself.

NAZISH thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy inventory for her husband's bakery shop (fresh cream cake, rusks, milk, biscuits, juices etc).

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en: Silvina has been involving in business activities since 2012, she started with her own working capital of $ 250.00. she is taking the loan of $ 1500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin, she will use to buy  biscuits, cooking oils, milk, ketchup, sauces, noodles, sweets, pens, Including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell. She is very happy when the Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan for her, because she can use this loan to improving her business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, cooking oils, milk, ketchup, sauces, noodles, sweets, pens, Including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Valle Verde Group

texts.es: Grupo ¨Valle Verde¨, lo conforman 3 mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, coordinador por doña Ada, de 59 años, casada, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida fritanguera y a la venta de gaseosas desde hace 15 años, este negocio lo empezó con la ayuda de su esposo, quien trabaja como mecánico. Ahora por quinta vez solicita credito para la compra de gaseosas de la marca pepsi, big cola, coca cola, meneitos, golosinas, juegos enlatados y energizantes, aceite, leña, arroz, pollo y verduras. Para asi seguir desarrollando su negocio, Las demás socias son Juana de 39 años dedicada a la venta de ropa, y Maria, de 36 años tiene una pulperia en su hogar.
texts.en:
The¨Valle Verde group consists of 3 determined and enterprising women. The group is coordinated by 59 year old Ada. She is married, and her business is preparing and selling fried fast food and selling soda pop, a business she has had for 15 years. She began this business with the help of her husband, who works as a mechanic. Now for the 5th time she seeks a loan to buy various brands of soda pop, snacks, canned juices and energy drinks, oil, firewood, rice, chicken and vegetables in order to continue developing her business.

The other members of the group are 39 year old Juana who sells clothing and 36 year old Maria who has a convenience store in her home.

loans.use: to buy various brands of soda pop, snacks, canned juices and energy drinks, oil, firewood, rice, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Herma

texts.en:
Herma is 42 years old, married, and blessed with three children. Herma’s children are all attending school, in between college and high school level of education. Her husband works as a security guard.

Herma needs greater profit so that she can financially support her children's needs in school until they finish college. She engages in retailing as her source of income. She sells beverages, biscuits, noodles, and condiments.

Herma wants to sell more items but she can’t do it due to financial shortfall. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy sugar, powdered milk, coffee, and many more items.

Herma hopes to get greater income for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, powdered milk, coffee, and many more items.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en: Bonifacio is married with 6 adult age children. He is 80 years old and a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC. Bonifacio is glad that there is a cooperative that caters financial services to aging pensioners like him. He can access any finacial assistance whenever he needs it. In turn, he also nurtures his membership by paying his loans on time. Recently, he avails a loan to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en: Estrelita has been operating a nursery of trees ready for replanting in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte areas. She is 51 years old, married with 2 adult age children. She's making good sales out from this business and wants to have enough inventories of seedlings available to her costumers. She learns about Paglaum MPC and avails financial assistance for her business. Recently, she avails another loan to purchase Palcata seeds for nursery business.

loans.use: to purchase Palcata seeds for nursery business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Evangeline is able to turn the favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, soft drinks, shampoos and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, soft drinks, shampoos, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Eleodora

texts.en: Eleodora is 58 years old, married with adult age children and lives in Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a hog raiser in their place that primarily supplies pork on their local market. Eleodora wants to augment the number of heads in her hog raising that she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC to buy additional heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy additional heads of piglets & purchase bags of animal feed

location.town: Sindangan - Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 43 years old. She is married and has five children.

Her business is a retail shop. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She earns a monthly income of five thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, flour, rice and cooking oil. She will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, flour, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mefaret

texts.en:
Mefaret is married and a mother of three. She works in the kitchen of a private school and sells Amway to make more contributions to the family budget. With the help of this additional income from Amway the family budget was stabled. With the help of the third loan she will buy products. She is very pleased that she meets the needs of her children and live without debt.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Mefaret Hanım evli, üç çocuk annesi. Bir dershanenin mutfak bölümünde çalışıyor ve ailesine daha çok katkı sağlamak için de Amvey ürünleri satışı yapıyor. Bu işe başladıktan sonra kazandığı ek gelir ile ekonomik durumunu düzeltmiş. Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile toplu ürün alacak. Evini ve çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını karşılayıp borçsuz yaşadığı için memnun. Hayali emekli olmak.

loans.use: to buy Amway goods wholesale.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme  âgée de 41 ans résidante à Tokoin. Mère de quatre enfants, Ablavi prépare du riz  qu’elle revend à  la devanture de son domicile. Ablavi s’approvisionne du nécessaire une fois par mois  au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander  le sac de riz et le bidon d’huile.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Ablavi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider ses enfants à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a woman of 41, living in Tokoin. The mother of four children, Ablavi prepares rice which she sells in front of her house. She stocks up on the necessary ingredients once a month at the market and is asking for this loan to order a sack of rice and a tin of oil.

With the profit that will result from investing the loan, Ablavi intends to improve the presentation of her business and help her children to thrive and and get a good education.

loans.use: to buy one sack of rice and one tin of oil.

loans.name: Jose Yonatan

texts.es:
José, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, actualmente tiene un hijo.

José, se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño, porque el padre siempre lo llevaba al campo para que fuera aprendiendo el oficio, pero también tiene 2 años de ser pastor en la iglesia de la comunidad, pero su principal fuente de ingresos es la agricultura y su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a las 11:00 a.m.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y semilla de frijol para sembrar, con este préstamo podrá cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y de frijol.

Los sueños de José, poder ser un buen pastor con la ayuda de Dios, seguir cultivando la tierra.
texts.en:
Jose, 20, studied until high school and is married. His wife makes a living in the domestic trade, and they currently have one son.

Jose has made his living in agriculture since he was a boy, because his father always brought him to the fields so that he would learn the trade. However, while he also spent two years as a pastor in his community's church, his main source of income is in agriculture and his daily schedule is from 6am to 11am.

Jose needs this loan to buy farming supplies and bean seeds to sow. With this loan, he will be able to harvest 7000 square meters of corn and beans.

Jose's dreams include being able to be a good pastor with God's help, while continuing to cultivate the land.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and bean seeds to sow.

loans.name: Nachan Group

texts.en:
Chone is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Chone and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.

The water filter Chone and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. Chone and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Chone and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Napho Group

texts.en:
Sonechai’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Sonechai and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now shift to other pursuits.

Sonechai and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two-year period filter users, like Sonechai’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Fonki Alfred

texts.en:
Fonki is married with five children. They live in five bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced challenges in life such as the death of his parents and inadequate finance to start up a business of his own and poverty. He was motivated by his friends to join GHAPE and he has been a member since 2009. He has successfully taken and repaid EC four times.

With this new loan he will buy goats, pigs, fowls, rabbits for resale. He is very optimistic that the business will succeed because he has a good business knowledge, the population is increasing every day as such the demand for fowls is also increasing because fowls are relatively cheap. The community will buy at a cheaper rate.

He intends to use the profit to pay his children’s education, provide medication for his children. He prefers GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy goats, pigs, fowls, rabbits for resale.

loans.name: Nimer

texts.en:
Nimer is a 48-year-old married father of eight children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He established a coffee shop in July 2013 to cover his family's needs and expenses.

As a result of the increase in living costs and the tough life in the Palestinian refugee camp, Nimer is suffering from a limited income that is not enough anymore. Thus, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to redecorate his shop, which will help him attract more customers. Nimer is trying to improve his financial situation to plan a better future for his kids.

loans.use: to redecorate his shop to attract more customers.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Growing vegetables gives life to Evangeline. She feels energized every time she wakes up and takes good care of her vegetable garden. She is 58 years old with three adult age children. Evangeline said that vegetables are nutritious for our bodies, especially when they are grown organically. This gardening turned into her business as she has become a supplier of organic vegetables in their local market. To support her growing demands, she is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase bags of compost fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase bags of compost fertilizer.

loans.name: Jima

texts.en:
Jima is a 33 years old single lady, who has been working in a tailoring and clothes selling business since 2002.
She used to work as an employee, got the necessary experience and established her own business which she is developing currently.
Jima's income is good but not enough to expand her working sector and develop it with new machines.
An acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua was Jima's decision. Through this loan she will buy more updated tailoring machines to develop her business in a well managed way, and increase her production.
She hopes that in the future she can manage her business properly and recruit others to help her increase her production.

loans.use: To buy more updated tailoring machines to develop her business in a well managed way

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 35 years old. He is married and has 2 children.

His business is farming and keeping cows and goats. He has been in this business for 14 years.

He earns a monthly income of sixteen thousand Kenya shillings. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. He will use the profits from his expanded business to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 45 years old and married with five children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Roselyn has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rolaly

texts.en:
Rolaly is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rolaly is 40 years old and has one child still in school.

Rolaly has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Rolaly requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear products like pants, blouse, shirt, shorts, slippers, underwear etc to sell.

Rolaly has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready to wear products like pants, blouse, shirt, shorts, slippers, underwear etc to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase a stock of new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Blaise

texts.en: Blaise is married living in Kasese-Uganda.His business is welding of metals being the only source of income. He serves the local community and he has a lot of clients. Blaise has been given contracts to make doors, windows among others for a school,the challenge is he lacks enough capital to purchase the materials. Blaise requests for money to buy more metal materials and serve his contract.

loans.use: to buy more metal materials

loans.name: Nathone Group

texts.en:
Tang understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Tang knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Tang purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Tang is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years, so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying  washing machines

loans.name: Rida

texts.en:
Rida is a 36-year-old married father of five and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Fourteen years ago, he started selling and composing perfumes to cover the needs and expenses of his children.

Rida is well known among his region for his good taste in composing perfumes. He is working hard to develop his business; thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy more fragrance essence to satisfy his customers' special requests.

He hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to buy more fragrance essence to satisfy his customers' special requests

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction material.

loans.name: Ghenda

texts.en: Ghenda is a 19 year old married woman. She is living with her husband and has an only child still attending school. She is a housewife dedicated only for her family and her husband works in order to satisfy their needs. Due to the hard financial situation, today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l; she will be utilizing the loan to pay her child's educational fees. In the future, she plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering his study fees.

loans.use: to pay her child educational fees

loans.name: Sadurdin

texts.en: Sadurdin is a generous man. He was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1973. He is living in a small beautiful and peaceful town. He is married and has four children. His wife is a housekeeper. He is a taxi driver. His business is doing well. But unfortunately he does not have the money to get treatment for his child. His child is sick and needs to be treated at the hospital. He appealed to IMON asking for a loan to pay medical services and buy medicines to treat his child. He awaits KIVA lender kindness and support. The loan will help him to get medical treatment for his child and see him healthy.

loans.use: to pay medical service and buy medicines to treat his child

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita sign up for membership with Paglaum MPC and obtained the needed capital to start up her hog raising business. She is thankful that she is given the opportunity to access financial assistance to alleviate their present household conditions. Recently, she avails a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins. Someday, she hopes to build a concrete pig pen and septic tank for proper sanitation.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth has been a member of Paglaum MPC for four years. She previously used the insurance services of the cooperative during the time after the death of her husband. Bernadeth maintains a good partnership with the coop by paying her obligations on time. 

She has requested a loan to buy sticks, nails, plywood, galvanized iron sheets and pay labor costs to repair her house. She wants to live comfortably in a decent home.

loans.use: to buy sticks, nails, plywood, galvanized iron sheets and pay labor costs for house repair

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 22 years old. She is married and has one child. Her business is green grocery stall. She has been in this business for 5 years.

She earns a monthly income of eighteen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies of vegetables for resale as well as pay school fees for her child.

She will use the profits from expanded business to repay her loan and educate her children by paying their school fees.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of vegetables for resale as well as pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Ricchard

texts.en:
Richard is aged 38 years old.married and has 3 children.

He has been a small scale farmer earning an income of KES 18,000 per month for 3 years.

He has applied his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizer for top dressing his tea plantation in order to produce an increased harvest.

He will use the gained profit to repay the loan and buy a dairy cow for milk production.

He will use the profits from his expanded business to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizer for top dressing his tea plantation in order to produce an increased harvest.

loans.name: Sacred Heart Gulu School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Peter. He is the Deputy Head teacher of Sacred Heart Secondary School, a Girls school in the Rural area of Gulu with 920 students. Sacred Heart School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Sacred Heart School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Peter ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. .

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Kossiwa est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin. Agée de 52 ans, Kossiwa se bat énormément pour gagner son revenu en produisant du savon liquide fait à base du soda. Kossiwa s’approvisionne du nécessaire deux fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de soda et des bidons d’huile. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Kossiwa aura plus de recettes et pourra faire face aux charges de la famille et préparer la scolarité de ses enfants pour la rentrée prochaines.
texts.en:
The mother of two children, Kossiwa is a married woman who lives in Tokoin. Kossiwa, aged 52, struggles hard to earn her living by producing liquid soap made with soda. She stocks up on the necessary ingredients twice a month at the market and is asking for this loan to order some bags of soda and tins of oil.

With the profit margin that will come of the loan, Kossiwa will bring home more income and will be able to cover the family expenses and make everything ready for her children to go back to school.

loans.use: to buy three bags of soda and one jerrycan of oil to use to make liquid soap.

loans.name: Akouyo

texts.fr: Akouyo est une femme âgée de 34 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Akouyo est une marchande de produits alimentaires  qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Akouyo désire ce crédit pour financer son achat de paniers de tomates fraîches en vue de tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Akouyo is a woman aged 34 who lives in Tokoin. Married and the mother of four children, she sells foodstuffs and stocks up twice a month at the market, selling her goods in front of her house.

Akouyo wants this loan to cover her purchase of baskets of fresh tomatoes to make a profit and earn more income so she can better contribute to the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy six baskets of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en:
Farzona is a single, clever girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1997. She is living in big district with her family. Her mother is a nurse and father is a teacher.

She studies at University and gets excellent marks. She is capable, active, and responsible and goal oriented student. She wishes to finish her studies and find a good job to support her parents and be helpful to Tajikistan. She is asking to get a loan to pay her education costs of university. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her education costs of university.

loans.name: Silvana

texts.en:
Silvana is a 41-year-old single lady. Six years ago, she started working as a hairdresser to cover the needs and expenses of her family that consists of four members. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is well known among her region. 
Due to the increasing living costs, Silvana's income is not enough anymore. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her necessary dental treatments.
Silvana hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her necessary dental treatments

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo is a 49-year-old man from Ajuy, Iloilo. He is married and has four adult children. His eldest child is 20 years old and still in college. Eduardo is engaged in the fishing business to earn a living. He has been doing this for almost 30 years. Aside from fishing, he also buys and sells gasoline to have extra income. Eduardo works hard to provide for the needs of his family. He is asking for a loan to buy materials for fishing such as fishing net, fishing knot and fishing weights. He also buys gasoline to sell. In the future, he wants to have a new boat for fishing to help him increase his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fishing knot, fishing weights and gasoline.

loans.name: Chaghaf

texts.en: Chaghaf is a 24 year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents. Her mother and brother are the income source in the family in order to fulfil their family needs and improve their lifestyle. She doesn’t work as she is only focusing on her education at this time. Today, she is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her technical study fees. Pursuing her education suitably will make her very happy and help her secure a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay her technical study fees

loans.name: Yosra

texts.en:
Yosra is a 45 year old woman living with her husband and five children. She cooperates with her husband to fulfill the family needs. In 2013, she started her business by opening in her house a small room where she sells make up, perfumes, accessories, using her special selling skills and providing a high quality of products. She is well-known in her region with the unique objects that she offers, in addition to her friendly personality.

Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, to increase her inventory to meet the needs of her clients. In the future, she hopes to open her own shop.

loans.use: to increase her cosmetics and perfumes inventory.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta operates an auto repair shop with her husband as the chief mechanic. She is 56 years old with 5 adult age children whom most of them have their own family. She manage to send all of them to school until they graduated college through her business ventures. Marietta makes it to the point she have to save money for the repayment of her loan so that she can maintain her good membership with Paglaum MPC. Recently, she loan an amount of PHP 30,000.00 to buy additional industrial oxygen tank and air compressor for auto repair business.

loans.use: to buy additional industrial oxygen tank and air compressor for auto repair business

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en: Peregrina has a business buying and selling crabs and shrimp in a local market and in neighboring towns. She earns an income of approximately 10,000 PHP per month. She and her fisherman husband provide for their family, especially for their children who are college students. Recently, she requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy additional supplies of crabs & shrimp to sell.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of crabs and shrimp to sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 46 years old. She is married and has three children.

Her business is tailoring. She has been in this business for 20 years.

She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings. This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to buy a sewing machine. She will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 51 years old. He is married and has three children.

His business is farming. He has been in this business for 15 years.

He earns a monthly income of eight thousand Kenya shillings. This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya.

He will use the loan to buy a water tank. He will use the profits from the expanded business to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Carolina Lisset

texts.es:
Carolina, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en una Alcaldía Municipal como fontanero desde hace 8 años, tienen dos hijos y los dos están estudiando.

Carolina, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años, dicha actividad la realiza en algunos cantones y caseríos cercanos a su comunidad y lo hace varios días a la semana; esta actividad la aprendió gracias a una amiga que le enseño las rutas para salir a vender.- Carolina, tiene que caminar una distancia de un kilómetro cada vez que sale a vender, pero los deseos de llevar el sustento a sus hijos, son los mejores incentivos que ella tiene para no desanimarse en dicha actividad.

Este crédito Carolina lo necesita para comprar más mercadería como ropa y calzado, porque la mayoría de sus clientes solicitan que les deje la ropa al crédito y hay momentos en que ella necesita efectivo para continuar comprando más mercadería.

Carolina, sueña con darle una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carolina, 40 years old, studied until the ninth grade, is in a relationship and her partner has worked for the municipality as a plumber for 8 years.  They have two children, who are studying.  Carolina has made a living selling clothes for many years in some districts and villages near her community.  She works several days every week.  She learned this profession thanks to a friend who taught her the routes in order to go out and sell.  Carolina has to walk one a distance of one kilometer each time that she goes out to sell, but her desire to ensure the livelihood of her children is her greatest motivation that keeps her from getting discouraged with this profession.

Carolina needs this loan to buy more merchandise, such as clothing and footwear, because the majority of her clients are requesting that she sells them the clothes on credit and there are times when she needs cash to continue to purchase more merchandise.  Carolina dreams of providing her children with a good education and of improving her house.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as clothing and footwear

loans.name: Ana Yasari

texts.es:
La Joven Ana de 25  años de edad, vive con su mamá y su hermana en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 5 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería,. vive en San Lorenzo, en una  aldea al sur de Honduras.
Ana es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería como frescos, churros, frijoles, arroz,  lácteos, jabón, pollo, papel, embutidos, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio,  bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Agosto del  2015
texts.en:
Ana is 25 years old and lives with her mother and sister in their own home. She has made a living selling groceries for five years. She lives in San Lorenzo, in a village in southern Honduras.

Ana is an enterprising woman with wishes of getting ahead and fights every day to improve her quality of life. She is requesting a loan to buy products to stock her grocery store, such as soft drinks, churros, beans, rice, milk, soap, chicken, paper, sausage, etc. With the help of this loan, she intends to improve her income as well as her quality of life. She is a client with desires of working with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good, well-stocked business, and at the same time to improve her future together with her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, churros, beans, rice, milk, soap, chicken, paper, sausage, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jill

texts.en: Jill has been into dried fish selling business for 9 years. She finds this business profitable and easy to sell knowingly she got supplier at the cheapest cost. She vends her dried fish to the neighborhood and even reached other barangays doing this type of business activity. She has high demands especially during non-fishing season (fishing ban once every month during full moon) that she asks a loan from Paglaum MPC. She loan an amount of PHP 6,000.00 to buy additional dried fish for buy & sell business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish for buy & sell business

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 40 years old. She is married and has 5 children. Her business is a restaurant. She has been in this business for 4 years.

She earns a monthly income of thirty five thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, maize, flour etc. for cooking in the restaurant.

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, maize, flour etc. for cooking in the restaurant.

loans.name: Belenda

texts.en: Belenda is a hardworking mother that she's willing to do everything for her only child who is in school age. She vends various snacks to their place and even reached neighboring barangays selling her snack products. She's been doing well on her choosen business that she wants to increase her production. Unable to fund her business expansion, she asks for a financial assistance from Paglaum MPC where Belenda is an active member. The amount that she loan shall be used to purchase ingredients like bags of flour, sugar, milk, cheese, butter, cooking oil, leavening and other.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like bags of flour, sugar, milk, cheese, butter, cooking oil, leavening and other

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Copra production has been the life of Jesusa. She is 67 years old, widow with 8 adult age children. She has been into this type of business for 35 years and had provide her sufficient income for her family needs. She needs additional capital that she applies for a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase coconut for copra production.

loans.use: to purchase coconut for copra production

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita, 54 years old, from Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte, finds a good source of income from recycling old rubber tires and interiors. She buys used rubber tires and recycles them into new products such as plant pots and garbage containers. It’s a good way of transforming unusable things into useful products. It’s a prolific business, but her only difficulty is the unstable supply of rubber and high cost of raw materials. Sometimes she cannot meet the demands of customers due to insufficient stocks. She intends to buy a volume of used rubber tires and interiors as raw materials for her business, when she acquires enough capital. She is requesting a loan for PhP 15,000 to secure the continuous operations of her business. With this, she will be able to boost her income and sustain the needs of her family of six children. If her business grows steadily, she can attain her dream to put up a presentable shop and slowly acquire a lot where she can build a decent house for her family. She and her husband Felipe, her business partner, wish to bestow a stable business to their children after they finish their college education.

Lita meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy volume of used rubber tires and interiors as raw materials for her business

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirian, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja con una moto-taxi realizando viajes en los alrededores de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tienen dos hijos, de los cuales solo uno de sus hijos asiste a la escuela.

Mirian, es propietaria de una pequeña tienda ubicada frente a su casa, donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como bebidas, golosinas, granos básicos, etc. dicho negocio lo inicio desde hace varios años por iniciativa propia y por el deseo de darle a su familia lo necesario para vivir.- Cuando ella tiene que salir a hacer algún trámite su mamá se encarga del negocio y el horario de atención de Miriam, es de lunes a domingo de 08:00 a.m a 05:00 p.m.- Anteriormente, también vendia ropa, pero ahora solo se dedica a la tienda.

El crédito que Mirian está solicitando es para comprar más mercadería como pan, café, bebidas, detergentes, cloro, arroz, frijoles, embutidos y lácteos.- Porque muchos de sus cliente buscan algunos productos que ella no tiene.

Mirian, sueña con darles una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda, principalmente colocar piso, porque actualmente es de tierra.
texts.en:
Mirian, 28, completed ninth grade, is in a relationship and her partner has worked with a motorcycle taxi making trips in the vicinity of where they live for several years. They have two children, of which only one attends school.

Mirian owns a small shop located in front of her house, where she sells all kinds of staple products such as drinks, snacks, staple foods, etc. She started this business several years ago on her own initiative and due to the desire to provide her family with essentials. When she has to go out to take care of some errand her mother tends the store. Mirian’s store is open Monday through Sunday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 pm. Previously, she also sold clothes, but now she only works at the store.

The loan that Mirian is applying for is to buy more merchandise such as bread, coffee, drinks, detergents, bleach, rice, beans, sausages and dairy products, because many of her customers seek some products that she does not have.

Mirian dreams of giving her children a good education and improving her house, principally installing a floor, because the current floor is made of dirt.

loans.use: buy more merchandise such as bread, coffee, drinks, detergents, bleach, rice, beans, sausages and dairy products.

loans.name: Gladness

texts.en:
Gladness is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
Gladness has  operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Gladness dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Meybel Damari

texts.es:
Meybel, de 36 años de edad, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja vendiendo frutas y verduras, tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos trabajan y dos estudian.

Meybel, tiene seis años de dedicarse a vender frutas y verduras, peor también se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos, ella vende en los cantones vecinos.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar una novilla para criarla y engordarla, de esa manera espera mejorar el nivel de vida, porque en el futuro tendrá más ingresos. 

Su sueño es comprar un carro, para así poderse desplazar en toda la zona.
texts.en: Meybel, 36 years old, has a partner who works selling fruits and vegetables.  She has four children, two of whom work and two who are studying.  Meybel has made a living selling fruits and vegetables for six years, but she also makes a living raising cattle and pigs, which she sells in the neighboring districts.  She needs this loan to purchase a heifer to raise.  By doing this, she hopes to improve her quality of life by having a higher income in the future.  Her dream is to purchase a car in order to travel around the whole region.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer to raise

loans.name: Enso Nyame Group

texts.en:
The member belongs to the Enso nyame group, located in Teshie, Accra-Ghana. They have businesses that sell soft drinks, smoke fish, utensil and hair wigs, creams and shampoo.
Gloria continues working at her business selling soft drinks. She has been selling soft drinks for 11 years. She has had the business for some time and it is satisfying for her on a personal level. Gloria is responsible woman who is married and has three children. She wants to continue working in order to keep on supporting her family. Gloria and her colleague are applying for a loan in order to buy hens and more. Gloria is grateful for this loan and promises to make the repayments. The other members of the group are doing very well in their respective businesses.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks from the wholesalers and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Manoj Kumar

texts.en:
Extra efforts, all-nighters, and sacrifices are always worth it when it come to studies because studies are the only sure way to improve one’s quality of life. Manoj Kumar is well aware of this because he has always counted his goal as becoming a good engineer. Now he has reached the last step in completing his degree and entering the working era that any professional lives in.

Manoj Kumar is asking for a loan amount of 40,000 INR to pay off his engineering course fees and accomplish his dream. He also hopes to become a famous civil engineer, and in the long run, to establish his own technical firm.

This enthusiastic young man of only 18 years urges young people to make an effort to reach for their dreams because, just like him, they can get ahead.

loans.use: to pay off his engineering course fees.

loans.name: Souhad

texts.en:
Souhad is a 39-year-old widowed mother of three. Twelve years ago, she started preparing and selling "Mouneh" to cover her family's increasing needs and expenses. Souhad is the only breadwinner of her beloved kids and she is always trying hard to provide them with a better life.
Souhad is well known among her region for her tasty "Mouneh". She is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary foodstuff (yogurt, groats, Sumac, Sesame, etc..) to increase her production and satisfy her customers' special requests.
Souhad hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary foodstuff (yogurt, groats, Sumac, Sesame, etc..) to increase her production

loans.name: Cordelia Bih

texts.en:
She is married and the mother of five children. They all live in a three-bedroom house in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has been through difficult moments due to the lost of her loved one, inadequate finance to start up a business of her own and cater for her family's needs, and being attacked by armed robbers.

With this new loan requested she will buy shoes, rubbing oil, mesh, hair products, lipstick, body spray, bathing soap, secondhand shoes, earrings and handbags. She is optimistic that the business will succeed because she has been doing it for a long time, she has a good business site and she treats her customers well. With this business activity, the community will benefit from quality products, moderate prices and she will contribute to development by paying her taxes.

With the profit made from this loan, she will expand her business site, pay her children's school fees and save some in order to provide medication for her family. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. Members also share their experiences and ideas, also constant EC utilization checks.

loans.use: to buy shoes, rubbing oil, mesh, hair products, lipstick, body spray, bathing soap, secondhand shoes, earrings and handbags.

loans.name: Poder De Dios Group

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora es la coordinadora del Grupo ¨Poder de Dios¨, casada, y con un hijo de 9 años y esperando próximamente a su segundo hijo. estando con ADIM 25 ciclos, nuevamente solicitan crédito para poder desarrollar mas su negocios. Dedicada a la preparación y venta de nacatamales y a la comercialización de plátanos. Quien le ayuda en la venta de estos productos es su mama, ahora invertirá en la compra de hojas, maíz, cerdos y plátanos. Así su producción sera mayor y cubrirá la demanda de la clientela. Las demas socias son Elsa de 60 años, quien ofrece servicios de comideria y vende leña. Y Georgina de 46 años quien compra y vende pan.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is the coordinator for the group "Poder de Dios" (Power of God). She's married and has one 9-year-old son and is waiting for a second son soon.

She has been with ADIM for 25 cycles and is once again asking for a loan in order to build her businesses more.

She makes a living by preparing and selling nacatamales (a traditional Nicaraguan food similar to the tamale) and bananas. Her mother helps selling these products, and Maria will invest in the purchase of blades, corn, pigs, and bananas. Thus, her production will improve and she will be able to meet her clients' needs.

The other members are Elsa, 60, who runs an eatery and sells firewood, and Georgina, 46, who buys and sells bread.

loans.use: to buy blades, corn, pigs, and bananas.

loans.name: Cosma

texts.en: Cosma is married with six children. He deals in crude salt and fishing.These two sources of income help him procide for his family needs. He hopes to increase his income and be a whole seller of crude salt only to be challenged by high license  fees charged on salt miners. At the moment Cosma wants to stock more salt but the money he has is not sufficient. He requests a loan for more money to stock enough salt and meet his clients needs so that his income level can improve.

loans.use: to stock enough salt and meet his clients needs

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 40 years old and married. She is blessed with two children, aged nine and five years old. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last 10 years, earning a monthly profit of KES 10,000.

Monica has applied for a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase dairy feeds for increased milk production. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy dairy feeds for increased milk production

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a diligent mother of three children. She is the wife of a baker man. He works day and night so that he can earn enough to fulfill the needs of his family. He wants to provide quality education and a bright future to his children.

Currently, the required materials for the bakery are finished and need a refill. He is facing many financial issues because of which he is unable to pay for monthly bills and school fees of his children, and fulfill the daily basic needs.

Samina wants to help her husband; therefore she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help her husband to continue generating income. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bakery items for her husband's bakery business.

loans.name: Anani

texts.en:
Anani is from the capital of Georgia. She is a 39-year-old divorced woman who takes care of two children alone. She works as a private nurse and gets 250 GEL fixed income every month. However, she finds it really hard to satisfy even her children's basic needs and requires an additional source of income.

According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Anani has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions for the country's poor people, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

Anani will go to Turkey and purchase various kinds of clothing and will start selling them at increased prices in her community. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will increase significantly. Anani will be able to create better living conditions for her children and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothing and start trading.

loans.name: Fazeelat's Group

texts.en:
FAZEELAT is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.
For a long time, he has wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body. Because of this, he is unable to attract passengers due to the ugly looking vehicle and to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of the new rickshaw body.
Therefore, FAZEELAT has requested for a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of the rickshaw body. This will help him to continue his business.
FAZEELAT will be thankful to Kiva and it's field partner BRAC, Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 46-year-old married mother of three children. Eight years ago she opened her tailoring shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She has professional skills in this domain and is well known in her region.

Siham is trying hard to develop her business; thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy an updated tailoring machine and raw materials (cotton thread, etc.).

Siham hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of satisfying her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an updated tailoring machine and raw materials (cotton thread, etc.).

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 60 years old. He is married and has two children.

His business is farming, buying and operating a posho (flour) mill.

He has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand Kenya shillings. This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya.

He will use the loan to buy bags of maize to mill and sell the flour.

He will use the profits from the expanded business to renovate his house.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business to bring a big and steady income.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to mill and sell the flour

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is 39 years old and married with two children. He sells shoes and does farming. With the previous loan, he was able to buy shoes to sell. This business worked very well for him, and he is grateful for the funds, having increased his profits from 40,000 shillings to 60,000 shillings.

Josephat has also been able to save some money, and he wants to construct a house for his family. However, he lacks some funds to meet his budget. He requests a loan to buy metals, timber, and softwood to add to his materials and construct a house.

loans.use: to buy metals, timber, and softwood to add to his materials and construct a house.

loans.name: Ta Mwat Gyi Village Group

texts.en:
This loan from Proximity Designs will help 22 members, expand their duck farming business. Win, a member from Ta Mwat Gyi Village Group, has intended to purchase feeds and store them. He has three children, all of them are married and working by themselves. He mostly spend his days raising crops and raising ducks. The couple has also planted seasonal vegetables which are sold at the village or town's market. As grandparents, they want their grandchildren to be well-educated and reach graduation.

Win expects all businesses to run smoothly and have good results this year. Also, he wishes the weather to be good, so that no devastation happens at his paddy field. Win's wife has goals of expanding farm acres for both businesses.

Pictured above are some members from Ta Mwat Gyi Village Group, named Win, Tun, Tun M, Zaw and San. Ta Mwat Gyi is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region where the men mostly focus on crop farming and raising ducks.

loans.use: to purchase high quality feeds

loans.name: Jhonny Luis

texts.es: Jhonny un joven estudiante de 24 años de edad soltero vive con sus padres. Actualmente estudia la carrera de ingeniería mecánica entrando al segundo ciclo. Decidió estudiar dicha carrera por tener gran demanda en el mercado laboral. Solicito el crédito para el pago de matrícula y pensión de estudios. El deseo de jhonny es de poder terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyarlo y promete poner mucho empeño en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jhonny is a 24-year-old student, he is single and lives with his parents. He is currently studying a degree in Mechanical Engineering and is starting the second cycle. He decided to study this degree for being in great demand in the job market.

He is requesting the loan to pay university and boarding fees. Jhonny wishes to be able to succesfully finish his degree. He is grateful to all Kiva lenders for supporting him and promises to put a lot of effort in his studies.

loans.use: to pay university and boarding fees.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is 22 years old and single, and started two years ago selling hot drinks through a small van he owns to make his living.

He is an ambitious man, who puts a lot of effort in developing himself, and he is working hard to improve his business to reach his dreams.

His income is fine, but not good enough to expand his working sector. Thus, as a step forward, Moustafa is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to open his own cafe and expand his working sector in addition to diversifying his provided services.

He is very optimistic about this new business and he hopes to keep on developing it.

loans.use: To open his own cafe and expand his working sector in addition to diversifying his provided services

loans.name: Mirador Del Comején Group

texts.es:
Grupo ¨Mirador del Comején¨, esta por primera vez solicitando crédito a los miembros de KIVA, para el mejoramiento y crecimientos de sus negocios. Coordinado por Esmelda de 41 años, soltera, y con dos hijos de edades 10 y 5 años, quienes lucha el día a día para brindarles sus derechos y condiciones económicas mejores. Dedica a la comerciliazacion de cosechas de frutas como nancite, mamón, y limones desde hace 15 años. ahora requiere del préstamo para la compra de cosechas de mamón, jocote, nancite, limón agrio. Así podrá aumentar su venta y poder brindarles trabajo a otras personas. 
Las demás socias son Susana, de 43 años dedicada a la venta de madera, y leña. Dalila, 22 años dedicada a la compra y venta de cosecha. Idalia de 25 años comercializa frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The Group “Mirador del Comején” is requesting a loan from the Kiva members for the first time in order to improve and grow their businesses.  It is being coordinated by Esmelda, who is 41 years old, single, and has two children who are ten and five years old, for whom she fights day after day to give them what they deserve and improve their economic situation.  She has made a living selling fruit crops such as nancites, mamones and lemons for fifteen years.  Now, she needs this loan to purchase mamón, jocote, nancite, and lime crops.  This way, she will be able to increase her sales and provide other people with jobs.  

The other members are Susana, who is 43 years old and makes a living selling wood, Dalila, who is 22 and buys and sells crops, and Idalia, who is 25 and sells fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase mamón, jocote, nancite and lime crops

loans.name: Keep Smiling - N10Kp5Đsơnbsơn Group

texts.en:
Năm is 61 years old and is married with two children. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for more than 10 years.

Năm lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoá province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. Also, the income from this business is unstable because when some disease happens to poultry, they could die, which would leave her nothing to sell, so she would be in trouble with her finances.

The main hardship that Năm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future. This is Năm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her life standard.

She is the group leader of the Keep Smiling - N10Kp5Đsơnbsơn Group, which consists of four members. With her business profit, Năm hopes to maintain  a successful business, and she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: William Alexander

texts.es:
William, de 37 años de edad, está acompañado, estudio hasta bachillerato, su pareja realiza oficios domésticos y tiene un solo hijo que por su temprana edad aún no asiste a la escuela.

William, se dedica a la carpintería desde hace muchos años y esa ha sido su fuente de ingresos desde siempre.

William, necesita el crédito para comprar materiales para la carpintería como madera, clavos, pegamento, entre otros. 

William, suela con colocar su propio taller de carpintería.
texts.en:
William, 37, is in a relationship, he completed high school, his partner is a homemaker, and he has just one child, who due to his young age is not yet in school.

William has worked in carpentry for many years and that has been his source of income forever.

William needs the loan to buy materials for carpentry such as wood, nails, and glue, among other items.

William dreams of setting up his own carpentry workshop.

loans.use: buy materials for carpentry such as wood, nails, and glue, among other items.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna has been a sari-sari store owner for more than ten years. She is 59 years old and lives in Baybay, Leyte. She is married with four adult children and her oldest child is 20 years old and in college. Her husband works hard as a driver and she also earns additional income by raising pigs.

Edna is asking for a loan to buy additional grocery items such as chips, candies, biscuits, noodles, eggs, spices, cooking oil, sugar, powdered milk and powdered juice, mosquito repellent, napkins, deodorant, toiletries and soft drinks for her store. In the future, she wants to improve her business so that it becomes sustainable.

loans.use: to buy chips, candies, biscuits, noodles, eggs, spices, cooking oil, sugar, powdered milk and powdered juice, mosquito repellent, napkins, deodorant, toiletries and soft drinks

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a 38-year-old married father of 4 children, who works hard to support his family. He is a Security Guard and his wife is housewife. Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of their daughter’s education.

This loan of $600 will allow Alberto to send his daughter, Clara Lopes, to post-secondary school. She will use the loan to pay for tuition and school supplies. They loves them daughter very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's tuition and school supplies.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 27 year old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and three siblings. Despite the bad circumstances, she is doing a great effort in cooperation with her father to be able to satisfy the family’s needs.

She owns a grocery store since 2010. And today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase food provisions to increase her business sales as well as her income. She is an optimistic person always aiming for the best and plans to receive more Kiva loans with the coming years to keep on improving her family’s standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase food provisions

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli has been running her store for many years. She is able to provide for the needs of her children and send them to school with the help of her husband. After five years of operating the business, she wants to offer the best items that she can to her customers. She requested a loan to purchase a wider variety of useful items to sell to provide for the needs of her customers.

Noli's plan for the future is to save money for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Babelyn

texts.en:
Babelyn is 27 years old and has four children. She is maried and three of her children are in school.
