Babelyn is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Babelyn requested a 3,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Babelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 27 years old woman living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of a daughter and her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years, but for the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to replace the rickshaw body.

However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost for the body. Therefore Saima has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost for the body of the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Saima is so much thankful to Kiva and brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to use this loan to purchase the body of an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
Lucy has operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over seven years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Lucy dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is 40, years old woman, living in Lahore, Pakistan, with her three sons and one daughter. she has been running his own clothing business for 6 years. She needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these clothes.

Therefore ALIA is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can purchase these clothes in bulk for her business. She can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
ALIA is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory in bulk for her clothing business.

loans.name: Nakahan Group

texts.en: Somphu understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Somphu knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Somphu purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Somphu is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 48-year-old single lady, the sole breadwinner for another member of her family. She has been working in Mouneh production and sales since 2008, and she is expand it properly by diversifying her products.

Zeinab is a hardworking lady, well known in her region with her special prices and quality of products she presents.

Through an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, Zeinab will buy necessary Mouneh needs to get ready for customer requests.

Hopefully, Zeinab will work on expanding her business and will manage to make the necessary maintenance on her house to use it for future development.

loans.use: To buy necessary Mouneh needs to get ready for the customers requests

loans.name: Saed Eddine

texts.en: Saed Eddine is a 22-year-old single young man who became employed 3 years ago to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and an ambitious man. He is still continuing his studies despite his limited salary. Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his university tuition fees. Saed Eddine believes that education is the only way to build a better future.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees

loans.name: Señor De Muruhuay Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “señor de muruhuay” conformada por 05 socias responsables y honradas. Ella es mahalda una de las socias de 55 años de edad casada con 4 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de medicina naturista desde hace más de 10 años que tiene dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de poder techar su casa. Solicito el crédito para la compra de más medicina natural. El grupo “señor de muruhuay” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Mahalda es la segunda del lado derecho viste chompa color negro
texts.en:
This is the new “Señor De Muruhuay” group, made up of 5 responsible and honorable members.
Mahalda is one of the partners, 55 years old, married with 4 children. She has had a business selling natural medicine for over 10 years. Her greatest desire is to put a roof on her house.

She applied for the loan for the purchase of more natural medicine. The “Señor De Muruhuay” group is grateful to the Kiva lenders who made this loan possible, because it lets her continue improving. Mahalda is the second on the right side, wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: buy more natural medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fabric, thread, elastic, lace, etc. to make skirts, dresses and pants and to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is married with three children and resides in Sapang Dalaga with her family. For many years she has worked with her vegetable garden to earn a living. She has to support the needs of her family's daily expenditures. She also has to send her children to school. 

Recently, she requested a new loan to purchase fertilizer for her garden to be able to provide good quality vegetables to her customers. Conception's plan for the future is to save more money to improve the quality of life they have.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is aged 28, married, and supports two children .

She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last seven years, earning an income of KES 15,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase animal feed and nappier grass for her cow in order to meet her client demands, which have increased in the market. The surplus will be used to add a dairy cow.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and nappier grass for her cow in order to meet her client demands which have increased in the market; the surplus will be used to add a dairy cow.

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is aged 42 years old, married and supports 2 children.

She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 17 years earning an income of KES 15,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase animal feeds and nappier grass for her cow, in order to meet her client demands, who have increased in the market and the surplus to add a dairy cow.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and nappier grass for her cow in order to meet her client demands who have increased in the market and the surplus to add a dairy cow

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is 24 years old married and blessed with two children aged five and two years old.

She is a farmer and she grows maize and vegetables which earns her a monthly income of Kshs. 12,000.

She has been farming for the last five years. Lydiah has applied for a first loan of Kshs. 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya intends to purchase fertilizers and seeds for planting.

The anticipated profits shall be used in paying back the loan.

Her future plan is to engage in large scale farming to earn enough for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Joachim

texts.en:
Joachim who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda used his previous loan to buy more cattle. He still operates a butcher shop and works for six days a week. He also gets more income from coffee and maize farming and has been farming for more than 10 years.

Through his hard word, he has managed to pay school fees for his children and has also built a permanent residential home.He believes hard-work keeps him active but also does not believe in dependence on his children. A good father he is, he is committed to the task of educating all his children up to degree level as a minimum qualification. His customers are the people surrounding him.

He has a good plan of expanding and developing his business into a modernized farm in order to get more income to fulfill his dreams but like other businessmen, his main challenges are price fluctuation and inadequate capital.

Joachim is seeking for a loan to buy more goats and cows to sell.

loans.use: to buy more goats and cows to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a single woman but has no child. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. In addition she also operates a butcher and grocery business that earns her additional income.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize  flour, beans and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es casado tiene 53 años de edad. Trabaja como guardia de seguridad en turno nocturno, desde hace tiempo le diagnosticaron cataratas. No ha podido tratarse debido a la carencia de recursos . Esto no le permite desempeñarse en su trabajo como debería y  ha sido advertido de que puede perder su trabajo.
texts.en:
He's 53 years old and married, and he works as a security guard on the night shift.

Some time ago he was diagnosed with cataracts. He hasn't been able to get the treatment he needs because he lacks the money. This prevents him from carrying out his job as he should, and he has been warned that he could lose his job.

loans.use: to pay for eye treatment

loans.name: Chaung Pyar Village Group

texts.en:
Win from Chaung Pyar Village, a member from the group aims to purchase duck feeds from Proximity's loan. Win has four children and all them are married and working by themselves. Duck farming is her second business but as it has covered most of family's cost, Win plans to expand certain business. Profits from duck business will be financed to her main business, crop field. She is very warm-hearted and works very hard to succeed her goals.

This loan will help 22 members to purchase ducks and high quality feeds. Duck raising has recently been very popular in Myanmar and a way to boost income in rural areas. Ducks growers work very carefully to be kind to their ducks as it affects the egg production rate.

Pictured above are some members from Chaung Pyar Village Group, named Win, Ti, Yar and Mon. Chaung Pyar is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region where most households focus on crop farming and raising ducks.

loans.use: of 22 to purchase high quality feeds for her ducks.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is aged 37 years old and married; she is supporting four children .

She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 17 years, earning an income of KES 15,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer for top dressing her crops. This will help her to meet her client demands, which have increased in the market. The surplus will be used to add a dairy cow.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer for top dressing her crops to meet her client demands, which have increased in the market; the surplus will be used to add a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lesbia Ruth

texts.es: Lesbia, 42 años, acompañada y responsable de 1 hijo de 11 años quien cursa la primaria. Esta con ADIM 5 ciclos, nuevamente solicita crédito para seguir emprendiendo y recibir ganancias que le ayuden a aportar a los gastos familiares de su familia. Ella tiene su negocio de venta de ropa nueva quien comercializa ropa de forma ambulante desde hace 7 años con dinero que le proporciono su esposo. Ahora invertirá en la compra de blusas, pantalones, ropa interior para damas y caballeros. Así tendrá disponible mercadería nueva para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en: Lesbia, 42 years old, is in a relationship and cares for one eleven-year-old son who attends elementary school.  She has been with ADIM for five loan cycles and is once again requesting a loan in order to continue pursuing her work and to make a profit that will help her cover her family’s household expenses.  She has a business that sells new clothes that she has marketed as a street vendor for seven years with money provided by her husband.  Now, she will invest in the purchase of men’s and women’s shirts, pants and underwear.  This way, she will have new merchandise available to offer to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase men’s and women’s shirts, pants and underwear.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a resident of Tondo Manila, Philippines. She is already 53 years old and owns a variety store for eight years now that has been one of their source of income. A variety store, is also known as “sari-sari store” in the Philippines. Most housewives are engaged on this type of business since this can be done at the comfort of their own home while taking care of the family and doing the house hold chores as well. A sari-sari store is a smaller version of a supermarket where you can buy cheap items since products here are being sold by piece, volume or by kilo. Teresa enjoys earning while at home with her family.

Teresa is working hard to sustain their day-to-day expenses, with the help of her husband, Pacifico who’s earning by driving a motorized tricycle. Teresa is grateful of having a responsible husband like Pacifico. Not all the time the business gives good profit since there are also competitors in the same area which she consider a challenge in the business. Aside from grocery items, Teresa also aims to add more products for her variety store business like school supplies, fruits and vegetables, mineral water and Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG).Since customers are more attracted if a variety store offers complete items.

Teresa has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and other products for her variety store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add cereals in order to meet her client demands, which have increased in the market; the surplus will be used to add a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn has been working hard cultivating her vegetable garden. For five years she has made a good profit, and because of this she is able to send her children to school with the help of her husband who works as a carpenter. She has borrowed previously and repaid her loan. 

Recently, she requested a new loan to purchase fertilizer for her garden in order to produce good quality vegetables for her customers and to deliver them to the market that will generate more income. 

Jelyn's plan for the future is to save more money for the educational needs of her children when they go to college and also to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Reynalda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store and farming rice.  Reynalda is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients like meat, fish, chicken meat, spices, flour, cooking oil and other utensils for her food production business for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Reynalda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, chicken meat, spices, flour, cooking oil and other utensils for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Sonia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Sonia works hard to support her family.

She has a ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store.  Ma. Sonia is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like dresses and shirts for her business.

Ma. Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like dresses and shirts

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja junto a él en el mercado y tiene dos hijos que estudian en la escuela. 

José, vende frutas y verduras en el mercado desde hace 5 años. 

Él necesita el crédito para comprar más frutas y verduras.

El sueño de José, es tener un puesto más grande en el mercado y percibir mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
José, 34, finished ninth grade, is in a relationship and his partner works with him in the market, and he has two children who attend school.

José has sold fruit and vegetables in the market for 5 years. He needs the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. José’s dream is to have a larger booth at the market and earn a higher income.

loans.use: buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: St. Joseph Ombachi School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Andrew. He is the Head teacher of St. Joseph's College Ombachi, a boy's school in the Urban area of Arua with 1000 students. St. Joseph's Ombachi School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Joseph's Ombachi School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Andrew ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. .

loans.name: Juan Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Juan de 34 años edad, vive con su esposa y sus hijos tiene casa propia  y vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica a su negocio que es la venta de verduras desde hace 16 años y sus clientes son sus amigos y vecinos de su comunidad.
Don Juan es un hombre trabajador con muchos deseos de salir adelante esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de papas, plátanos, chiles, cebollas, cilantro, yuca, etc. para poder surtir su negocio y ofrecerles a sus clientes más productos y satisfacer la demanda que tiene asimismo  espera obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
Su sueño es mejorar más su vivienda.
                 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto 2015
texts.en:
Juan is 34 years old, lives with his wife and children, and has his own house.  He lives in a village of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  For 16 years, he has made a living selling vegetables, and his clients are friends and neighbors from his community.

Juan is a hardworking man with a strong desire to get ahead.  He is requesting the loan to purchase potatoes, bananas, chili peppers, onions, cilantro and yucca to be able to stock his business and to offer his clients more products and meet the demand that he has.  He also hopes to make the money he needs to get ahead with his family.  His dream is to improve his house.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, bananas, chili peppers, onions, cilantro, yucca, etc. for his business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a mother of three school-going children in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a business buying and selling cocoa which she has operated for five years.  During that time she has faced challenges like price changes caused by the seasonality of cocoa and competition from other cocoa dealers. 

She is determined that through her hard work she will be able to expand her business by buying more cocoa plantations to harvest and sell. She wants to use this loan to buy more cocoa to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is a 28-year-old young man from the city of Tbilisi. His father is an invalid and his wife is temporarily unemployed. In order to generate some income for his family, Levan works as a baker at a private bakery. His income isn't enough to meet daily costs and Levan decided to start his own business and earn more income. He wants to improve his family's living conditions.

After several unsuccessful attempts, Levan applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of a Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva. It permits poor people to start or re-start businesses.

Levan will rent a place and purchase the necessary equipment for his own bakery. He will start working in his own and get the chance to increase productivity.

The loan will be great support to this hard-working and motivated man, as he has great experience and will lead the business in a profitable way. Levan and his family members rely on the good will of the lenders.

loans.use: To start his own business and open a bakery

loans.name: Jazmin Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jazmín, de 29 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos. 

Jazmín, trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace 3 años y de esa manera ayuda a su familia. 

Jazmín, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono y pesticidas para sembrar maíz.

Jazmín, sueña con darle una educación adecuado a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jazmín, 29, is married and has two children. She has been working as a maid for 3 years and in this manner helps her family.

Jazmín needs the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to plant corn. She dreams of giving her children a suitable education.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pesticides to plant corn.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.pt: A Srª Dulce é  casada, mãe de 3 filhos  menores mas com idade escolar,ela e o marido vivem na base de conta propria nunca trabalharam em nenhuma empresa,ela vende no  mercado grossista de Maputo e o marido é pintor de profissão mas nunca teve sorte deser  empregado numa empresa. A vida não tem lhes sido facil por isso a senhora Dulce teve que recorer aos emprestimos da hluvuku.É a terceira vez que pede emprestimo,com o dinheiro vai comprar blocos,cimento,barotes e chapas de zinco.O seu maior sonho é ter uma viatura pessoal para facilitar a mobilidade da sua familia.
texts.en:
Dulce is married and has three young children, all of whom are in school. She and her husband have always worked independently and have never worked for anyone else. Dulce sells goods at a wholesale market in Maputo and her husband is a painter by profession but has not been lucky enough to find work with a company.

Life has not been easy for Dulce and her family and for this reason she has had to take out loans with Hluvuku [Kiva Field partner]. This is her third loan with Hluvuku and she plans to use the money to buy blocks, cement, wooden beams and zinc plates. Her dream for the future is to have a vehicle of her own to help her family with their transportation needs.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, wooden beams, and zinc plates.

loans.name: Prosper

texts.en:
Prosper is a 30-year-old married man with 2 children, one attends school. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He also takes care of a relative who serves as a domestic worker in their home. He grows crops to get food and income for his family. He also teachers to supplement his earnings. He has distilled local brew for more than 5 years.

He would love to educate his children and build a good residential home but he does not have the capital to fulfill his vision.

He needs a loan of 3,500,000 UGS to buy manure and pay laborers to clear his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure and pay laborers to clear his banana plantation.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 58-year-old married woman with 3 children .

She has been a small-scale farmer for 10 years and earns 15,000 KES per month.

She has applied for 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase items and a dairy cow to meet her client's demands.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to eradicate poverty

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosa Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa de 33 años edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa propia, vive en la aldea la Cuesta  y se dedica a su negocio de venta de pan desde hace 07 años sus clientes son las personas de la comunidad y personas vecinas.
Doña Rosa es una mujer trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, azúcar, manteca, huevos, leche, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende surtir y mejorar su negocio y de las ganancias que obtenga espera poder mejorar su vivienda.
Doña Rosa uno de sus sueños es poder realizarle mejoras a su casa y que esta se mire más bonita.


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del  2015
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old, and lives with her husband and children in a home they own. She lives in the village of Cuesta, and has made her living selling bread for 7 years. Her clients are people from the community and neighbors.

Rosa is a hardworking woman with big desires to move forward. She is seeking a loan to buy corn, sugar, shortening, eggs, milk, etc. With the help of the loan she hopes to stock up and improve her business. With the earnings she obtains she hopes to be able to improve her house. One of her dreams is to be able to make improvements to her house and make it look nicer.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2015

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, shortening, eggs, milk, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “RETO AL FUTURO”.
El  socio es el  Sr. Claudio; el socio sigue con el negocio de compra y venta de repuestos  y a la vez brinda servicio técnico de electrodomésticos, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le  va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio es una persona responsable, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.
El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
 El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “RETO AL FUTURO” [Challenge to the Future] communal bank.

The member is Don Claudio; he continues with the business of buying and selling spare parts and he also services household appliances. He has been in this business for some time and it is going well, thanks to the effort that he puts into his business each day. He is a responsible person, in this manner supporting his family.

He is thankful for and values the loan awarded through this channel and he likewise commits to making the payments within the established time period. The member is applying for the loan to buy tools, among other items.

loans.use: buy tools, among other items.

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt: A Srª Laura vive com seu esposo, 3 filhos e 1 neto esses todos na sua responsabilidade,o esposo é desempregado,faz alguns biscatos em algum momento, ela trabalha num orfanato como mãe educadora, o seu salario não é suficiente para cobrir com as despesas da casa,vive numa casa pequena e precisa ampliar a mesma para o bem estar da sua familia sendo assim teve que recorrer a um emprestimo no banco hluvuku para comprar cimento para fazer blocos. O seu maior sonho é de formar seus filhos profissionalmente. o maior desafio é o custo elevado do material de construção.
texts.en:
Laura lives with her husband, three children, and one grandson, all of whom depend on her financially. Her husband is unemployed but finds work sometimes doing odd jobs.

Laura works in an orphanage helping to raise the children there, but her salary is not enough to cover all the household expenses. The family lives in a small house and they need to add onto it in order to improve their quality of life. For this reason, Laura is taking out a loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner] that she will use to buy cement to make blocks with.

Laura's main goal for the future is to have her children educated so that they can become professionals, and her biggest current challenge is how expensive construction material is.

loans.use: to buy cement in order to make cement blocks.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is a 45-year-old woman who lives with her two daughters in the city of Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. Gayane’s husband goes regularly to the Russian Federation to work abroad. He returns every three months and brings money to cover the needs of his family. Gayane does her best to take care of their cute farm, which is a source of income for her family. She has cows, calves, bull and chickens. She sells her farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product), curd, cheese, meat, and eggs. Gayane’s elder daughter is a student and incurs tuition fees. Gayane does her best to earn more money.

Gayane will used the loan to buy a cow and also fodder for her cattle. She hopes that a larger farm will be of great help to meet the family’s numerous needs.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fodder.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 64-year-old married woman with 5 children .

She has sold cereals for 18 years and earns 15,000 KES per month.

She has applied for 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase additional supplies of assorted cereals.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to eradicate her poverty.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of assorted cereals.

loans.name: Marisela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maricela, de 27 años de edad, actualmente es empleada y está acompañada, su pareja  se dedica a la agricultura, tienen un hijo que por su corta edad no asiste a la escuela. 

Maricela, junto a su esposo trabajan en la agricultura para cubrir los gastos de la casa. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono, pesticidas y herbicidas, entre otros, esto lo necesita para poder sembrar granos básicos. 

Maricela, sueña con darle estudio a sus hijos para que se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
27-year old Maricela currently works as a servant. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. They have a son who does not attend school as he is too young. Together with her husband, she also works the land to cover the cost of household expenses.

Maricela needs a loan to buy compost, pesticides, and herbicides etc. so she can grow basic grains. Her dream is to provide a good education to her children so they are well-prepared academically.

loans.use: buy compost, pesticides, and herbicides etc.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
This nice woman’s name is Ani, and she is 44 years old. She lives with her retired parents in Sevan, a city in the Gegharkunik region. Ani graduated from Gavar State University's Faculty of Russian Language and Literature.

Having started when she was 25 years old, Ani works at the school as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature. She mentions that she likes her profession and her everyday work with her pupils. At her house, she also gives paid private courses as many pedagogues do, helping the pupils to prepare for entrance exams.

Now Ani asks for this loan of 700,000 AMD (Armenian dams) in order to buy a computer, accessories for it, and also professional literature for use in the courses she gives at her home.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it, and also professional literature for use in the courses she gives at her home.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.pt: O Sr Roberto  trabalha numa companhia de produção de cana sacarina,é casado e pai de 3 filhos cuida tambem dos sogros que vivem  com ele,o seu salario não é suficiente para pagar todas suas necessidades assim viu a necessidade de solicitar um emprestimo para comprar motobomba e insumos agricolas para iniciar com a produçao de orticulas.O seu maior sonho é tornar se um grande produtor de orticulas .O seu maior desafio é estar a viver longe da sua familia pela natureza do trabalho.
texts.en:
Roberto is married and has three children, and also helps care for his mother and father-in-law who live with the family. He works for a company that produces sugarcane but his salary is not enough to cover all of the families expenses.

For this reason, Roberto is asking for a loan to buy a pump and other agricultural supplies so that he can begin to farm vegetables. His plan for the future is to grow vegetables on a large scale, and his biggest current challenge is that he has to live apart from his family because of the nature of his work.

loans.use: to buy a pump and other agricultural supplies in order to begin farming vegetables.

loans.name: Mujeres En Acción De Fhiladelfia Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “MUJERES EN ACCION DE FHILADELFIA” y está conformado por 07 socias responsables. Jheisy  de 26 años de edad es soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su bodega desde hace más de 06 años que tiene su bodega. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida gracias al préstamo podrá implementar más su negocio. Su último crédito lo destinará para  la compra de arroz azúcar menestras .su mayor deseo es poder ampliar su negocio. El grupo “MUJERES EN ACCION DE FHILADELFIA” agradece a las personas de kiva por hacer posible éste crédito. JHEISY SE encuentra en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado derecho y viste casaca color marrón.
texts.en:
The Women in Action in Fhiladelfia group is made up of seven responsible women.

26-year old Jhelsy is single and earns her living selling groceries from her store which she's had for six years. With a lot of effort she has managed to improve her standard of living. With this loan she will be able to further expand her business. Jhelsy plans to buy rice, sugar, and vegetable soups. Her greatest wish is to grow her business.

The Women in Action in Fhiladelfia group is grateful to Kiva lenders who make this loan possible.

Jhelsy can be seen in the back row of the photo, second on the right, and wearing a brown jacket.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, and vegetable soups

loans.name: Bunyansaigi Abagambakamu Group

texts.en:
Enid is a member of Bunyansaigi Abagambakamu and its members guarantee each other in order to access a loan.

She is a widow with 6 children, they living in Fort Portal Uganda. After the death of her husband, she started a business to sell second-hand shoes, with a loan. She has had the business for two years and hopes to take good care of her children. Enid has asked for a loan to buy second hand shoes to sell.

She wishes to expand her business in order to earn more money and educate her children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to buy second hand shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her tea plantation.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 38 years old married and supports a family of four people.

Her children are sixteen, eleven and eight years old. She has been into horticultural farming for over ten years earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 15,000 and she intends to buy seeds and fertilizers to help her in planting.

Her future plan is to educate her children to higher education levels.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to help her in planting.

loans.name: Arusyak

texts.en:
Arusyak is 62 years old and she lives with her husband in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. She graduated in accounting from college and for many years she worked as an accountant at different private organizations.

Now Arusyak with her retired husband is fully engaged in farming and agriculture. They have two children and they are already married and they live with their families. Arusyak has large farm where she takes care of cows, a calf, a bull, pigs, sheep, lambs and chickens. From the farm she sells a lot of milk, macun (national dairy-product), meat, cheese, curd and eggs.

Arusyak likes her farm, and cares for the cattle in it very much and together with her husband she does all the work with great pleasure. She would like to make her farm richer with cattle and she decided to ask for financial help from Kiva lenders.

With a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams Arusyak would like to buy two more calves for her farm and also fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two more calves for her farm and also fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 26 years old, married and supports one child.

She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 10 years earning an income of KES 13,000 per month.

Rose has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her nappier grass in order to meet her clients' demands which have increased in the market.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and the surplus to buy a dairy cow for milk production.

Her hopes and dreams are to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy certified  fertilizers for top dressing her nappier grass.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 59 years old and she is a widow. She lives alone in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. Her two children are married and they live now in the Russian Federation with their families.

Since she has been alone, Anahit became devoted to farming and agriculture. Now on her farm she has cows, calves, bull, pigs, sheep and chickens. On her plot of land she cultivates potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers. She sells her farm products (milk, cheese, meat and eggs) and her land’s harvest at the city’s wholesale market during the week.

Anahit wants to enlarge the assortment of dairy products. With this aim with the Kiva loan she wants to buy one more cow and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a farmer and a local brewer. He has been doing well in his businesses, but of late he is facing a problem of banana pests and the banana bacterial wilt disease. The pests have eaten up his banana plantation and affected his brewing business badly.

Robert has been advised by a veterinary doctor to cut the whole plantation down, spray them with pesticides and plant new tubers under fertilizers, to reduce the infection. However Robert does not have enough money to do so. He therefore requests a loan to buy farm inputs and improve his productivity.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and improve his productivity.

loans.name: Giga

texts.en:
Giga is a 25-year-old lawyer from the city of Rustavi. His wife is temporarily unemployed. Giga earn 500 GEL from his work and he desires another source of income.

Giga has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Giga plans to open a learning centre for Spanish. He will hire a teacher to instruct pupils on the Spanish language. GIga will renovate the place and also purchase all needed equipment. The clients will be local people and the business will generate additional income.

The loan will greatly assist Giga and his family. He will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better lifestyle. He awaits Kiva lenders' support and kindness.

loans.use: to open a language-learning centre for the Spanish language.

loans.name: Benenego

texts.en:
Benenego is a 42-year-old man with four children. He takes care of his parents and 3 children. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He grows crops and works for 4 days per week. He has raised cattle since 2004 and gets milk to sell.

He has been able to look after his family and attain a good standard of living. He is responsible for educating his children and expanding and modernizing his coffee plantation.

He is a first time borrower in Hofokam and wants a loan to buy manure and pay laborers to clear his farm. His main challenge is bad weather and long droughts which affect the coffee and bananas crops.

loans.use: to buy manure and pay laborers to clear his farm.

loans.name: Kilesi

texts.en:
Kilesi is a 28-year-old married man with 2 children who has farmed for 2 years.

He will use the loan to purchase farm inputs and hopes this will help him buy livestock.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to help him buy livestock

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married with four children. She operates a retail shop. However, she is lacking enough stock to compete for market favorably. This exposes her to being out competed because customers demand what she does not have.

Her greatest desire is to educate her children, which she cannot do with the lower income she is getting now. She requests credit to buy soft drinks and bags of sugar among others for selling and improving her family livelihood.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and bags of sugar for selling.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
In Kapan city of Syunik region lives Silva with her husband, two children and her husband’s sister. In the family only Silva and her husband are employed. Silva graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute, the faculty of Arts. She is a very intellectual and wise woman. She used to works as a guide at the museum. Now she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature.

Silva is greatly engaged in a self-development process and as she says she reads a lot and she is always looking for any new literature that may be useful in her teaching process. She also greatly wants to take part in training courses (the courses are paid) of teaching methodology that are regularly organized in the regions for the pedagogues, in order to inform them of the innovations and changes in the teaching process.

So she will be very thankful if she will manage to receive this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams which she will use to pay for the training course. She also wants to buy a computer which is also nowadays very necessary equipment for any pedagogue.

loans.use: to do a training course and to buy a computer which is also nowadays very necessary equipment for any pedagogue.

loans.name: Lydya

texts.en:
Lydya is 24 years old, married with four children.

She has been in the agricultural sector for the last 13 years. Right now her earning per month is KES 17,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase an additional cow for milk production.

She would use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams for her future is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase an additional  cow for milk production.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: BUSHRA is a 40 -years old married woman, lives with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with the scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sell it to the recycling factories. Nowadays due to household expenses he does not have amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for getting money. Therefore, BUSHRA requested a loan for her husband, so that he could buy scrap goods such as waste papers, iron, and plastic accessories, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. She is very impressed with this  support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy recycle goods such as waste papers, iron, and plastic accessories for her husband

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is married, with 3 children. He is a teacher by profession and also does farming for additional income. Through these two sources, Musa is able to meet his family needs, and also to save money for future developments. Musa wants to construct himself a residential house, but the challenge is he does not have enough money. However, if Musa is given a loan he can meet his budget and also pay back the loan  promptly, without any hassle. He is a committed man; when he wants something, he goes for it. He requests a loan to buy construction materials, like cement, stones and timber, to build his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, like cement, stones and timber, to build a house.

loans.name: Narbeda

texts.en:
Narbeda is 53 years old and lives with his wife, son and daughter-in-law. Narbeda cultivates rice together with his son for the care of their family.

Narbeda finances his fertilizers and pesticides for his rice production through Seva MFI and always repays his loan on time.

He now wants to renovate his house and asks for a loan of SRD 10,000. With this loan, he will replace the old roof and old walls of his home and will paint the house completely.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 30 years old married and supporting a family of two children aged eight and six years old.

She has been in poultry farming for the last two years earning a monthly income of Kshs. 5,000.

Joan has applied for a loan of Ksh. 10,000 as her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and plans to buy poultry feeds and increase her chicken stock.

The anticipated profits she plans to pay back the loan on time.

Her dream is to become a big supplier of chicken in town.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam used the previous loan to buy coffee seeds for planting. He is a farmer growing crops like tomatoes, Irish, onions and coffee. He started this business with a hope of earning an income for his family and his clients describe him as a hardworking man who supplies them quality seeds.

He faces challenges of price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes that destroy his crops and reduce his overall profits.

Sam is looking forward to having different sources of income in order to have a stable flow of income. Sam is requesting a loan to pay for labor to clear land for the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for labor to clear land for the planting season.

loans.name: Carnota

texts.en:
Carnota is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carnota is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Carnota has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines. Carnota requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

Carnota has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Carnota would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 61 years old and married with five children. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, biscuits, candies, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, candies, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc.

Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, biscuits, candies, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is 36 years old and she lives in Geghi village of Syunik region. Kristine is divorced and she lives with her mother and school-aged son. She is a very active and laborious woman and she is always looking for some work, some other way of earning more money for her family and to provide better living conditions for her single son.

Kristine’s mother works at the school and she also works at the same school as a librarian. Simultaneously she is engaged in gardening; on her plot of land she established a nice orchard and has planted there a lot of sweet and tasty fruit trees. She sells the harvest locally. She has persimmon, apple, apricot, grape, pear, peach and plum trees. She also cultivates corn on her land and sells it with her fruits assortment.

She mentions that she is happy that despite of great hardships in her private life and hardships of bringing up her son without his father she is strong enough to overcome and solve all the problems on her life's way.

Now Kristine is asking for this loan amount of 600,000 Armenian drams as she wants fence her fruit garden and also she will repair the irrigation pipes of her garden.

loans.use: to fence her fruit garden and also repair the irrigation pipes of her garden.

loans.name: Philista

texts.en:
Philista is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
Philista has operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over three years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Philista dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Pricila

texts.en:
Pricila is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a  house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.In addition she also operates a car wash business operating in the near by town.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 53 years old and married with five children.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Anita has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Anita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 30 years old and has three children. She is married, and two of her children are currently in school.

Bernadeth is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Bernadeth has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Bernadeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is 52 years old and married with four children. With two children still in school, Conception works very hard to provide for them.

Conception runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Conception has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as chocolate drink, milk, detergent soap, candies, noodles, etc.

In the future, Conception would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as committed. She operates a cold store retail business where she sells fish, chicken, and other meats. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be capital to buy enough stock to sell to her customers. She will use the GHS 3,500 to buy more fish, chicken, and other meats, which she will sell to her customers. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her sixth loan with ID-Ghana Micro finance. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more fish, chicken, and other meats, which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is 48 years old. This woman is not married and lives alone in Gagarin, a village in the Gegharkunik region. Armine has two higher education degrees: first she graduated from Sevan city’s university, from the Faculty of Economics, and then she graduated from Gavar State University's Faculty of History.

From 1998 till today, she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian History. Since she lives alone, she is greatly devoted to her pedagogical work and to her pupils, and she pays special attention to the quality of her work. With her pupils she works properly and particularly, and she always emphasizes the importance of knowledge of the history of the Armenian people, their national heroes, and their achievements.

Armine asks for this loan as she wants to buy a computer, accessories for it, and also some professional new literature; all of these will make her pedagogical work more informative and interesting for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it, and also some professional new literature; all of these will make her pedagogical work more informative and interesting for her pupils

loans.name: Vigilance

texts.en:
Vagilance is a married woman who has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. School fees are her greatest monthly expense.

Vagilance has operated a poultry-selling enterprise for over five years. Disease outbreaks causing losses are her biggest business challenge.

With this Kshs 30,000 loan, Vagilance wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Donald

texts.es: Donald es un hombre muy trabajador, que se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Solicita un préstamo de cuatrocientos mil colones (₡400 000), dinero que será utilizado para aumentar el número de animales en su finca y de esta manera incrementar los ingresos provenientes de esta actividad.
texts.en: Donald is a very hard-working man who works raising cattle. He is requesting a loan of four hundred thousand colones (400,000 CRC). He will use the money to increase the number of animals on his farm and in this way increase the revenues derived from this business.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is single and has one child, a senior high graduate. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, Christina has been selling soft drinks in a kiosk close to her residence. Fluctuation in the number of her clients is her major business challenge.

With this GHS 2,000 loan, Christina wants to purchase more soft drinks to sell. She dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Avita

texts.en:
Avita is 50 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Avita has a plastic bag-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Avita has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business.

loans.name: Mukisa Devt - Masajja Group

texts.en:
Nulu is a repeat client with UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. She is applying for a loan of UGX 400,000. She is a widower with children.

She is a businesswoman who owns a food stall. In a bid to increase her working capital/expand the business, she has applied for a loan of UGX 400,000 to increase her stock of foodstuff to sell to her customers. This will help her to increase her profit. It will also help her to overcome the challenge of competition.

She is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to sustain her business.

The sixth person at the extreme left is from the UGAFODE credit staff.

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chicks

loans.name: Nueva Jerusalem Yepocapa Group

texts.en:
San Pedro Yepocapa is located south of Guatemala City at the base of the “Fuego” (Fire) Volcano. The people who live here are Maya Kakchiquel and hold fast to their customs and traditions. A majority of the women dress in their beautiful typical outfits.

Norberta or as she is commonly called, Berta, is an active participant and the Treasurer of the Trust Bank “Nueva Jerusalem Yepocapa”. She was widowed six years ago and is the sole parent and supporter of 11 children. Thanks to the success of her fruit selling business, as well as the earnings from her small convenience store, Berta has been able to successfully support her large family. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more products for the store including oranges, pineapple, watermelon, cookies, soft drinks and other supplies. Berta is quite motivated to be successful and meet the daily needs of her children. She wants each of them to enjoy a good education and is quite proud that one has already reached high school. She looks forward to watching her daughter graduate.

Although Berta and most of her 10 friends in the Trust Bank did not have the opportunity to attend school, they are most aware of the value of education. They look forward to their monthly meetings when they not only make payments on their loans but also participate in educational trainings with a Facilitator from Friendship Bridge.

Gratitude to Kiva lenders for their interest in Berta and the women in the the “Nuevo Jerusalem Yepocapa”. They are already taking small steps toward a brighter and more prosperous future benefitting themselves, their families and their community.

loans.use: to purchase more products for the store including oranges, pineapple, watermelon, cookies, soft drinks and other supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Marleny

texts.es:
Rosa, de 39 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja como seguridad pública, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos van a la escuela del cantón. 

Rosa, trabaja vendiendo tortillas y pupusas desde hace 5 años y quiere colocar su negocio propio. 

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar una plancha para hacer tortillas.

Su sueño es que sus hijos se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Rosa, 39 years old, never had the opportunity to study in school. She is married and her husband works in public security. She has three children, two of whom attend school in the canton.

Rosa has worked for five years selling tortillas and 'pupusas' (a popular Salvadoran fast food). She wishes to have her own business.

She needs the money from this loan to purchase a new flat griddle for making tortillas.

Rosa's dream is for her children to be prepared academically.

loans.use: buy a flat griddle for making tortillas.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is a basket weaver from Maribojoc, Bohol. She makes and sells native baskets made of buli (palm) . She has been weaving baskets for almost ten years now. She earns 2,500 PHP a month out of that livelihood.

She is 58-year-old married woman with two grown children. Her husband is a farmer. The photo shows the materials used for weaving baskets in front of Dioscora .

She has a requested a loan to buy material like nito (dried palm), buli (palm) and uway (used for binding). She would like to improve her earnings by weaving more baskets in order to cope with the higher prices of commodities nowadays. Thus, her income will grow and she she can start to save. Also, she she can start to invest in possible business opportunities.

She is hopeful that her livelihood will be successful to improve the living condition of the family.

loans.use: to buy material like nito ( dried palm), buli (palm) and uway (used for binding)

loans.name: Glenys

texts.en: Glenys, who is originally from the Dominican Republic, immigrated to the United States 10 years ago.  Here she met her husband Carlos who had a family business of repairing household appliances like refrigerators, dishwashers, washers, and dryers.  Since meeting and getting married, Glenys has helped Carlos expand the business to include buying, repairing, and selling old refrigerators.  Glenys manages this side of the business full time while Carlos still does at-home appliance repairs full time.  Glenys now needs extra funds to purchase more used refrigerators.  She will fix them up like new and sell them to her growing customer base to help her continue to provide for her three children.

loans.use: To buy more used refrigerators to repair and sell

loans.name: Los Toles Group

texts.en:
In a rural area of Quiché, located in the Western part of Guatemala, the trust bank “Los Toles” thrives. Humble women who maintain strong determination to contribute to the daily survival of their families and offer better opportunities for the lives of their children make up this group.

A year ago, this group of women had the benefit of receiving a microloan, through which they have gradually seen growth and establishment of their businesses. Micaela, a 61-year-old woman who has never been to school, commented that she has definitely seen this kind of change in her business. Micaela runs her business with the objective of improving her family's quality of life, embroidering and weaving traditional Guatemalan “huipiles”, or blouses, napkins, and “perrajes”, large cloths used for carrying babies and goods. With the new loan that she is requesting, this intelligent woman will buy more products, such as different styles and colors of better quality thread, which she can use to embroider more blouses, napkins, and cloths. For extra income, Micaela has been able to run another side business raising and selling chickens and pigs, and this has proved successful. Micaela has been married for 40 years, and her husband is a farmer who plants and sells corn and beans. She has seven children, and together with her husband, Micaela has been able give her children education through secondary school.

These women are astonished by and very grateful for loving people around the world who generously supply the capital for their microloans.

loans.use: to buy more products, such as different styles and colors of better quality thread, which she can use to embroider more blouses, napkins, and cloths.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
She is an industrious woman from Mariboc, Bohol. Her name is Emelie. She is 39 years of age. She is a married woman with three dependents. Her eldest child is 19, while the youngest is eight.

She earns a livelihood by weaving baskets made of palm. To augment her income, she would like to avail herself of a loan.

Emelie has requested a loan to buy materials like nito, uway and buli. Those are all native palms, but vary in form. With the presence of these, she can weave and sell more baskets. It will enable her to provide for the needs of her family. In addition to that, she can continue finance the schooling of her three children for their brighter future.

She can also expand and manage her business well to become productive and successful in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy materials like nito, uway and buli.  Those are all native palms, but vary in form.

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.en:
The historic Maya Sakapultek city of Sacapulas is in the far northwest of Guatemala, in the state of Quiche (pronounced “Key-che”). The surrounding area is filled with lush, green forests and mountains whose natural beauty has been preserved. Although the climate is quite warm, there is enough irrigation to maintain the health of the forests. There is also a very active local market.

Seven very hardworking and dedicated women borrowers of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Amigas Unidas” meaning “United Friends,” take advantage of the great market in their area. They sell their diverse products there, such as traditional foods, typical sweets, sandwiches and bread. Some members have stores, where they sell snacks and other daily food items. One member is has an animal husbandry business.

It is also a group of women whose backgrounds are quite diverse. Some are single and some have families and children, with an average of four per member. Most importantly of all, they each are willing to take risks in order to expand their small businesses to improve their incomes, which then makes it possible for their families to have a brighter future!

With only a third grade education, 42-year-old Maria has a mini-mart, where she sells snacks and other foods needed on a daily basis. She established her business some time ago, and invested time and money to assure its success so that she could provide an education for her five children. Maria is asking for a loan to buy sugar, salt, corn, coffee, eggs and rice to increase her inventory in order to meet the demands of her customers.

Each month, Maria enjoys the meetings where she participates with her Trust Bank companions, learning how to invest her income wisely, how to do her own bookkeeping, and how to provide good customer service so her customers will return and bring new customers. These educational trainings are part of the Friendship Bridge “Microcredit Plus” Program (microloans and education), that has proven to be a successful pathway for the women to empower themselves and eliminate poverty in their lives.

Thank you KIVA investors for providing the funds to help the Maya women like Maria achieve a brighter and more successful future!

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, corn, coffee, eggs and rice to increase her inventory at her mini-market.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is 46 years old and married with six children. She ventured into hog raising to support her husband in raising their children, especially now that two of her children are in college. She signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC and applied for a loan to capitalize her business. She successfully repaid her loan and has availed successive loans for the same purpose. This time, Mariam availed her 11th loan in an amount of PHP 14,900 to buy additional heads of piglets and animal feeds.

loans.use: to buy additional heads of piglets and animal feed.

loans.name: Yvette Faz

texts.en:
Yvette is busy managing her hardware store in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old and single with two school age kids. She is doing well in her business, and a part of her profit was spent on building her new house. She is also a member of Paglaum MPC, and had availed herself of previous loans that supported her existing business.

She wants to complete the construction of her house, and she asks for a loan of PHP 50,000.00 from the cooperative. The amount will be used to buy sand, gravel, bags of cement, iron rods, hollow blocks and other things for house completion.

She hopes that she can manage to pay her obligations without default to maintain her good membership status.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, bags of cement, iron rods, hollow blocks and other things for house completion.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is making a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She is 56 years old and married with three adult age children.

She never gets tired of tending her store. Elpedia has a passion for selling, and she earns a small income from it that is sufficient to support her needs.

Elpedia is a full fledged member of PMPC, and applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventory and sales. Elpedia continues to look for better business opportunities, which is proof that she is determined to pursue her goals.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Mary Salome

texts.en: Mary Salome is 36 years old and single from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a sari-sari store (convenience store) that is her primary source of income. Through this business activity, Salome is able to support the needs of her parents and her younger siblings, especially on their studies. She is grateful that she is a member of Paglaum MPC, which provides her financial assistance in the capitalization of her existing business. Currently, she is availing a loan to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, condiments and confectioneries.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, condiments and confectioneries.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: The success of children is the success of the parents. Jocelyn has successfully sent all her children to school until they finished college and have landed a good job. She fills the needs of her children through her buy and sell business that sufficiently supports her family's needs. It is also through the help of Paglaum MPC as her business partner that she never runs out of capital. Jocelyn is on her way to constructing her dream house. She asks for a loan from the cooperative to buy bags of cement, plywood, sticks, and nails for completing her house. She hopes to live comfortably while spending her prime age together with her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement, plywood, sticks, and nails to complete her house

loans.name: Diodora

texts.en: Diodora is on her way to renovating her house. She wants to improve her general living condition by having it renovated from ground up. She asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC to buy sand, gravel, bags of cement, wood, and nails for house renovation.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, bags of cement, wood, and nails for house renovation

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a 60-year-old widow with eight adult children. She is a businesswoman who ventures into various business activities just to sufficiently support the needs of her children. She signed up for membership with PMPC in order to access its financial aid to small time entrepreneurs like her. She manages her account well, evident on paying her obligations on time. Recently, she asked for a loan from the cooperative to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Judit

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RETO AL FUTURO”.
La socia es la Sra. Judit; La socia sigue con su  negocio de brindar servicio técnico para todo tipo de electrodomesticos,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio e cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio ,la socia es una persona responsable ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas entre otros.
texts.en:
Judit is a member of the "Challenge of the Future" communal bank.

Judit continues to operate her business, offering technical services for all types of domestic electrical appliances. She has had the business for a long time. She believes it is doing well, thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. Judit is a responsible person, and she wants to be able to continue working in this manner in order to continue providing help to her family.

Judit is requesting a loan to purchase equipment, among other things.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and other things her business needs.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is a farmer from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years old and married with two kids of school age.

He has availed himself of various loans from Paglaum MPC to head into the next cropping season. He is borrowing PHP 20,000.00 to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Roditha

texts.en:
Roditha is in the hog raising business in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, single and an active member of Paglaum MPC.

She gained financial access to the cooperative, and started a business. She busied herself in this business venture because she wanted to help her relatives, especially with their schooling.

Recently, she has availed hereself of a loan from the cooperative to buy additional piglets and animal feeds.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and animal feeds.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel, 37 years old, is very responsible toward her household obligations, and she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and one child in Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

She is a farmer, focusing on rice farming. She wants to increase her crop yield on her rice farm. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase bags of fertilizers for her farming operation, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 63 years old and has four children. She has coco producing land that she cultivates and integrates other commodities for more income. Norma plans to graze cows on her farm. She approached PMPC to buy more head of cows for dispersed grazing. She wants to take advantage of the high demand for beef cows. In the future, Norma hopes to sustain her business and would love to open an eatery.

loans.use: to buy more head of cow for dispersed grazing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural products in order to meet client demand that has increased in the market and to add a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
O sr Pedro tem 34 anos de idade, casado e pai de uma menina que não tem idade escolar. Vive em casa propria e nao sustenta mais ninguem.
Trabalha como motorista numa empresa de transporte. Solicita o emprestimo pela segunda vez e pretende comprar material de construção como: cimento, varões, pedra, área, tinta para dar continuidade da sua obra. Sonha em concluir a sua casa de modo a melhorar as condições habitacionais e confortar a sua família, assim como melhorar as condições da dieta alimentar. O desafio é de reembolsar o empréstimo em entrar em moras.
texts.en:
Pedro is 34 years old. He is married with a small daughter who doesn't go to shool yet. He lives in a house that he owns and he doesn't support anybody else.
He is a driver for a transportation company. He is asking for his second loan to buy construction materials such as cement, rods, stone, sand, paint to continue building his home. 
His dream is to finish construction and improve his living conditions as well as his family's, and he also wants to improve their food diet. His goal is to pay this loan on time without delays.

loans.use: to buy cement, rods, stone, sand, paint to continue building his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, rods, stone, sand, paint to continue building her home

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin has spent his lifetime in farming. He has mastered the craft of farming, including land preparation, seed bed preparation, planting, pre-harvest and post-harvest management and operations. He's been doing well with these activities, and generated enough income to send his two children to school until they finished college and landed good jobs.

Despite the fact that he need not to till his land because he receives support from his children, he is still willing to do the same routines in farming because staying idle and doing nothing for himself makes him feel like an unproductive citizen. So, just recently, he asked for a loan for farmers like him to purchase bags of fertilizers and corn seeds.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and corn seeds

loans.name: Akouvi Marie

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Akouvi est une femme âgée de 32 ans résidant à Tokoin. Akouvi est une revendeuse de pains et des fruits qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à dans les quartiers environnant et à domicile.
