Akouvi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des tas de pains et de mangues afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en: Akouvi is 32 years old, lives in Tokoin, and is a married mother of two children. She sells bread and fruit, which she purchases three times a month from the market and sells from her home, as well as in nearby neighborhoods. She is asking for this loan to buy bread and mangoes so that she and her husband can educate her children and pay for daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy 7 bags of bread and 6 packages of mangoes.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is on her way to renovating her house in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She wishes to live comfortably in a decent house so she asked for a loan from PMPC. The amount shall be used to buy sand, gravel, bags of cement, galvanized iron sheets, sticks and nails. Her loan will be paid through the proceeds of her retailing business.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, bags of cement, galvanized iron sheets, sticks and nails

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos has been in the farming business for almost forty years. He is also an active member of Paglaum MPC, where he has availed himself financial assistance for his farming activities.

Through this, he receives an approximate income of PHP 36,000.00 quarterly. Recently, he took out a loan of PHP 50,000.00 to pay for land preparation and to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Ignace

texts.fr: Agée de 24 ans, Ignace est un jeune homme célibataire qui vit à Tokoin. Ignace est un dépanneur de portables et ordinateurs qui s’approvisionne des plaquettes cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend à une société. Pour commander des plaquettes de téléphones et d’ordinateurs, Ignace nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de faire face aux charges qu’il éprouve dans sa famille.
texts.en: Ignace is a young, unmarried 24 year old who lives in Tokoin. He is a telephone and computer repairman who buys motherboards five times a month at the market and resells them to the public. He needs this loan to supplement his supply of telephone and computer motherboards and achieve a good profit margin so that he can afford his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 15 telephone motherboards and 10 computer motherboards.

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia has been in the corn production business for 15 years. She is 69 years old, and a widow with one adult-age child. Despite her age, Eustaquia still finds joy in doing farming activities. Farming for Eustaquia is her daily exercise. This is what makes her alive that she wants to wake up and do her daily routine from her house up to her farm.

Recently, she requested a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase bags of fertilizer. She believes that having enough supply of fertilizer will give her good produce.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Toriano

texts.en:
Toriano is 46 years old, singe, and from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is a rice farmer and this is his primary source of income. He has been in this type of business for a long time.

Toriano has expanded his rice farming, producing bulk rice grains. He is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC, through the loan program intended for farmers like him. The amount that he loaned shall be used to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn is 33 years old, and married with four children of adult age. She is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has been a hog farmer for ten years, and it gives her an approximate income of 5,000 PHP every month. She is also an active member of Paglaum MPC, which provides her the needed capital for her business.

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of animal feed and vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Clotelda

texts.en:
Clotelda has started her small time business and became a boss with her sari-sari (general) store. She has managed to have enough inventory, and rolls up her capital to gain more profits. Every day she has made good sales since she is the only store in her village.

Recently she approached Paglaum for much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel runs and operates a retail store in Dipolog City, which gives her sufficient income for her needs and those of her immediate family. She is 42 years old, single and has been in this type of business for 15 years.

Maricel recalls how she started her business with only 500 PHP in her pocket. She never thought that she could build her own store and have more inventory for retail. She signed up for membership with Paglaum in 2008, and accessed financial and non-financial services that helped her successfully run her business.

Recently, she requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to restock her store with canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, detergent bar and bath soap.

loans.use: to restock her store with canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, detergent bar and bath soap.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Amivi est une femme mariée âgée de 56 ans résidante à Tokoin. Mère de deux enfants, Amivi est une revendeuse des produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Amivi désire ce prêt pour commander des cartons de cannettes et de biscuits. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Amivi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation.
texts.en: Amivi is a married 56-year-old mother of two children living in Tokoin. She sells food products, and she buys her merchandise at the market twice a month. She sells her products at a shop she runs out of her home. She is requesting this loan to order packages of cans and cookies. With the profit margin that she will earn, Amivi hopes to improve her business, provide a good education for her children, and help her family flourish.

loans.use: to buy 8 packages of cans and 8 packages of cookies.

loans.name: Aimé Liva

texts.fr:
47 ans, mariée, Aimé Liva est une mère de trois enfants de 22, 25 et 28 ans. Deux de ces derniers sont déjà mariés. 
Son époux est agent de sécurité chez un particulier. Il vient de subir une opération chirurgicale et a dû prendre des avances sur son salaire et ne reçoit actuellement qu'une petite partie.
De ce fait, Aimé Liva  doit travailler dur, elle dirige un magasin de quincaillerie et ce depuis 1994. Le fonds de démarrage était de 100000 ariary seleument. Donc, l'approvisionnement devait être journalier. Avec ses efforts personnels et la collaboration avec CEFOR, on peut constater certaines évolutions dans son activité. Et elle voudrait encore la développer et l'étendre, son but est de devenir grossiste un jour, construire une maison en dur car celle qu'elle a en ce moment est en bois. Tous ses efforts vont vers la réalisation de ses rêve.
texts.en:
Aimé Liva is 47 years old, married, and has three children who are 22, 25, and 28 years old. Two of her children are already married. Her husband is a security guard residing in the home of a client. He recently underwent a surgical operation and had to take an advance on his salary. He is currently receiving only a small portion of his salary. 
As a result, Aimé Liva has to work hard. She has run a hardware store since 1994, when her start-up costs totaled only 100,000 ariary. She therefore had to restock her store every day. Thanks to her personal efforts and the collaboration with CEFOR, her business has noticeably evolved. She would like to continue to develop and expand her business, and her goal is to one day become a wholesaler and build a permament house, since her current house is built of wood. All of her work is going toward these dreams.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of hardware items.

loans.name: Laurette Aurélie

texts.fr:
39 ans et mariée, Laurette Aurélie est une femme très dynamique et travailleuse. Elle est mère de trois enfants et ces derniers ne fréquentent plus l'école. La dernière l'aide dans l'exercice de son activité. Elle vend des chaussures, des tennis, et des sandales. Elle en possède tant d'année d'expérience car dès son enfance, elle accompagnait et aidait ses parents dans l'exercice de leur activité, la même qu'elle effectue actuellement. 
Elle a pour objectif de développer et étendre son activité, elle voudrait devenir grossiste dans ce domaine de commerce de chaussures.
Grâce à ses efforts et ses bonnes intentions durant ces années, elle est propriétaire de sa maison d'habitation, et son rêve est de construire un magasin ou une boutique de vente des chaussures.
texts.en:
Laurette Aurélie is 39 years old, married, and a dynamic and hardworking woman. She has three children who no longer go to school. Her youngest helps her with her business. She sells shoes, tennis shoes, and sandals. She has many years of experience, since as a child she helped her parents run the same kind of business that she runs now. 
Her objective is to develop and expand her business, and she would like to become a wholesaler in the shoe industry. 
She owns a house thanks to her efforts and her good intentions during these years. Her dream is to build a shoe shop or boutique.

loans.use: to buy ballet flats, tennis shoes, and sandals.

loans.name: Zokirakhon

texts.ru: Эту женщину с очаровательной улыбкой зовут Зокирахон. Ей 48 лет. Она живет в маленьком городке под названием Исфара. Она работает швеей. Семейная жизнь Зокирахон не сложилась и она одна растила своего сына. Сейчас сыну 22 года и он хочет жениться. Зокирахон очень рада за сына. Скоро будет свадьба и им нужно подготовиться к свадьбе. Чтобы провести свадьбу, нужны денежные средства. Зокирахон хочет, чтобы свадьба ее сына прошла на ура. Для свадебных расходов она просить кредит, и надеется, что ее радость разделят и поддержат.
texts.en:
This woman with the charming smile is called Zokirakhon. She is 48 years old, and she lives in a small city called Isfar. She works as a seamstress. Zokirakhon's family life didn't work out, and she raised her son alone.

Now, her son is 22 years old, and he wants to get married. Zokirakhon is very happy for her son. The wedding will happen soon, and they need to prepare for it, but funds are required to put on a wedding. Zokirakhon wants her son's wedding to go off with a bang. She has requested a loan for the wedding expenses, and hopes that her joy will be shared and supported.

loans.use: to put on her son's wedding.

loans.name: Lisela Carolina

texts.es: Lísela tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y actualmente habita en casa de su madre junto a su hijo de 7 años de edad al que con mucho esfuerzo lo está sacando adelante en sus estudios porque quiere verlo que sea una gran persona en la vida, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que se preocupa por llevar el sustento al hogar y que no le falte nada a su pequeño hijo. Lísela se gana la vida en su pequeño negocio de venta de pupusas en el domicilio desde hace 1 año es así como ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, frijoles, quesillo, chicharrón, repollo, tomates,  consomé, manteca y bebidas así poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Lísela is 29 years old. She is a single mother and currently lives in her mother’s home with her 7 year old son. She is striving to get him ahead in his education because she wants to see him become a great person in life. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who is concerned with bringing home nourishment and for her son to not lack in anything.

Lísela has earned her living for the past year from her small business selling pupusas (tortilla stuffed with cheese and meat) from her home. That is how she obtains her income. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: corn, beans, cheese, pork rinds, cabbage, tomatoes, seasoning, butter and beverages so she can have better returns.

loans.use: to invest in: corn, beans, cheese, pork rinds, cabbage, tomatoes, seasoning, butter and beverages so she can have better returns.

loans.name: Adelo

texts.en: Adelo grows various vegetables for a living. He cultivates his own land and has a good harvest that supplies a local market and even a neighboring market. He is an active member of PMPC that primarily supports his farming activities financially. Adelo wants to grab his good fortune by renovating his home. Recently, he requested a loan to buy plywood, sticks, wood, nails, galvanized iron sheets, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.use: to buy plywood, sticks, wood, nails, galvanized iron sheets and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en: Angel is a 66-year-old widower with three adult children from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is a pensioner member of PMPC where he has obtained various loan products that he successfully repaid. Recently, he requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy housing materials such as wood, nails and other supplies for house renovation.

loans.use: to buy housing materials such as wood, nails, and other supplies for house renovation.

loans.name: Lourdes Esperanza

texts.es:
Lourdes, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja como policía, tienen dos hijos y los dos estudian.

Lourdes, se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras en toda la zona, de lunes a viernes, también trabaja con la junta de agua de su comunidad.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar frutas y verduras, de esa manera espera mejorar sus ingresos, su negocio será más grande.

Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y así tener más ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 41 years old, studied through high shcool and is in a relationship. Her partner works as a policeman; they have two children, both in school.

Lourdes earns a living selling fruits and vegetables in a wide area, from Monday to Friday. She also works with the water board in her community.

Lourdes needs the loan to buy fruits and vegetables; in this way she hopes to increase her income since the business will be larger. Her dream is that her business will grow and thus she will have more income for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La socia continua  con el negocio de elaboración de velas ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua elaborando velas para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia  lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de velas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member continues to work in her candle-making business. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She continues to make candles for her customers who ask for them. She has been in this business for years, and it is going well due to the effort she puts into it. This is how she provides for her family.

The member is requesting the loan in order to buy candles, among other things. She feels thankful for the loan and she promises to make the payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy candles, among other things.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a businesswoman in Ozamiz City who runs a food stall primarily selling barbecue. She is making good sales in this type of business. It gives her a monthly income of PHP 15,000 that provides for the needs of her family. Through her business activity, she's able to venture into the motorcycle transportation business wherein her husband is one of the drivers. Fe is grateful for the opportunity that Paglaum MPC offered to her. Now she asks for a loan of PHP 50,000 to add to her capitalization of her existing food business. The amount will be used to buy meat and other ingredients for her barbecue business.

loans.use: to buy meat and other ingredients for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice is 32 years old and married with four school-aged children who live in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She decided to go into farming to support the needs of her family. However, due to lack of funds she hasn't yet started her farming business. Upon learning of Paglaum MPC and its support extended to small farmers like her, she signed up for membership. Currently, she is requesting a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers and corn seeds for production. With this financial aid, Janice hopes tob have a successful farming business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and corn seeds for production

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: Aurelia is a responsible mother who requests a loan from Paglaum MPC to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel has wide experience in farming. He has mastered farming activities such as growing, caring and harvesting, and has been earning income as well. Manuel has supported his wife doing this type of work.  Like a farmer, Manuel has nurtured his membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. He knows he can always turn to the Cooperative for his financial needs. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds which will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  Someday, Manuel hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds which will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fertilizer, insecticides, etc. as he wants to increase his earnings in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is a businesswoman from Calamba. She is 63 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Nenita is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has had several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Nenita continues to look for better business opportunities, which is proof that she has the passion and energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Chuchi Marie

texts.en: Chuchi Marie is 44 years old and married with three school-aged children from Ozamiz City. She is a government employee and at the same time an active member of Paglaum MPC. She has requested various loan products including insurance services. She manages her account so well that she's always given priority in all of her loan applications. Recently she asked for a loan of PHP 50,000 to pay for her ailing mother's medical expenses. Chuchi Marie is grateful to the cooperative for supporting her financially, regardless of her loan purpose.

loans.use: to pay for her ailing mother's medical expenses.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan has worked as a driver for the past 10 years. He is married and lives in Ozamiz City. His business involves motors for hire and public transport. He does this work to support his needs and his family's needs as well. Allan has asked for a loan to pay for the overhaul and maintenance of his motor unit. He wishes to own another unit to increase his income and to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for the overhaul and maintenance of his motor unit

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa has been running her convenience store for almost 15 years. She started with a small store and initial capital of PHP 3,000 that she got from a loan from Paglaum MPC. She invested that little amount into buying consumable goods that are commonly used in a simple household and she rolled up her proceeds. From that time on, she expanded her little business and added on more products, even rice and corn grains for human consumption, and now she also sells animal feeds.

Melissa recalls that her dreams of being the boss of her own business have come true. She said that this has been made possible because of the assistance of the cooperative that she nurtured for a long time. She continuously provides her immediate market with their needs. She asks for a loan of PHP 14,900 to restock her store with grocery items, confectioneries, condiments and other items.

loans.use: to restock her store with grocery items, confectioneries, condiments and other items.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 48 years old and has seven children of adult age. She has hog-raising business that gives her more income for the family. Rosalinda plans to add piglets on her farm. She approached Paglaum MPC to buy more piglets for fattening. She wants to take advantage of the high demand of pigs for butchering. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to sustain her business and would love to open an eatery.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Teodita

texts.en: Teodita is making a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She is 67 years old and married with four adult-aged children. She never gets tired of tending her store. Teodita's passion is selling, and she earns a meager income from it that is sufficient to support her needs. Teodita is a full-fledged member of PMPC and applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories and sales. Teodita continues to look for better business opportunities, which is proof that she is determined to pursue her goals.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn is a CCT* member, aged 37, from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jayson, an electrician, and they have three children. One of the children is in high school and the other two are still in elementary school. Her husband's salary could not fully cover their living expenses, which led Lalyn to open a small general store. They may not have luxuries in life but they are happy to have been blessed with three obedient and loving children.

She has been operating her store for nine years already. Her charming personality attracts more people to buy at her store. Her earnings have greatly helped cover their daily sustenance. She sells dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. All products are essential food items. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She values her store as it is a great help in sending her children to school.

Lalyn has been attending CCT's weekly fellowship with co-members sharing stories of their work and hearing God's Word, which gives them strength and inspiration to do their best in life.

To help her expand her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to refill her store with items like rice, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda, toiletries, etc. She prays that you will consider her request as it will improve her income and help her to meet the growing needs of her family. She is thanking God for Kiva's noble work to assist entrepreneurs like her.

Lalyn's precious dream is to see all of her children become professionals someday.

*CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: annatto, eucalyptus leaves, cinnamon, etc., in order to continue with his spice business and give a better quality of life to his family.

loans.name: Neftali Antonio

texts.es: Neftalí tiene 55 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa quien es una persona reconocida en la comunidad como alguien luchador y de gran prestigio por colaborar para la comunidad. El presta sus servicios en la alcaldía desde hace 3 años, y además cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de granos básicos ya que se ha dado cuenta que quiere incrementar más su fuente de ingresos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, frijoles para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida por medio de su negocio de venta de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Neftalí is 55 years old. He lives in a home he owns with his wife, who is a prestigious person in the community, well known as a fighter and a collaborator for the community.

For 3 years he has worked for the city. He also runs a small business selling basic staples, as he realized he wanted to increase his source of income. For that reason he seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in corn and beans in order to be able to improve his quality of life through his business selling basic staples.

loans.use: to invest in corn and beans in order to improve his quality of life through his business.

loans.name: Mary Renheart

texts.en:
Mary Renheart, 24 years old, is a member of CCT's Gen. Trias Branch. She is happily married to Rodelio, an electrician with whom she has two children. The eldest is still at the preparatory level and the other one is not of school age yet. Having been blessed with two lovable babies and a responsible husband, she was inspired to find ways to help her husband make a living.

Her direct selling of beauty, skin, and cleaning agents, underwear and other personal products of popular brands has earned her not only friends but extra money for her family's daily personal needs. To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to meet the increasing orders of face and body lotion, whitening products, shampoo, and other household cleaning agents. Your assistance will be a great help to sustain her business.

Mary Renheart's precious dream is to see her children go to college. She prays for her business to flourish. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital,and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty and skin products, cleaning agents and other toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, aged 53, is a widow and a new partner of CCT's* Gen. Trias Branch in Cavite. Being a widow has been her biggest challenge in life but with her faith and perseverance, she came out of it victorious. She is thankful that she was able to raise her children all by herself. Her boarding house rentals helped fund their everyday needs.

With the opening of classes, Myrna needs to add more doors to her boarding house to accommodate more people and serve the demand for bed space from students around their area. In view of this, she hopes she can receive a loan of PHP 10,000 loan to pay for the construction materials of her boarding house. She trusts you will have a positive response to to help her finish building her boarding house. This will give her additional income which will allow her to save money to open a "Tapsihan" (food stand that serves grilled cured beef with fried rice and fried egg.)

Myrna dreams of starting a food stand business called "Tapsihan" to save up for her old age. She prays for abundance in all aspects of her life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for construction material to add another door for her boarding house for rent.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is 58 years old with four children from the community of Kananga, Leyte. His children are ages nine to eighteen. Jose farms rice and sugar cane for a living. But with the needs of his four children, he would like to venture into another business, as he is hoping to increase his income. He is asking for a loan to buy pork, chicken and skewers so he can start a barbecue business. In the future, he plans to expand his business so he can better provide for his children in their schooling and family daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken and skewers.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. Yolanda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase new fish nets and materials for boat repair.

Yolanda has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new fish nets and materials for boat repair

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora María de 44 años edad, es soltera tiene casa propia y vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo se dedica a su negocio de venta de golosinas desde hace 02 años y medio sus clientes son las personas de la comunidad y personas vecinas y también los jóvenes que todas las tardes salen a jugar futbol al campo.
Doña María es una mujer trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña, azúcar,  aceite, carnes, etc. para seguir elaborando sus golosinas y satisfacer la demanda su clientes.
Uno de sus sueños es surtir más su negocio y un día mejorar mas su vivienda.                  

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del  2015
texts.en:
María is 44 years old. She is single and lives in her own home in a village in San Lorenzo. For two and a half years she has made a living selling snacks. Her customers are people from the community and neighbors, as well as youngsters who go to play soccer in the fields every afternoon.

María is a hardworking woman with a great will to succeed. She is seeking a loan to buy corn, firewood, sugar, oil, meats, etc., in order to continue making her snacks and meet the demand of her customers. One of her dreams is to stock her business better, and one day to improve her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2015

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, sugar, oil, meats, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en: Direct selling is the chosen business venture of Michel from Dipolog City. She is 39 years old and married with two school-aged kids. From her desire to help her husband in providing for the needs of her family, she signed up for membership from Paglaum MPC, which empowers women to engage in business. Recently she requested a loan to buy more stock like toothpaste, toilet cleaner, fragrances, detergent powder, fabric conditioner and others for her direct-selling business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like toothpaste, toilet cleaner, fragrances, detergent powder, fabric conditioner and others for her direct-selling business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is 52 years old and is known in Tudela, Misamis Occidental for her delicious and palatable food. She delivers her food products for snacks at different school canteens and operates her snack inn just outside her house. She has expanded and increased her production due to high orders from her local customers. In order to meet the demands, she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 14,900 to purchase ingredients for snack vending like flour, milk, sugar, butter, cheese and others. Alicia believes having enough inventories of the raw materials will help ensure that her daily operation is not hampered.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for snack vending like flour, milk, sugar, butter, cheese and others

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en: Vitaliana is 74 years old and a widow from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is a snack vendor and also makes native salabat (powdered ginger) as her primary source of income. She is also an active member of Paglaum MPC. She managed her accounts well and has no records of default payments. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase peanuts for retail and ginger for salabat (powdered ginger) making.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts for retail and ginger for salabat (powdered ginger) making

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en: Liberty engaged herself in the direct-selling business because it gives her big income of up to 25% of the mark-up price. She ventured into this business with her initial capital that she obtained from Paglaum MPC where she is an active member. She successfully got back her investment with astonishing profit that she rolled up to have more stock for retail. Recently, she asked for additional capital to purchase more stock for her direct-selling business such as toothpaste, detergent soap, toilet cleaner, fragrances and others.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her direct-selling business such as toothpaste, detergent soap, toilet cleaner, fragrances and others.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda has been in the retail vegetable business for 25 years. This gives her PHP 9,000 net income per month. Through this business, she was able to send all her children to school until they graduated college and landed a good job. Luzminda recalls that everything has been made possible with the aid of Paglaum MPC as her financial partner, knowing it is not always a smooth road in business. This time, she asks for a loan to buy bulk vegetables for retail.

loans.use: to buy bulk vegetables for retail.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a businesswoman in Dipolog City who engages in tuba (native wine) making. She's doing well in her business and is making good sales from it. She hopes to finish the completion of her house for her family. She asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC to buy construction materials such as sand, gravel, cement and iron bars to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, gravel, cement and iron bars to finish her house.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 60 years old and a widow with two adult-aged children from Dipolog City. She has been in the hog-raising business for 15 years in a row. She is supported financially by Paglaum MPC in her existing business ventures. Recently she requested a loan to purchase bags of feeds to grow hogs.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds to grow hogs.

loans.name: Gil

texts.en: Gil is a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC who actively participates in any activities of the cooperative. He is a member in good standing without records of default payments and has maintained this for nine years. He is in the farming business and primarily grows rice. He is primarily financed by the cooperative. Recently he requested a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel, de 49 años de edad, es agricultor, está acompañado, estudio hasta tercer grado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen dos hijos que van a la escuela.

Ángel, es agricultor y tiene vacas, desde temprana edad se dedicó a la agricultura y la ganadería.

Ángel, necesita el dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas y para la ganadería.

Ángel, desea darles el estudio adecuado a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángel is a 49 year old farmer. He studied until 10th grade. He has been in a relationship and his partner is dedicated to the household responsibilities. They have 2 children who attend school.

Ángel is a farmer and has cows. From an early age he has been engaged in agriculture and livestock.

Ángel needs the money to purchase agricultural supplies and for livestock.

Ángel wants to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and livestock.

loans.name: Siempre Arriba Group

texts.es:
Rosario del Pilar, tiene 49 años de edad, tiene dos hijos jóvenes quienes son el motor de su vida.
Rosario del Pilar forma parte del grupo "Siempre Arriba", éste grupo está formado por siete socios, todos ellos pequeños comerciantes.
Desde hace unos años, ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida en un puesto ubicado en un mercado de mucha concurrencia. Todos los días desde muy temprano hace sus compras y se dedica a la preparación de los alimentos que ofrecerá a sus clientes del mercado en el almuerzo. Pero su trabajo no termina ahí, porque en la tarde atiene en su domicilio ofreciendo lonches, sanguches y comida rápida, prepara también queques para ofrecer.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos e ingredientes al por mayor para que le resulte mas rentable y pueda obtener un poco mas de ganancia y ganar tiempo al día para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Rosario del Pilar is 49 years old. She has two young children who are the driving force of her life.

Rosario del Pilar is part of the group “Siempre Arriba.” This group is made up of seven members, all of them small business owners.

For some years, she has made a living from the preparation and sale of food in a stand located in a market with a large attendance. Every day, very early, she makes her purchases and prepares the food that she will offer to her market customers at lunch. However, her work does not end there, because in the afternoons she works in her home offering lunches, sandwiches, and fast food. She also prepares cakes to offer.

She will invest the loan received in the purchase of supplies and ingredients wholesale so that her business becomes more profitable so she is able to obtain a little more profit, and gain more time in the day to prepare her food.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of supplies for selling food.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is an active member of Paglaum MPC, from whom he requests additional capital for his fish-selling business. He has a good payment record. Previously he requested a loan that he successfully paid, and this time he is requesting another loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more stock of fish for his fish-selling business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish for his fish-selling business.

loans.name: Jasie

texts.en: Jasie is 31 years old and married from Helen, Larena, Siquijor. She runs a business buying palay grains and selling them as rice grains. She's making good sales from this business and is grateful that she helps to provide for her family's needs. Jasie hopes to own a parcel of land that she could cultivate and grow high-value crops as additional income for the family. Recently, she requested a loan to be used for additional payments for a parcel of land.

loans.use: to make additional payments for a parcel of land.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina has mastered the hog-raising business and has expanded her market. She is 51 years old and married with adult-aged children from Cantaroc, Maria, Siquijor. She is supported by Paglaum MPC in the finances of her existing business. She is also given the opportunity to participate in various trainings and seminars with regards to her hog-raising business. Recently, she requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional piglets and purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 54 years old and a widow with adult-aged children. He is a responsible and hardworking father that provided for the needs of his children until they finished college. He runs and operates a motor transport business that is his primary source of income. He is also an active member of Paglaum MPC and manages his account with no records of default payments. Now that his children have graduated and have their own jobs, he wants to finish the construction of his house, so he is asking for a loan from the cooperative. The amount will be used to buy sand, gravel, and bags of cement, and to pay for the labor cost to finish his house.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, and bags of cement, and to pay for the labor cost to finish his house.

loans.name: Gorrion Dorado Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde se ubica el grupo Gorrión Dorado es muy pacífica y sus habitantes sobresalen por ser muy trabajadores. Los hombres salen desde muy temprana hora para preparar la tierra pues es temporada de siembra de maíz el cual es la base de su alimentación. 
   Leticia es una mujer trabajadora quien siempre está de muy buen humor, mismo que contagia a todos los demás miembros del grupo. La mayor motivación en su vida son sus hijas, quienes estudian la educación primaria. Lety, como es mejor conocida, está muy orgullosa de sus pequeñas ya que siempre al terminar sus cursos reciben el primer lugar en aprovechamiento. 
   Desde hace nueve años, cuando decidió formar una familia, comenzó su actividad de cría de aves de corral. El proceso hasta que llegan a su desarrollo ideal puede durar hasta cinco meses, mientras tanto hace uso de los huevos. Los animales además de servir para la venta también le sirven para uso personal con el que elaboran distintos platillos. Desgraciadamente debido a los cambios bruscos de temperatura las aves se enfermaban y Lety resultaba perjudicada en sus ganancias; por lo anterior decidió comenzar a criar pavos. "Por eso mismo he decidido cambiar de pollos a pavos pues éstos son más resistentes y no enferman tanto" comentó. Sin embargo mantiene la cría de pollos debido a los huevos que le proporcionan para la alimentación de su familia.
   Por otro lado, se encuentra muy agradecida con el préstamo ofrecido porque de esta forma es sencillo adquirir los animales que necesite. También es una manera efectiva de aportar ingresos a su hogar y complementarlos con los de su esposo sobretodo en la educación de sus hijas. Una de sus metas es incrementar su producción y crear varios corrales para separarlos de acuerdo a su tamaño; Lety está confiada de que posteriormente podrá criar otro tipo de animal.
   Los integrantes del grupo Gorrión Dorado son Teófila y Laura quienes invertirán en su tienda de abarrotes y Rigoberto e Irma, en borregos. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco del municipio, Lety es quien viste el chaleco rojo.
texts.en:
The community where the Gorrión Dorado group is located is very peaceful, and its inhabitants stand out as being very hardworking. The men leave very early in the morning to prepare the land as it is corn planting season, which is the mainstay of their nutrition.

Leticia is a very hardworking woman who is always in a good mood, which she spreads to all the other members of the group. The primary motivator in her life is her daughters, who are in elementary school. Lety, as she is better known, is very proud of her young ones, as at the end of the semester they always receive first place in academic progress.

Nine years ago, when she decided to start a family, she began raising barnyard fowl. The process can take up to five months to reach ideal development of the birds. In the meantime, she uses the eggs. The animals are used not only for sales but also for personal use, in different prepared dishes.

Unfortunately, due to abrupt changes in temperature, the birds got sick, and Lety's income suffered. Therefore, she decided to begin raising turkeys. "For that reason, I decided to switch from chickens to turkeys, as they are more resilient and don't get sick as often," she said. Nevertheless, she maintains a chicken brood for the eggs it provides for her family's nutrition.

Separately, she is very thankful for the loan offered because it will make it easy to acquire the animals she needs. It is also an effective way to contribute to the income of her home and complement the income of her spouse, especially for the education of her daughters.

One of her goals is to increase her production and make various corrals to separate the animals according to size. Lety is confident that in the future she will be able to raise another type of animal.

The members of the Gorrión Dorado group are Teófila and Laura who will invest in their grocery store, and Rigoberto and Irma, who will invest in sheep.

*The photograph was taken on the stairs of the municipal kiosk. Lety is dressed in a red vest.

loans.use: to buy small turkeys.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is single and lives in Cangomantong, Lazi. She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the coop. She's requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of rice to sell at retail in the local community. Ester hopes to continue her business and to be able to save enough money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a variety of rice to sell at retail in the local community.

loans.name: Cyclin

texts.en: Cyclin has been in the hog-raising business for a long time and it gives her sufficient income for the family. She is 45 years old and a widow from Tacdong, Siquijor. She had requested loans from Paglaum MPC and had successfully paid without records of delayed payments. Recently she asked for a loan to buy additional piglets and bags of animal feeds.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and bags of animal feeds.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane hopes to live comfortably in a fully-furnished home that she started to construct from the profits of her hog-raising business. She is from Cantaroc, Maria, Siquijor, and is 38 years old and married with school-aged kids. She is supported by Paglaum MPC in all of her financial needs and has successfully paid without default. To finish the construction of her house, she asks for a loan from the cooperative to purchase sticks, bags of cement, and paint.

loans.use: to purchase sticks, bags of cement, and paint to finish her house.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma has mastered her retailing business that has existed for 15 years. This business sufficiently provides for the needs of her family. Recently, she requested a loan from PMPC to restock her store with canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, detergent soaps, bath soap, shampoo and other items.

loans.use: to restock her store with canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, detergent soaps, bath soap, shampoo and other items.

loans.name: Chita

texts.en: Chita is 31 years old, married, and lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor. She is supported by her husband working abroad. She is on her way to constructing their dream house. She is also a member of Paglaum MPC, which provides her the needed amount to construct their house. Recently, she requested another loan to purchase housing materials such as sand, gravel, and bags of cement.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials such as sand, gravel, and bags of cement.

loans.name: Rene Amilcar

texts.es: René tiene 54 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar que lo conforman cuatro personas, él es un hombre muy luchador y muy reconocido por toda la comunidad él cuenta con una mini tienda desde hace 2 años donde vende productos básicos el cual tiene mucha demanda por sus clientes que adquieren sus productos el cual necesita surtir más su tienda para generar más ganancias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: huevos, aceite, salsitas, leche, café, sopas, detergentes, jabón, pan, embutidos etc. para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
René is 54 years old. He lives in his own home with his family group of four people. He is a very hardworking man and very well known throughout the community.

He has a small store where for 2 years he has sold basic staples. There is much demand from his customers who buy his products, which is why he needs to stock his store better, to generate more income. For that reason he seeks a credit from FUSAI to invest in eggs, oil, salsa, milk, coffee, soups, detergents, soap, bread, cold cuts, etc., in order to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to invest in eggs, oil, salsas, milk, coffee, soups, detergents, soap, bread, cold cuts, etc., to continue growing his business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a hardworking woman from the municipality of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with three children aged 13, 16 and 17. She has been farming rice for many years to help her husband, who is a carpenter. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer such as two sacks of Atlas 14-14-14, one sack of urea, and pesticides. Julieta hopes that her business income will give her enough return so she can support and send her children to college.

Some of her profit will be used to buy a healthy diet for her family, reinvestment in the same business, and savings.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of Atlas 14-14-14, one sack of urea, and pesticides

loans.name: Inda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Inda works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Inda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Inda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene works hard to support her family. Irene is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Irene has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Irene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell for her business buying and selling dried coconut meat.

Gerlie has been in this business for eight years. Gerlie earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making dried fish in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish for her business making dried fish.

Valentina has been in this business for five years. Valentina earns more income from fish vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Chrisna

texts.en: Chrisna is 43 years old and lives together with her husband and 3 daughters. She sells food in the canteen of a banana company, while her husband is a fieldworker with the same company. She and her husband plant rice for extra income. Together, they have taken loans from Seva MFI to finance their rice cultivation, and they have always repaid those loans on time. Chrisna wants to have one of her daughters married and needs a loan of SRD 5000 to pay for the wedding expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the wedding expenses of her daughter

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is from the town of Kananga, Leyte. She is 38 years old and has two children, aged 16 and 18.

Emma provides for them by selling snack foods such as rice cakes and pancakes. She plans to have another business and will start selling fresh fish as well.

She is asking for a loan to buy fresh fish, a weighing scale and plastic bags (cellophane) so that she can start this business. Emma is optimistic and excited of what the loan can do for her planned business expansion. Her income will be for food, tuition fees and reinvestments in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, a weighing scale and plastic bags (cellophanes).

loans.name: Vecetacion

texts.en: Vecetacion is 53 years old. She is from the town of Kananga, Leyte. She is married and has two children who are still dependents, aged 15 and 18. Vecetacion usually cooks snacks for a living. She would like to expand her business to include food during meal time such as noodles, fried fish, meat stew and sautéed vegetables. Vecetacion is asking for a loan to buy meat, vegetables and spices. Vecetacion will utilize her income for the school fees of her children and healthy meals for her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe, 51, is a member of CCT's Gen. Trias Branch. She is married to Joselito, a businessman with whom she has three children - the eldest of which is already working, the middle is in College, and the other one is still the elementary Level.

Just like most mothers, she has found ways to help her husband make a living. She got involved in a food and a direct selling business to send her children to good schools.

Aside from selling branded bras, she also makes peanut butter and "atsara" (Filipino pickled relish made from grated unripe papaya) which is often served as a side dish for grilled and fried foods.

To help her meet the increasing orders of bras, "atsara" and peanut butter, she is seeking a PHP 50,000 loan. She prays that you will consider her request and thanks CCT and Kiva their support.

Fe's dream is to grow her business so that she could afford to send her children to College. She also wishes to give them houses of their own. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for branded bras, ingredients to make "atsara" and peanut butter to sell.

loans.name: Rosabelyn

texts.en: Rosabelyn is 19 years old with a one-year-old son from Kananga, Leyte. She is engaged in buying and selling coconut wine, rice and soft drinks. She works hard so that she can provide for her son. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock of coconut wine, soft drinks and rice so she can increase her income. Rosabelyn hopes to expand her business in the future so she can better provide for the needs of her child and give him a better future through education.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks and coconut wine

loans.name: Ibei

texts.en:
Ibei is 35 years old and married with a 15-year-old daughter. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Ibei runs a general store in Kananga, Leyte. She requested a loan through CEVI to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, rice, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, bath soap detergent, seasoning and shampoo.

Ibei has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Ibei would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, rice, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, bath soap detergent, seasoning and shampoo

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en: Ritchel is a resident of Kananga, Leyte. She is 27 years old and married with three children aged four, six and eight. Ritchel has been engaged in a sari-sari (convenience) store business for eight years now.  She is asking for a loan to buy stocks of goods to sell such as detergent, bath soap, seasoning, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, soft drinks, rice and coconut wine. Her income will be utilized for family daily consumption and payment for tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy detergent, bath soap, seasoning, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, soft drinks, rice and coconut wine

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is 58 years old and married with four children.

Maxima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, biscuits, noodles, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Maxima has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Maxima aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, biscuits, noodles, cooking oil, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es: Juan tiene 38 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas de 13 años y 8 años de edad a las cuales las está sacando adelante en sus estudios porque quiere verlas que sean personas triunfadoras en la vida él cuenta con un pequeño negocio de un molino por el cual es su fuente de ingreso para mantener el sustento del hogar y buscando la manera de obtener más ingresos económicos quiere surtir más su tienda por el cual quiere tener mejores ingresos económicos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: aceite, leche, café, golosinas, huevos, sopas, pan, detergentes, jabón, consomé etc. para tener otra mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 38 years old. He lives in his own house, with his wife and two daughters, aged 13 and 8. He is helping them succeed in their studies because he wants to see them be winners in life. He has a small store with a mill which is the source of income to meet his family's needs.

In looking for a way to increase his income, he wants to stock his store better, in order to increase sales. For that reason he seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in oil, milk, coffee, snacks, eggs, soups, bread, detergents, soap, consumme, etc., in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in oil, milk, coffee, snacks, eggs, soups, bread, detergents, soap, consumme, etc., in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RETO AL FUTURO”.
La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de fabricación y venta de velas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia continua elaborando las velas para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de velas entre otros.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to a communal bank called “RETO AL FUTURO”.

Elizabeth continues to work in the making and sales of candles. For a long time she has been with her business, which is going well thanks to the determination she puts in each day. She is a responsible person, and continues to make candles for all the customers that make requests. In this manner she provides for her family.

She is requesting for a loan to buy candles among others.

She thanks and values the loan granted via this means, and at the same time she promises to meet the payment terms in the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy candles, among others

loans.name: Gennifer

texts.en: For 13 years, Gennifer has been engaged in a business growing flowering plants. She lives in Ormoc, Leyte with her husband and two children aged nine and eleven. Gennifer needs additional capital to grow her business. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides for the plants. Gennifer dreams of sending her children to school for their bright future. They are her inspiration to work hard. Her profit will be for their school fees and daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en: Virgilia is 47 years old from Ormoc, Leyte. She is married with one dependent who is 16 years old. Virgilia started a sari-sari store in the year 2000.  She sell chips, candies, noodles, biscuits and canned food. Virgilia would like to improve her inventory level and include buying items in bulk for a better profit. She is asking for a loan to buy items like detergent, shampoo, canned goods, bath soap, chips, candies and seasoning. She hopes that with the help of the loan she will be able to increase her income for her family. Her profit will be for her family's daily consumption and house renovation.

loans.use: to buy detergent, shampoo, canned goods, bath soap, chips, candies and seasoning.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 46 years old and has six children. Gloria is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Gloria is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gloria has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah works hard to support her family. Jonah has a live-in partner and has a rug-making business in the Philippines.

Jonah requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her business.

Jonah has been in this business for four years now.

Jonah would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Maria requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maria has been in this business for five years now.

Maria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Fe is 45 years old and has six children who are in school.

Maria Fe has a business selling silver jewelry in the Philippines. Maria Fe requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more silver jewelry to sell to her customers.

Maria Fe has been in this business for six years. In the future, Maria Fe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more silver jewelry to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Merylotis

texts.en:
Merylotis is 41 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Merylotis runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Merylotis has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, sanitary pads, noodles, cereals, coffee, etc.

In the future, Merylotis would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell for her fruit vending business.

Rosalia has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from raising pigs and farming vegetables.

Rosalia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 59 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are still in school.

Rosita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosita has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonel De Jesus

texts.es: Leonel tiene 45 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa y sus 6 hijos una varón y cinco niñas a los que han logrado sacar adelante. Leonel se dedica a la mecánica industrial el cual realiza puertas, balcones, etc., es así como obtiene sus ingresos económicos y buscando la manera de obtener más ganancias cuenta con una pequeña ferretería el cual necesita materiales para cumplir con la demanda de materiales que solicitan sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito FUSAI para invertir en: clavos, alambre, tornillos, desarmadores, para surtir su pequeña ferretería, para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Leonel is 45 years old. He lives in his own house together with his wife and his 6 children, one son and five daughters, for whom he has managed to provide. Leonel works in industrial mechanics, in which he mends doors, balconies, etc. This is how he obtains his economic income.

To find a way to get more earnings, he counts on a small hardware store, where he needs more materials to meet his customer's demands. For this he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: nails, wires, screws, and screwdrivers, to supply his hardware store and to obtain a better income.

loans.use: to invest in nails, wires, screws, screwdriver to supply his small hardware store and to obtain a better income.

loans.name: Kadipo

texts.en:
Kadipo is 38 years old. He is married, with 3 children, and has had a farming business for 6 years.

He will use this loan to purchase farm inputs and hopes this will help him expand his business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to help him expand his farming business.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 41 years old and married with three children. With all of her children currently in school, Teodora works very hard to provide for them.

Teodora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, beer, candies, snack foods, fabric conditioners, diapers, cereals, etc. to sell.

Teodora has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, beer, candies, snack foods, fabric conditioners, diapers, cereals, etc.

In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, beer, candies, snack foods, fabric conditioners, diapers, and cereals to sell.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 61 years old and married with one child.

Guillerma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Guillerma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Guillerma has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Guillerma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Cris is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mary Cris has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary Cris requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Mary Cris has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mary Cris would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 35 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Felipa works very hard to provide for them.

Felipa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, vinegar, cooking oil, coffee, etc. to sell.

Felipa has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, vinegar, cooking oil, coffee, etc.

In the future, Felipa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, vinegar, cooking oil, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 54 years old, married and has three children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Crisanta requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, seedlings and other farm supplies.

Crisanta has been farming vegetables for 35 years now, and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Crisanta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seedlings and other farm supplies

loans.name: Julie Mae

texts.en:
Julie Mae is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Julie Mae is 25 years old and has one child who is in school.

Julie Mae has a fishing business in the Philippines. Julie Mae requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for her fishing business.

Julie Mae has been in this business for 20 years. Julie Mae would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for her fishing business

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en:
Delilah is 45 years old and married with four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming fruit trees in the Philippines. Delilah requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

Delilah has been farming fruit trees for five years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 53 years old and married with five children, two of whom in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Thelma has been farming vegetables for 15 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 35 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Rosie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like snack foods, candies, canned goods, detergent soap, noodles, etc. to sell.

texts.en: Thoum is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Thoum and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter Thoum and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Thoum and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Thoum and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

Doña Ana es una mujer trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña y cal y de esta manera poder seguir preparando su producto, espera que esta inversión que realice a su negocio le permita poder salir adelante con su familia.
Su sueño es surtir más su negocio y un día mejorar mas su vivienda  

                
San Lorenzo, Honduras – Agosto del  2015
texts.en:
Ms. Ana is 38 years old, married, and has her own house in San Lorenzo in the South of Honduras. She has worked in her business for 3 years. Her customers are friends and people of the community who buy her delicious tortillas daily.

Ms. Ana is a hard-working woman with a lot of wishes to get ahead. She is requesting for the loan to buy maize, firewood, and lime, so that she can continue preparing her products. She hopes that this investment can allow her to get ahead with her family.

Her dream is to further supply her business and to one day improve her housing.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – August 2015

loans.use: to buy maize, firewood, and lime for her business
