texts.es: Irma de 45 años de edad que habita vivienda familiar en compañía de sus padres, hermanos y sus dos hijas de 10 y 17 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se gana la vida brindado sus servicios como vendedora en una empresa de calzado, es así como genera sus ingresos con los que ha llevado los insumos básicos a su hogar y ha sacado adelante a sus dos hijas. Irma desea realizar unas reparaciones en el techo de la vivienda ya que está en mal estado y en invierno el agua ingresa al interior, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, polines, tornillos, mano de obra, para realizar las reparaciones del techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Irma is 45 years old. She lives in the family home with her parents, siblings, and her two daughters, aged 10 and 17. She is a very hardworking woman who earns her living as a saleswoman in a shoe business. That is how she generates her income to cover the basic needs of her home and gets her two daughters ahead. Irma wants to make some repairs on the roof of her home because it is in poor condition and in the winter water comes in. That is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in sheeting, rods, screws, and labor to repair the roof on her home.

loans.use: to invest in sheeting, rods, screws, and labor to make repairs on the roof of her home.

loans.name: El Temporal Group

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer muy alegre, tiene una linda sonrisa que contagia a todo aquel que la conoce. Tiene ocho años de experiencia en la cría de cerdos y los ingresos están destinados solventar los gastos de su familia integrada por su esposo Oscar y cuatro hijos. Para asegurarse del óptimo crecimiento de los animales los adquiere desde muy pequeños para así cuidar su salud y alimentación. 
   La necesidad de comenzar su actividad surgió ya que los ingresos de su pareja no eran suficientes para solventar todos los gastos familiares, sobre todo en cuanto a la educación de sus hijos. Así, mientras Oscar trabaja en la Ciudad de México, Lidia cuida de los animales en su comunidad; “No recuerdo exactamente el número de ovejas con las que inicié pero seguro eran menos de cuatro” recuerda. 
   Al día de hoy cuenta con varios años ayudándose de los préstamos con VF México pues mientras los ejemplares adquieren su tamaño necesario, éstos le ayudan a comprar alimento y útiles para sus hijos. En esta ocasión solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar cuatro cerdos pequeños ya que sólo cuenta con tres. Afortunadamente  el clima de la región es agradable para los animales y casi nunca se enferman y si llegara a pasar, Lidia cuenta con los tratamientos necesarios para curar a las crías. Su mayor meta es poder aumentar su producción para que sus hijos puedan graduarse de una carrera profesional.
   Los demás integrantes son Irene, Rosa María y María Juana quienes invierten en ovejas; Martha, en elotes; Catalina, Celestina, Juan y Rosa, en animales de corral; Claudia, en vacas, Rosa Ma., en tortillas: Anayeli, en antojitos típicos; Reynaldo, en sombreros y Marisol, en pollos. Todos ellos viven en una comunidad muy tranquila donde aún conservan sus costumbres y tradiciones; el dos de febrero celebran el día de La Candelaria donde todos los habitantes de la comunidad son participes. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en donde se reúne el equipo, Lidia es quien viste la chamarra negra.
texts.en:
Lidia is a very happy woman. She has a beautiful smile that spreads to everyone she knows. She has 8 years experience raising pigs, the income from which goes to meet the expenses of her family, consisting of her husband Oscar and four children.

To ensure the optimal growth of her animals, she acquires them when they're very young, in order to care for their health and nutrition. The need to begin her business arose because the income of her spouse wasn't sufficient to meet the family expenses, above all for the education of their children. Accordingly, while Oscar works in Mexico City, Lidia cares for the animals in her community. "I don't remember exactly how many sheep I started with, but I'm sure it was less than four," she recalls. She has benefited from loans from VF México for many years. While the animals reach their appropriate size, the loans help her buy food and supplies for her children.

On this occasion, she seeks a new loan to buy four small pigs, since she only has three. Fortunately, the climate of the region is good for the animals, and they never get sick. If they were to fall sick, Lidia has the necessary treatments to cure them. Her primary goal is to be able to increase her production so that her children can obtain professional degrees.

The other members of the group are Irene, Rosa María and María Juana who invest in sheep; Martha who invests in corn on the cob; Catalina, Celestina, Juan and Rosa who invest in barnyard animals; Claudia who invests in cows; Rosa Ma. who invests in tortillas: Anayeli who invests in typical snacks; Reynaldo who invests in hats; and Marisol who invests in chickens. They all live in a very peaceful community where customs and traditions are still preserved. On February 2nd they celebrate the day of the Candelaria, in which all the inhabitants of the community are participants

*The photograph was taken where the group meets. Lidia is wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Inday Lecia

texts.en:
Inday Lecia is 46 years old and married with one child who is in school. Inday Lecia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like egg, noodles, canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

Inday Lecia has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like egg, noodles, canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 46 years old and married with four children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Edelyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Edelyn has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Jennefer

texts.en:
Jennefer is 39 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Jennefer works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Jennefer has been in this business for one year.

In the future Jennefer would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa works hard to support her family. Jesusa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline and wood.

Jesusa has been in this business for 21 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline and wood

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 51 years old and has four children. Helen is married and has two children who are still in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

Helen has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sherly is 55 years old and has five children who are presently in school.

Sherly has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Sherly requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell such as potatoes, onions, garlic, as well as spices.

Sherly has been in this business for 25 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell such as potatoes, onions, garlic, as well as spices.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru:
Прекрасная женщина Мастона. Ей 50 лет. Она из города Душанбе. Мастона образованная женщина. Она работает учительницей в университете. Мастона 10 своей жизни занимается любимой работой. Ей нравится преподавать и проводить больше времени студентами. Мастона замужем и мать двоих детей. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Старший сын женат, младший студент. Детям 30 и 18 лет. 
Мастона за сейчас решила взять кредит и купить приобрести бытовую технику (кондиционер зима-лето и пылесос) для дома. Она была вынуждена, обратится за кредитом, потому что с заработной платы она не могла приобрести необходимых средств. По этой причине Мастона обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас!
texts.en:
Meet Mastona, a lovely woman from the city of Dushanbe.  Mastona is 50 and well educated.  For the past ten years, she has been working as a university professor, and she loves her work!  She really enjoys teaching and spending time with her students.  Mastona is married and the mother of two children who are 30 and 18. Her husband is currently working in Russia.  Her oldest son is married, the youngest is still a student.  

Mastona has decided to take a loan to purchase some home appliances (an all-seasons air conditioning unit as well as a vacuum cleaner).  She had no choice but to request a loan because her salary does not allow her to save enough for these purchases.  For this reason, she is turning to you for a loan.  Please support her!

loans.use: to purchase appliances for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel and brick so he can build a second floor on his house.

loans.name: Kelli Jasmin

texts.es: Kelli de 28 años de edad habita en vivienda familiar junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 4 años de edad por el que trata de salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y fragancias desde hace 5 años y deseando mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos para la economia del hogar solicita un credito a FUSAI para invertir en: ropa para dama, caballeros y fragancias y de esta manera mejorar su forma de vida.
texts.en: Kelli, 28, lives her family's home with her life partner and their 4-year-old son trying to get ahead. She has sold clothing and fragrances for 5 years and wishes to improve her sales and increase her income to support her household economy. She applied for a loan from FUSAI to invest in clothing for women and men and fragrances to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in women's and men's clothing and fragrances to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Эту милую заботливую девушку зовут Манзура. Она уроженка района Темурмалик, замужняя и ей 24 года. Манзура с мужем занимаются разведением скота. Родители мужа также помогают им и дают полезные советы. Основным источником их дохода является продажа животных. Манзура с мужем решили расширить свой бизнес и купить еще несколько коров и телят. Но, к сожалению, для покупки этих животных в семье не хватает денежных средств. Манзура решила обратиться к Вам за кредитом и в душе очень надеется на положительный исход этого дела.
texts.en:
Meet Manzura, a kind and caring young woman from the Temurmalik district of Tajikistan.  She is 24 years old and married.  Manzura and her husband are cattle breeders.  Manzura's in-laws help them with the farm work and give them useful advice.  The main part of their income comes from selling cattle.

Manzura and her husband have decided to expand their business and to buy a few additional calves.  However, the family doesn't have enough money to buy these animals.  For this reason, Manzura has decided to turn to you for a loan.  With all her heart, she is hoping for a positive outcome!

loans.use: to purchase a few calves.

loans.name: Emelina Gladis

texts.es: Emelina de 54 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su hija, nieta y cuñado. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida vendiendo tortillas lo que le permite generar sus ingresos económicos con los que brinda los insumos básicos a su familia.  Emelina desea realizar reparaciones en el techo de su vivienda el cual está en mal estado y permite el ingreso del agua en época de invierno, es por eso que solicito un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina, tornillos, para la reparación del techo de su vivienda. Emelina con el crédito anterior logro construir el muro de retención en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Emelina is 54-years old. She lives in her own home with her daughter, her granddaughter and her son-in-law. Emelina is a hard-working woman who earns her living selling tortillas, which allows her to generate the income that supplies her family with the basics.
Emelina wants to repair her home's roof, as it is in bad condition and water gets in during the winter. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheet metal and bolts to repair her home's roof.
With the previous loan, Emelina was able to build a retaining wall for her home.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal and bolts to repair her home's roof.

loans.name: Angela Herlinda

texts.es:
La señora Ángela de 36 años de edad,  es  casada  tiene dos hijos  que depende de ella, se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería y también a la  venta de tortillas es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante. 
Doña Ángela esta solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de abarrotería como detergentes, jabón, frescos, jugos, churros, pollo, queso, frijoles, huevos, etc. espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su familia y poder tener más productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes.
Esta feliz de poder seguir trabajando con Prisma de Honduras, siendo este su tercer crédito, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2015.
texts.en:
Señora Ángela is 36-years old. She is married and has two dependent children. For twenty years, she has made her living sells groceries as well as tortillas. She is a hard-working woman who wants to get ahead.

Doña Ángela is requesting this loan so she can purchase groceries, such as detergents, soaps, sodas, juice, "churros," chicken, cheese, beans, eggs etc. She hopes that this investment will allow her and her family to get ahead and enable her to have more products to offer for sale to her customers.

Doña Ángela is happy to continue working with Prisma de Honduras, this being her third lending cycle. One of her dreams is to be able to make some improvements to her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August, 2015.

loans.use: to purchase detergents, soap, sodas, juice, "churros," chicken, cheese, beans, eggs etc. for her business.

loans.name: Grupo Cruz Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
Caracterizada por una gran sonrisa, Sandra es una joven que está dispuesta a cualquier cosa para que sus dos pequeños hijos puedan superarse a través de la educación. Junto con su esposo José Luis obtiene ingresos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades diarias de su hogar.
   Inició su trayectoria de vendedora dentro de su comunidad con productos para habitación. El negocio fue todo un éxito para ser la primera experiencia pues consiguió clientes que le solicitaban de manera segura. Sin embargo decidió incursionar en la renta de juegos inflables debido a que en su comunidad se realizan grandes festividades a las cuales acuden muchos niños. Por otro lado, también quería ayudar con los gastos de su hogar y por eso con la ayuda de su esposo pudo adquirir el primer juego. “Es un negocio muy práctico porque no necesita reinvertir a menudo y puedo trasladarlo a cualquier comunidad o municipio sin mayor problema” comentó Sandra. Cobra 10 pesos por quince minutos de manera individual, en cuanto a la renta por día su beneficio es mayor pues no tiene que cuidar el artefacto sólo se encarga de transportarlo. Actualmente planea comprar otro juego con ayuda del préstamo con VF México. Su meta es promocionar más su actividad dentro y fuera de su comunidad para obtener ganancias mejores.
    En su comunidad la fiesta más grande se lleva a cabo el 15 de Agosto, día de San Isidro: santo de la comunidad; por tres días celebran todos los habitantes se dan cita al centro municipal y realizan distintas actividades en familia. 
   Las otras integrantes del grupo son Alicia quien invertirá en pollos; Blanca Flor, en una estética y Ana Lura, en Perfumes y catálogos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco, Sandra es quien viste saco color verde.
texts.en:
REVISED

Known for her great smile, Sandra is a young woman who is willing to do anything for her two young children, who can improve their lives with an education. Together with her husband Jose Luis, she earns an income necessary to meet the daily needs of her home. She began her career selling home goods in her community. Her business was a success for a first venture and she was able to secure regular clients. However, she decided to venture into the business of inflatable playhouses because many festivities for children in her community include them.

On the other hand, she also wanted to help with household expenses so she was able to to acquire her first inflatable playhouse. "It is a very practical business because we don't really need to reinvest the profits and we can move into any town without issue," said Sandra. They charge 10 pesos per fifteen minutes of individual play. Day-long rentals are more to her benefit because she doesn't have to operate it, she only has to transport it.

She currently plans to buy another playhouse with the help of a loan from VisionFund Mexico. Her goal is to promote more activity inside and outside her community and earn better profits. In the largest community festival, which takes place on 15 August (the Holy Day of San Isidro), the entire community has celebrations for three days and carries out various family activities.

The other members of the group are Alicia, who will buy chickens; Blanca Flor, an esthetician; and Ana Lura, who sells perfumes from catalogs. *The photograph was taken on the steps of a kiosk. Sandra has a green sweater.

loans.use: to buy an inflatable playhouse

location.town: San Antonio La Cienega, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old, married and has four children, who are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jocelyn has been fattening pigs for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Unión Y Fuerza Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad cuyo origen se remonta a la cultura mazahua viven personas muy alegres y trabajadoras que conservan su lengua materna y algunas costumbres. El respeto entre los habitantes es notable, por ejemplo, cuando los señores se quitan el sombrero al saludar o cuando los niños pequeños besan la mano de sus padres, abuelos y padrinos. Gran parte de la población se dedica a la cría de animales pues la vegetación hace más sencilla la actividad.
   Doña Alicia es una persona alegre, junto con su pareja Ernesto quien trabaja en la construcción ha formado una familia con tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando. Desde hace ocho años abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que ha mantenido con gran éxito. La idea fue motivada por la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos de su hogar además de vivir cerca de la calle más transitada de su comunidad. Para tener el capital suficiente, Alicia comenzó a vender elotes cocinados y “esquites”: un entremés típico del país hecho con granos de maíz. De igual forma ahorró durante seis meses todas sus ganancias para comprar dulces y refrescos, así gradualmente sus ganancias fueron aumentando y pudo ser capaz de abrir la tienda de abarrotes. 
   Por otro lado, los préstamos con VF México le han permitido conservar su negocio pues con ellos compra pan, huevo, leche, azúcar, productos lácteos, detergentes, etc. Su mayor objetivo es ampliar su negocio para mejorar los ingresos familiares y, sobretodo, que sus hijos no trunquen sus estudios por falta de apoyo.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo muestran el mismo agradecimiento que Doña Alicia con VF México y KIVA pues siempre han confiado en ellos. Don Severiano, Irma y Don José Juan invertirán en la cría de ovejas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el campo donde Don Severiano cuida de sus animalitos. Alicia es quien carga en su espalda a un su bebé.
texts.en:
This is a community whose origins go back to the Mazahua culture. The people who live there are very happy and work hard. They have kept their native language and some customs. The respect the residents show is significant. For instance, the men take of their hats when greeting others, and the young children kiss their parents', grandparents' and god-parents' hands. A large part of the population makes their living raising animals, as the vegetation makes that work easy.

Doña Alicia is a happy person. Her husband, Ernesto, works in construction. Together they have formed a family of three children, two of whom go to school. Eight years ago, doña Alicia opened a small grocery. She has maintained it quite successfully. The idea to open the store came out of a need to help with the household expenses. Besides, she lives close to the busiest street in her community. To gain sufficient capital, doña Alicia started selling corn on the cob and “esquites” (a snack made from grains of corn that is common in their country). She saved all her earnings for six months so she could purchase sweets and sodas. Gradually, her earnings increased and she was able to open her grocery store.

On the other hand, the loans from VF México have allowed doña Alicia to maintain her business. She uses the loans to purchase bread, eggs, milk, sugar, dairy products, detergents etc. Doña Alicia's main objective is to expand her business and improve her family's income. Above all, she doesn't want her children to abandon their studies for a lack of support.

The other members for the communal bank show the same gratitude for VF México and KIVA as as doña Alicia; they have always trusted in them. Don Severiano, Irma and Don José Juan will invest in raising sheep.

*The above photograph was taken in the field where don Severiano raises his small animals. Alicia is the one carrying a baby on her back.

loans.use: to purchase bread, eggs, milk, sugar, dairy products, detergents etc.

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Johanna

texts.en:
Johanna is 33 years old and married with four children, who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

Johanna has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Jebelyn

texts.en:
Jebelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jebelyn is 30 years old and has three children, who are still in school.

Jebelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jebelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Jebelyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Los Ideales Group

texts.es:
Berta, tiene 47 años de edad, tiene dos hijos jóvenes y una niña menor de edad. Ella es socia del grupo "Los Ideales" que está formado por ocho socias. 
Berta se dedica a prestar servicio de reparación de prendas de vestir y a la elaboración de ropa. Desde muy joven tiene ésta habilidad la cual ha sabido aprovecharla para poder obtener un ingreso económico extra y así apoyar en el pago de los gastos familiares.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de hilos, cierres, cintas y otros materiales para realizar su trabajo y parte del préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser.
texts.en:
Berta is 47 years old. She has two young sons and one young daughter. She is a member of the group "Los Ideales" which consists of 8 members.

Berta makes a living providing repair services to garments of clothing and manufacturing of clothing. From a young age she has had this ability which she has taken advantage of to obtain extra income and thus help pay for the household expenses.

The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of thread, zippers, tapes, and other materials to do her work and part of the loan will be invested in the maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of materials for making and repairing clothing.

loans.name: Mirzomad

texts.ru: Мирзомад молодой отец из района Фархор. Фархор не большой район с малым населением. Основная работа в этой местности является сельскохозяйственные деятельности. Мирзомад отец пятерых детей. Он занимается животноводством. Мирзомад в свое время не смог получить высшее образование и хочет, чтобы его дети смогли получить хорошие знания и быть образованными. Его сын Парвиз хочет учиться в Университете, получить высшее образование, стать успешным человеком и помочь своей семье. Мирзомад вкладывает большую надежду в сына и надеется, что он станет хорошим специалистом и найдет работу. Мирзомад обращается за кредитом для оплаты обучения сына. Вы можете поддержать Мирзомада и его сына, и внесете свой вклад в будущее Парвиза.
texts.en: Mirzomad is a young father of five from Farkhor, a small and sparsely populated district of Tajikistan.  Most people there are involved in agriculture.  Mirzomad himself raises livestock.  Mirzomad never had the chance to get a higher education and he would like his children to learn more than he did and become well-educated.   Mirzomad's son, Parviz, wants to attend university and get a higher education.  He wants to become successful and help his family.  Mirzomad places all his hopes in his son, and his dream is to see him graduate one day and get a good job.  Mirzomad is taking a loan to pay for his son's tuition.  Please support him and his son and invest in Parviz's future!

loans.use: to pay for his son's university tuition.

loans.name: Ayubjon

texts.ru: Аюбчон жизнерадостный парень, у которого большие планы на будущее. Ему 24 года он женат и живет вместе с семьёй в городе Курган-Тюбе. По образованию Аюбчон экономист. Однако жизнь сложилась, так что он стал таксистом. Взяв в аренду автомобиль, он потихоньку обзавелся постоянной клиентурой. Весь город он знает очень хорошо и может без труда довезти пассажира до места его назначения. Однако машину ему пришлось вернуть, так как закончился срок аренды. Аюбчон обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить себе собственную машину. Он верит, что Вы поддержите его, и он сможет обеспечить семью всем необходимым.
texts.en: Ayubjon is a young man with a positive attitude in life and many dreams for the future!  He is 24 years old, married, and lives with his family in the city of Qurgan-Tube.  Ayubjon is an economist by training.  However, due to life's circumstances, he became a taxi driver.  He started by renting a car, and over a period of time he was able to develop a regular customer-base.  He knows his city very well and he has no problem taking his customers to their destinations.  However, he has had to give his car back because the leasing contract had expired.  Ayubjon is taking a loan to buy his own car.  He is confident that he will receive your support, which will help him to fully support his family.

loans.use: to purchase his own car and start his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in auto parts like spark plugs, brake shoes, and belts, and to provide better service to her auto repair customers.

loans.name: Benancio Esteban

texts.es:
El señor Benancio de 54 años de edad,  no tiene hijos  que depende de él, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de la venta de granos como maíz, tiene varios clientes que le compran la cosecha y también el compra para reventa, además quiere invertir en su pulpería donde vende abarrotería en general.
Don Benancio tiene casa propia y desea en este año tener el apoyo de Prisma para cosechar mas maíz y también invertir en su negocio de pulpería en la compra de frijoles, huevos, queso, azúcar, etc. el anteriormente no tenía la pulpería pero ahora sí y está muy contento porque está saliendo delante.
Uno de sus sueños es poder realizarle unas mejoras a su vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2015.
texts.en:
Benancio is 54 years old. He has no dependent children. For a number of years he has been selling
grains such as corn. He has some customers who buy his harvest, and he also buys for resale. In addition, he would like to invest in his small store, where he sells general groceries.

Don Benancio has his own home. This year he hopes to have the support of Prisma to harvest more corn and also to invest in his grocery business by buying beans, eggs, cheese, sugar, etc. He did not have a grocery store before, but now he does, and he's very glad to be getting ahead.

One of his dreams is to be able to make some improvements on his home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August, 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, eggs, cheese, sugar, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is forty years old and married with three children. For the past ten years she has fattened and sold pigs to earn a living in the Philippines. She also has a sari-sari, or small general store.

Evangeline is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs. She is working tirelessly to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is 56 years old, married and has six children. For the past twenty years she has run her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income through her tailoring business.

Lucille has borrowed and successfully repaid five previous loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries to stock her shop such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap and snack foods. She is working diligently to build up her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock her shop

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy new fishing net.

Ligaya has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing net

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca de 57 años de edad habita en vivienda propia con sus dos hijos de 21 y 17 años de edad. Ella ha logrado salir adelante con sus dos hijos como madre soltera dedicandose a mantener un pequeño chalet desde hace 12 años. Francisca desea mejorar y surtir mas su negocio, por lo que solicita un credito a FUSAI para invertir en: bebidas, golosinas, galletas, fruta, etc. y de esa manera ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Francisca is 57-year-old. She is living in her own home with her two children who are 21 and 17 years old. She has managed to get ahead as a single mother with her two children by making a living maintaining a small chalet for 12 years. Francisca wishes to improve her business and to increase her supply. Thus, she requests a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in drinks, candy, cookies, fruit, etc. and thereby offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to invest in drinks, candy, cookies, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Diosela

texts.en:
Diosela is 67 years old, married and has three children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Diosela requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Diosela has been in this business for 30 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 46 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

Lorna has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María una mujer emprendedora y con deseos de superación de 62 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia en compañía de sus hijos. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas en su vivienda para mantener la economía de su hogar. Ella desea incrementar sus ganancias por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, queso, chicharrón, frijoles, loroco, etc. y ofrecer mayor variedad de especialidades a sus clientes.
texts.en: María is an entrepreneurial woman eager to overcome her 62 years of age. She lives in her own home with her children. She makes a living preparing and selling her own pupusas in her home in order to support the household economy. She wishes to increase her earnings; therefore she requests a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in corn, cheese, sausages, beans, edible loroco flowers, etc. and to offer a greater variety of specialties to her customers.

loans.use: to invest in corn, cheese, sausages, beans, edible loroco flowers, etc.

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es: María tiene 66 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad es una mujer muy emprendedora que siempre ha logrado salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que se presentan. María se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante desde hace 3 años en el cantón y a sus alrededores, además buscando la manera de obtener más ingresos económicos confecciona cortinas y las vende gracias a este negocio es como ella se gana el pan de cada día, ella necesita comprar mas mercadería para seguir creciendo en su negocio y así obtener más ganancias. María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camisas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos ropa interior, trajes para niños y niñas y tela para cortinas ya que así mejorara su condición de vida.
texts.en:
María is 66 years old. She lives in her own home. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who always has managed to get ahead despite the difficulties that arise.

María has made a living selling clothing on the street for the past 3 years in the canton and its surroundings. Also, she is looking for ways of obtaining greater income from manufacturing and selling curtains. Thanks to these businesses, she earns her daily bread. She needs to purchase more merchandise in order to continue growing her business and in order to obtain greater profits.

María requests a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in shirts, skirts, pants, undergarments, children's outfits, and fabric for curtains so that she will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in shirts, skirts, pants, undergarments, children's outfits, and fabric for curtains.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 58 years old, married, and has six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Ma. Elena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for one year. In the future, Ma. Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena works hard to support her family. Magdalena is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, rice, sugar, vegetables, meat, etc.

She has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Magdalena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, rice, sugar, vegetables, meat, etc

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eliza is 28 years old and has one child still in school.

Eliza has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell at her stall.

Eliza has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 49 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are still in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Josie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap, and snack foods.

Josie has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap, and snack foods.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Margie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Margie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase a new bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a new bundle of fishing net.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 49 years old and married with three children; one child still in school. Celerina works very hard to provide for them.

Celerina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap, and other snack foods.

She has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap, and other snack foods.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 50 years old and married with four children. One of her children is still in school. Elsa works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap, and snack foods.

Elsa has been in this business for five years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap, and snack foods.

loans.name: Marive

texts.en:
Marive is 38 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marive runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Marive would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Kristel

texts.en:
Ma. Kristel is 29 years old, single with one child.

Ma. Kristel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap, and snack foods.

Ma. Kristel has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fishing.

Ma. Kristel aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap, and snack foods.

loans.name: Roquelyn

texts.en:
Roquelyn is 47 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap, and snack foods.

Roquelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap, and snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

loans.name: Rowelita

texts.en:
Rowelita is 60 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rowelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap, and snack foods.

She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Rowelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap, and snack foods.

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es:
Las Poderosas es el nombre de un grupo ubicado en una comunidad mexiquense muy pintoresca. Sus habitantes son celebres por su dedicación al trabajo en el campo además de a la cría de animales de corral; muchas familias han conservado estas actividades durante varias generaciones. 
   Doña Fernanda una mujer de un carácter amigable y un espíritu emprendedor, todos en su comunidad conocen que siempre busca nuevas oportunidades para ayudar a los que quiere. Su familia está integrada por su esposo Alejandro y tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian enfermería y uno más la educación secundaria. 
   Siempre ha pensado que cuando se planea formar una familia se deben compartir las obligaciones y por eso decidió abrir una tienda de frutas, verduras y tortillas. Tiene diez años a cargo de su negocio y todas las ganancias están encaminadas a proveer de lo necesario para que sus hijos se gradúen de su escuela. “Por algunos años mi negocio funcionó muy bien sin embargo ahora la competencia que hay en la comunidad es grande. Pero yo sé que con esfuerzo puedo lograr mis objetivos” comentó Fernanda. Precisamente el mayor objetivo que tiene es que sus hijos se realicen profesionalmente.
La reinversión del local la realiza con los préstamos otorgados por VFMéxico, normalmente compra leche, huevo, pan, latas, detergentes, etc.
Las demás integrantes de Las Poderosas son Mireya quien invierte en zapatos; Laura, en zapatos y productos de belleza y Adriana, sólo en productos de belleza.
*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Doña Mireya, Fernanda es quien viste pantalón color rosa.
texts.en:
Las Poderosas (The Powerful Ones) is the name of a group located in a picturesque Mexican community. Its inhabitants are celebrated for their dedication to their fieldwork, as well as raising livestock. Many families have conserved these activities throughout many generations.

Doña Fernanda is a woman with a friendly character and an entrepreneurial spirit. Everyone in her community knows that she always seeks out new opportunities to help those she loves. Her family is made up of her husband, Alejandro, and three children, two of whom study nursing, and one of whom attends secondary school.

She has always thought that, when one plans to start a family, they must share the responsibilities. For this reason, she decided to open a store that sells fruit, vegetables, and tortillas. She has been running her business for ten years, and all of her earnings are channeled into providing what is necessary so her children can graduate from school. "For some years, my business has functioned very well; however, now, there is a lot of competition in the community. But I know that, with effort, I can reach my goals," says Fernanda. Specifically, the most important goal she has is that her children succeed professionally.

She will reinvest locally with the loan from VFMéxico. Normally, she buys milk, eggs, bread, canned goods, detergent, etc. The other members of Las Poderosas are Mireya, who works with shoes; Laura, who works with shoes and beauty products; and Adriana, who only works with beauty products.

*The photograph was taken at Doña Mireya's house. Fernanda is the one with the pink pants.

loans.use: to purchase milk, bread, eggs, and refreshments.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lourdes is 59 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Lourdes has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Lourdes has been in this business for two years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of dried fish business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of dried fish to sell.

Nida has been in this business for seven years. Nida earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ingrid Xiomara

texts.es:
Ingrid, de 35 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta séptimo grado, no continuó estudiando debido a que sus padres no tenían los suficientes recursos económicos para mandarla a la escuela, está casada, tiene 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela cercana de su comunidad y su esposo es empleado.

Ingrid, siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora; desde que formó su hogar decidió poner un pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas y desde entonces se levanta muy temprano a cocer el maíz, luego lo lava, lo lleva al molino y a las 7:00 de la mañana empieza a hacer tortillas para vender, esa actividad la finaliza a las 10:00 de la mañana, luego a las 3:00 de la tarde empieza otra vez y termina su jornada a las 5:30 p.m.

Ingird, necesita el préstamo para comprar 6 sacos de maíz, para tenerlos almacenados porque debido a la sequía que sufrio el país, el maíz está caro y eso le afecta en sus ganancias.

El anhelo de Ingrid, es reparar el techo en donde tiene el negocio, porque ya está deteriorado; también sueña con ver a sus hijos preparados académicamente.
texts.en: Ingrid is a 35 year old housewife who left school after the seventh grade as her parents did not have enough money to continue sending her there. She is married with 2 children who both attend the local, community school. Her husband is currently in employment. Ingrid has always been a hard-working woman and, not long after her marriage, she established her own tortilla business. She rises early each morning to cook the maize, then she washes it and grinds it. By 7am she begins to make and sell her tortillas, finishing at 10am, then at 3pm she starts over and her working day ends at 5.30pm. Ingrid is applying for this loan so that she can buy 6 sacks of maize to keep in storage as the country is currently suffering a drought. The cost of maize is therefore high and this is impacting on her earnings. Ingrid's greatest wish is to repair the roof above her business premises as it is already in a poor state and she also wishes to see her children do well at school.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa, de 44 años de edad, es comerciante, estudió hasta séptimo grado, no continuó sus estudios por ser de recursos económicos muy bajos; se acompañó y tuvo una hija, pero lastimosamente su compañero de vida falleció hace varios años y ella sola a tenido que sacar adelante a su hija. 

Rosa, tiene una tienda que la fundó junto a su compañero de vida hace muchos años, en donde vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta básica, también se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado y todo esto se lo administra su hermano.

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdos y animales de corral, para generar más ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su casa.

El sueño de Rosa, es mejorar su vivienda y su negocio, al mismo tiempo ayudar a su hija en todo lo que sea posible.
texts.en: Forty four year old Rosa is a businesswoman who left school after the 7th grade as her family did not have sufficient money to continue sending her there. She got married and gave birth to a daughter but, unfortunately, her husband passed away a few years ago and she was left to raise their child alone. Rosa runs a shop, which her and her husband set up many years ago, selling essential groceries and she also works as a farmer, raising livestock, and her brother helps her with this business. Rosa is applying for this loan so that she can buy pigs and other livestock in order to increase her income to cover her household expenses. Rosa's dreams for the future are to be able to improve her home and her business as well as helping her daughter in whatever way she can.

loans.use: to buy pigs and other livestock.

loans.name: José Ándres

texts.es:
José, de 37 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casado, tiene 2 hijas que aún están pequeñas y asisten a la escuela a quinto y tercer grado, su esposa se dedica a cuidar las niñas y a realizar  los oficios del hogar, así mismo le ayuda a José en la agricultura.

José, nació en una familia muy humilde y de bajos recursos económicos, debido a eso tuvo que dejar de estudiar y ayudar a su padres, por esa razón conoce muy bien el trabajo de la agricultura, mediante el cual genera ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia; el cultivo que siembra es maíz y el terreno donde siembra está a medio kilómetro de su vivienda aproximadamente y camina 30 minutos para llegar a sus cultivos, también se dedica a la ganadería.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar 2 novillos para engordarlos y cuando llegue el tiempo de vencimiento del préstamo, venderlos a buen precio para cancelar a tiempo y de la ganancia comprar lo necesario para sacar adelante a su familia.

El sueño de José, es ayudar a sus hijas en el estudio para que obtengan un título universitario y esto les ayude para conseguir un empleo digno y tengan mejor calidad de vida en el futuro.
texts.en: Jose is a 37 year old farmer who attended school up to the 6th grade. He is a married father to 2 young daughters who attend 5th and 3rd grade classes at school. His wife cares for their children and runs their home as well as helping Jose with his farming. Jose was born into a humble and poor family and, consequently, he had to leave school early to help his parents. Owing to his upbringing, he is now a skilled farmer and he uses this knowledge to increase his income so that he can provide for his family. He grows maize on a plot of land situated approximately half a kilometre - a half hour's walk - from his home, and he also raises livestock. He is applying for this loan so that he can buy 2 calves for fattening up and once his loan is due to expire, he plans to sell them for a good price so that he can repay his loan on time. He will use the income from these sales to buy whatever family provisions are needed. Jose dreams of being able to help his daughters by paying for their studies so that they can go to university and get a degree, which will help them to find a good job and provide themselves with a better standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves to fatten up.

loans.name: Vololonirina

texts.fr:
Vololonirina est une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et ils ont trois enfants  dont deux encore à leurs charges et l'ainé déjà marié. 
Elle dirige un magasin général depuis 2011. Auparavant, elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche, et la fermeture de celle-ci l'entrainait à chercher d'autre activité à effectuer. Donc, elle a démarré un petit magasin général avec l'appui de son mari qui est employé salarié et son économie.
Le magasin a encore besoin d'être développé et amélioré, c'est pourquoi, elle demande de financement pour le renforcement de son fonds de roulement.
texts.en: Vololonirina is a hardworking, resourceful woman who is 50 years old. She is married and has three children, two of whom are still in their parents' care, while the eldest is already married. Vololonirina has been managing a general store since 2011. Before that she worked in a company in the tax-free zone, but when this company closed she had to find another activity. She thus set up a small general store with the help of her husband, who is employed, and her savings. The shop still needs to be built up and improved and it is for this reason she is requesting a loan, so she can boost her working capital.

loans.use: to buy different types of general merchandise.

loans.name: Randrianasolo

texts.fr:
Randrianasolo est un brave père de famille de 32 ans. C'est un campagnard qui livrait du lait en ville pendant très longtemps. Avant 2011, il vivait dans la campagne avec sa femme et ses quatre enfants.Il était totalement dans le secteur agricole.
Mais en faisant le va et vient en livrant et vendant le lait entier, l'idée d'ouvrir un stand d'alimentation en ville fleurait en lui d'où le démarrage d'un stand de "kafe sy mofo" (café et beignets malagasy). L'élevage à la campagne continue toujours pour que le revenu augmente. La famille vit donc actuellement en ville et loue la maison ainsi que le lieu d'activité.
Le désir de Randrianasolo est de développer et étendre son activité, afin d'améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille, construire un jour une maison en ville.
texts.en: Randrianasolo is a courageous father, who is 32 years old. He is a peasant and for a long time delivered milk in the town. Prior to 2011 he lived in the countryside with his wife and four children and his life revolved totally around the farming sector. But while coming and going, as he delivered and sold full-fat milk, he had the idea of setting up a food stall in the town and consequently set up a "kafe sy mofo" (coffee and Madagascan fritters) stall. He continues to work in the countryside as well, in order to increase his income. The family currently lives in the town and rents its house and the place where he works. Randrianasolo would like to build up and expand his business so he can improve his family's quality of life and one day be able to build a house in the town.

loans.use: to buy flour, table oils, coffee grains, concentrated milk and full-fat milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, dried vegetables, flour, and several containers of table oil.

loans.name: Marlon José

texts.es:
Marlon, de 34 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta bachillerato, sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos, por esa razón no inició en la universidad, cuando cumplió su mayoría de edad se acompañó con una joven con la que ahora tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, su compañera de vida se dedica a cuidar al niño y a realizar los oficios del hogar, asimismo apoya y ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura.

Marlon, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, este trabajo lo aprendió con sus padres y ahora trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante a su familia; pero en el trabajo de la agricultura se dió cuenta que no le generaba los ingresos necesarios, es por eso que decidió dedicarse también a la albañilería, es muy reconocido en su comunidad y esto le ha ayudado a generar ingresos mediante su fuerza de trabajo.

Marlon, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como: semilla, abono, pesticidas para plaga y también preparará la tierra y pagar mano de obra.

El anhelo de Marlon, es tener un buen cultivo para venderlo a buen precio.
texts.en:
Marlon, 34, is a farmer and finished secondary education.
Due to his parent's poor financial situation, he never went to university.
He started a life together with his common-law wife at the age of eighteen. They now have a six-year-old son.
His wife takes care of their son and the household, while also helping out with the farm.
Marlon has been a farmer for a very long time; it is a trade he learned from his parents, at which he now works very hard to support his family.
However, farming alone is not enough.
Thus, he became a bricklayer, and has garnered quite the professional repute within his community. This helps him earn more money thanks to his work.
Marlon needs the loan to buy farm supplies, such as seeds, manure, and pesticides. He will use part of the funds to till the land and hire farm hands as well.
Marlon hopes for a plentiful harvest that he can sell at a good price.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and hire farm hands.

loans.name: Julia Estebana

texts.es:
Julia, de 38 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta cuarto grado, no continuó estudiando debido a que sus padres no tenían los suficientes recursos económicos para mandarla a la escuela, está acompañada, tiene 4 hijos, el primero ya formó su hogar y vive cerca de su casa, los otros tres están solteros y dos de ellos asisten a la escuela, porque el último está pequeño, el compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura y ella también le ayuda en este trabajo.

Julia, por la gran necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos ha tenido que trabajar arduamente en la agricultura, siembra maíz y también chile, en tiempos de cosecha se levanta muy temprano para ir al campo y ayudar a su compañero en este trabajo, al igual que sus hijos; actualmente siembra maíz y el terreno donde tiene la cosecha está cerca de su vivienda.- Desde hace 5 años también decidió poner una tienda en donde vnede golosinas, dulces, enchiladas, yuca frita, pasteles, entre otros; y le ha ayudado mucho debido que les vende a los vecinos y genera ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.

Julia, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como semilla, abono, pesticidas para plaga, preparará la tierra y pagar mano de obra.

El anhelo de Julia, es reparar su vivienda, porque el techo esta deteriorado y gotea en tiempos de lluvia, también desea darles el estudio universitario a sus hijos, para que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Julia is 38 years old and is a stay at home mom. She studied through fourth grade but didn't continue studying because her parents did not have sufficient income in order to send her to school. She has a life partner and four children. The oldest has already begun a family and lives close to Julia's house. The other three are single and two of them attend school, because the youngest is still too little. Her life partner works in agriculture and she also helps with this work.

Julia, out of the great need to help her children get ahead, has had to work very hard in agriculture, planting corn and chiles. Around harvest time she gets up very early to go to the field and help her partner in this work, along with her children. Currently they are planting corn and the land where they have the harvest is close to their home. Five years ago Julia decided to start a store where she sells sweets, candies, enchiladas, fried yucca, desserts, and other items. It has helped her a lot since she sells them to neighbors and this generates income for the well-being of her family.

Julia needs a loan in order to buy agricultural products such as seed, fertilizer and pesticides for insects. She will prepare the land and pay for manual labor.

Julia's dream is to repair her home, because the roof is deteriorated and leaks during the rainy season. She also wants to give her children the opportunity for a University education, so that they can have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products such as seed, fertilizer and pesticides for insects. She will prepare the land and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Keidy Joselin

texts.es:
La joven  Keidy Joselin de 21 años de edad, vive con sus padres  en casa de ellos,  se dedica desde hace 2  años al negocio de venta de ropa  usada y calzado,  vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle  al sur de Honduras,  es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Keidy está solicitando el préstamo para compra de ropa clasificada como pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de  seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Agosto del 2015.
texts.en:
Keidy Joselin is a young 21 year old. She lives with her parents in their house. She has worked for 2 years in a business selling used clothing and shoes. She lives in the city of San Lorenzo Valle in the south of Honduras. She is an entrepreneurial women with desires to get ahead and fight every day to improve her quality of life.

Keidy is asking for a loan to buy clothing classified as pants, shirts, underwear, boxers, tights, t-shirts, dresses, skirts, etc. With the help of this loan, she aims to improve her income and quality of life. She is a subsequent customer with hopes of continuing to work with Prisma. Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele, as well as improving her future with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2015.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear, boxers, tights, t-shirts, dresses, skirts, etc., for her business.

loans.name: German Maurico

texts.es:
German, de 26 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta séptimo grado de educación básica, está acompañado, tiene 2 hijos que aún están pequeños y no asisten a la escuela, su pareja se dedica a cuidar las niñas y a realizar los oficios del hogar.

German, debido a la necesidad de darle un mejor futuro a su familia, ha tenido que trabajar arduamente, desde que tenía 18 años ha trabajado en la agricultura y en la ganadería, gracias a su padre aprendió muy bien este trabajo y ahora siembra maíz y frijol y cuando ya está la cosecha vende la mayoría y siempre deja  una parte para consumo; pero además de eso también tiene una vaca y un ternerito y gracias a ello tienen leche y queso también para el consumo familiar.

German, necesita el préstamo para comprar una novilla de repasto e insumos agrícolas como semilla de maíz, abono, pesticidas para la plaga y también preparará la tierra.

El sueño de German, es obtener buenas ganancias en sus cosechas para generar ingresos y darle lo necesario a su familia, asi mismo darle estudio a sus hijos para que tengan mejor calidad de vida en el futuro.
texts.en:
German is 26 years old, is a farmer, and studied through seventh grade. He has a life partner and they have two children who are still small and don't yet attend school. His partner works taking care of the children and working in the home.

German, due to the necessity of giving his family a better future, has had to work hard. From the time he was 18 he has worked in agriculture and livestock. Thanks to his father he learned how to do this job very well and now he plants corn and beans and when the harvest comes in he sells the majority and leaves a part for consumption. Besides this he also has a cow and a calf and thanks to that they have milk and cheese for family consumption.

German needs a loan in order to buy a grazing heifer and agricultural products like corn seed, fertilizer, pesticides for insects and also to pay to prepare the land.

German's dream is to obtain good income from his harvests and generate earnings and give what is necessary to his family. He would also like to provide an education to his children so that they can have a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to buy a grazing heifer and agricultural products like corn seed, fertilizer, pesticides for insects and also to pay to prepare the land.

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
El nombre del grupo Amistad fue inspirado por la confianza, cariño, respeto y  apoyo incondicional que se tienen todos sus miembros. Ellos son personas muy alegres, accesibles, pero ante todo muy trabajadoras quienes viven en una comunidad muy tradicional. Dicha localidad se caracteriza tanto por la elaboración de ollas de barro utilizadas en la elaboración de piñatas como en la compra y venta de materia industrial. Con una sonrisa en el rostro los integrantes del grupo comentaron, “en el mes de noviembre y diciembre somos “piñateros” y el resto del año somos chatarreros”.
   Don Víctor es una persona muy amable, es soltero vive en compañía de sus padres. Desde hace 20 años se ha dedicado a la elaboración de macetas y ollas de barro, éstas últimas utilizadas en la elaboración de piñatas. “Desde pequeño yo veía como mi padre elaboraba los productos y  gracias a su paciencia y amor aprendí muy bien el arte de alfarero” comentó contento. Para la elaboración de ollas y cazuelas debe secar la tierra, después moler y batir hasta que se convierta en lodo; al día siguiente debe trabajar en moldes donde son secados y por la tarde las mete en el horno para que tengan resistencia. Al ser las piñatas objetos muy tradicionales para cualquier fiesta, prácticamente todo el año recibe solicitudes para comprarle más.
   Con el préstamo podrá comprar más tierra ya que es el material principal y sin duda el más solicitado. Cabe mencionar que se encuentra muy contento porque se acercan fechas muy rentables sobre todo en cuanto a las piñatas pues en época navideña todo el municipio compra dos o más piezas.
  Las demás integrantes del grupo son Ma. Guadalupe quien invertirá en su estética; Brenda, en una tienda de abarrotes; María Guadalupe R., en zapatos; Aurora y Socorro, en desperdicio industrial y Leticia, en su alfarería.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de Guadalupe quien muestra algunos pares de zapatos.
texts.en:
The name of the group "Amistad" was inspired by the confidence, care, respect, and unconditional support that all of its members have. They are very happy and approachable people, but more than anything they are very hard-working. They live in a very traditional community. This area is characterized as much for making clay pots used for making piñatas, as in buying and selling industrial material. With a smile on their faces, the members of the group say, "In the months of November and December we are 'piñateros' and the rest of the year we are scrap merchants."

Víctor is a very friendly person. He is single and lives with his parents. For 20 years, he has worked making clay pots and pans. The clay pots are used to make piñatas. "From the time I was young, I saw my father making the products, and thanks to his patience and love, I learned the art of pottery very well," he says happily.

To make the pots and pans, he has to dry dirt, then grind and mix it until it becomes mud. The next day, he must work with molds where the mud dries and in the afternoon he puts them into the oven to give them resistance. Being that the piñatas are very traditional objects for any party, practically all year-round he receives requests to buy more.

With the loan, he will be able to buy more dirt since it is the main material, and without a doubt the most requested. It is noteworthy that he is very happy because very profitable dates are coming up, especially regarding the piñatas because at Christmas time the entire town buys two or more.

The other members in the group are Guadalupe, who will invest in aesthetics; Brenda, who has a grocery store; María Guadalupe R., who will buy shoes; Aurora and Socorro, will invest in industrial waste; and Leticia, will invest in her pottery.

*The picture was taken at Guadalupe's house. She is showing some pairs of shoes.

loans.use: to buy dirt.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweeds culture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Rosalie is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional plastic rope and wood for her seaweeds culture business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastic rope and wood.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: Don José es un microempresario emprendedor de 54 años de edad, casado y  propietario de una pulpera, la cual con ayuda de su esposa ha mantenido  durante doce años, siendo esta una fortaleza debido a que  su negocio se encuentra bien posicionado en la comunidad, lo que ha traído como resultado ampliar la cartera de clientes. Él solicita por primera vez el financiamiento de la institución, para la compra de granos básicos, aceite, embutidos y papel higiénico, una de sus metas es vender gaseosas de diferentes marcas al por mayor.
texts.en: José is an enterprising small business owner who is 54 years old, married and the owner of a grocery store which, with help from his wife, he has maintained for 12 years. This is a strength for them because their business is well positioned in the community which has brought, as a result, a growing portfolio of clients. He is seeking financing for the first time from the institution to purchase basic grains, oil, meat and toilet paper. One of his goals is to sell different brands of sodas via wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, oil, meat and toilet paper.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Nilda has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from seaweed culture.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 34 years old and married. With one child in school, Nimfa works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. Nimfa has been in this business for 1 year.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

In the future Nimfa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. Nora is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nora has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of fish to sell.

In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rona Marie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Rona Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweeds culture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.

Rona Marie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seaweeds seedlings, plastic rope, etc. for her seaweeds culture business.

Rona Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweeds seedlings, plastic rope, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and rice bran for her pig fattening business.

Rowena has been in this business for 3 years. Rowena earns more income from fishing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and rice bran.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah works hard to support her family. Sarah is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Sarah requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new bundle of fishing nets.

Sarah has been in this business for 7 years now. And she makes additional income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Sarah would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new bundle of fishing nets.

loans.name: Adony

texts.es:
Adony, de 44 años de edad, es jornalero, no tiene ningún grado académico, debido a la gran pobreza en que vivia junto a sus padres; está acompañado, tiene 3 hijos que aún son menores de edad y su compañera de vida es ama de casa. 

Adony, ha sufrido mucho debido a la pobreza en que siempre ha vivido, es por ello que se ha dedicado a trabajar arduamente para sacar adelante a su familia, actualmente trabaja de jornalero y también de agricultor, cada año siembra maíz para vender y también para consumo familiar, así mismo se ha dedicado a la ganadería, tiene dos vacas y dos terneros que aprovecha para producir leche, queso, cuajada, requezon y para no desperdiciar el suero tiene 2 cerdos que son quienes se toman el para engordarse y venderlos a buen precio.
 
Adony, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas lecheras, para generar más ingresos en sus ventas.

El sueño de Adony, es tener una casa propia y darle estudio a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien y con oportunidades de empleo para que no sufran tanto como le ha pasado a él.
texts.en:
Adony is 44 years old. He is a day laborer and did not go to school due to the poverty that he and his parents lived in. He is married and has 3 young children and his wife is a housewife.

Adony has suffered a lot due to the poverty his family has lived in. So, he has dedicated himself to working hard to support his family. He currently works as a day laborer and also a farmer. Each year he grows corn to sell and also to eat. He has also worked in livestock. He has two cows and two calves that he uses to produce milk, cheese, curd, fresh cheese and, in order to not waste the milk, he has two pigs who drink it to fatten up and he can sell them at a good price.

Adony needs the loan to buy two dairy cows, in order to get more income on his sales. Adony's dream is to have his own home and give his children an education so they become good people with job opportunities and they won't suffer so much like he did.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Manila

texts.en:
Manila is 53 years old and widowed with seven children. With two of them still in school, Manila works very hard to provide for them.

Manila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap and other snacks foods.

Manila has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Manila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap and other snack foods.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 34 years old, married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Melba has borrowed and paid back 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from retailing rice and charcoal.

Melba aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Rosario Del Socorro
